name: Michelle Owens
text: If you're thinking of ordering pizza at the Domino's Pizza in Priceville, AL, you're better off ordering from somewhere else. My first encounter with them, I placed an online order 30 minutes before closing, & was told they couldn't complete my order, even though it showed online that they could. On top of that, I was STILL charged for my order...that I never received! Yeah...I'm not even joking. I received a phone call telling me they already closed off orders or something, but that my card had been charged. I was like..."Whaaattt??!!" How can I be charged for food I never received?? I mentioned that they didn't close until midnight, & he said that was correct, but because they don't "normally" get orders that late, they had already closed off orders or whatever he said. I guess he's never heard of people that work second shift?? So, now I'm out $22.00 & no food! Beware!

text: I had been ordering food for delivery for quite some time. The one time I had a complaint because my pizza was delivered cold, I had the most horrible experience. I remained calm and asked if they would redo my order that I would be more than happy to bring the cold food back. Only one slice had been bitten because it was not hot. He said no, they would not redo my order. I tried to talk to him reasonably but he simply said we can come get it and just not charge you. At this point, I had gotten mad. Just getting off work and being hungry doesn’t mix. Thankfully for him, I held my composure and merely hung up. They never have to worry about me nor any family members giving them any of our business again. Besides, the pizza isn’t good enough for their prices!!

If you could send us an email with your contact information to Dominos5816@5-StarPizza.com so we can look further into this, please. Thank you for your time and have a great day!

name: Jason Sharitt
text:
Used the app to place an order at 6:44 Saturday evening from a house party. Socialized with friends for a while and saw two missed calls a few minutes later at 6:53. No voicemails but I figured it had to be Domino’s so I called back. Waited for 10 minutes and no one picked up. App said pizza was being delivered. Called back at 7:26 to see where food was. Finally got someone on the phone. The gentleman said he tried calling twice to tell me there were no delivery drivers available. But he could’ve left a voicemail for that! Why did I have to try and call him back for that information? At this point we’re all hungry and now the guests are upset.

So a few things here:
1. The app shouldn’t show my food is being delivered when it hasn’t even been made.
2. I shouldn’t have been able to order delivery if the location doesn’t offer it.
3. The employee should have left a voicemail with the information and not wasted my time trying to call back for it.

So be careful using this location. The communication is very poor. Call ahead of time to see if they can deliver. Don’t use the app.

EDIT: Bumping up a star since the manager called me to explain the situation and obviously wants to make things right. I may give this location another try since it seems I caught them in a perfect storm of "things going wrong", and being a former restaurant worker myself, I can sympathize.

My order was flagged for review since it was associated to an address that has been linked to multiple phone numbers. This is a national Domino's corporate policy to keep tabs on potential sketchy orders.

Domino's corporate always expects their franchisees to have delivery drivers, and never anticipates a scenario where a given store has no delivery drivers show up for work. So don't expect the app design to improve, and I can't fault this location for that.

Domino's typically doesn't leave voicemails as they prefer to talk about potential order problems in person, and in my case, try to present an offer for me to pick up the pizza myself. Even so, we'll agree to disagree as the voicemail could have said "We have no delivery drivers for tonight. Please call us back by X time if you still want the order and can arrange to have it picked up."

resp.text: Our team appreciates your review and feedback. We apologize for not earning a 5-star review from you and want you to know we will be working hard to earn your 5-star review from you. Thank you and have a great day, Jason!

name: Roxy Steinberg

If you don't have delivery drivers, don't offer delivery! And answer the phone so someone can at least come for pickup instead.

resp.text: We would like to apologize for your recent experience with us and will look into your concerns. Y'all still need to work on the phone service.

text: The worst Domino’s I’ve ever experienced. I’ve given them multiple tries to get things right. One time I waited hours to get an order, and when I called they told me they didn’t have a delivery driver, so they had to cancel the order. BUT NEVER CONTACTED ME. Another time I waited over 2 hours for my order when they said it would be 30-45 minutes. This last experience was the final straw. Placed an order on the 4th of July and never received it, but I was charged. When I called to inquire about the charge a couple days later the store manager was EXTREMELY RUDE, and then told me he couldn’t do anything and I should probably just call my bank and say it was a fraudulent charge. I’m so done with this location.

resp.text: Our team would appreciate the opportunity to talk with you in order to gather some more details and get this issue addressed immediately. name: Kindall Bishop
text:
I had the same experience as many others. I ordered a pizza last night and it was canceled due to no delivery driver. They called from a personal cell phone to tell me this instead of the Dominos’ number, which resulted in me not answering since it was an Iowa number. That much was understandable since I know people are having a hard time finding workers. After I called to check on my pizza, she said I needed to place my order again online since she couldn’t apply my coupon over the phone. She told me they now had a driver, and it would be delivered. I order my pizza again and the tracker says it has been delivered. 30 minutes later- still no pizza. I was left on hold for 20 minutes or so and called back several times with no answer. I love dominos, but I hate to say I won’t be ordering from this store anymore. Save your money!!

Edit: Updating from 1 to 3 stars because the very kind manager, Samantha, called and apologized for the mix up and refunded me for my order!

resp.text: Our team appreciates your review and feedback. We apologize for not earning a 5-star review from you and want you to know we will be working hard to earn your 5-star review from you. Thank you and have a great day, Kindall!

text: I just placed an order at Domino’s for the first time in a very long time. I ordered a 3 topping large pizza with specialty chicken. Well, I called back to the store and spoke to a guy, who assured me that we’d get our pizza and a 2-liter for the inconvenience. We received the right pizza after about 45 mins, but no drink. By the time my husband got to the door, the driver was getting in his car. I get it’s “contactless delivery” but sheesh! Called back to the store and Michelle just basically laughed it off as and said was a mixup. Never ever ordering from here again if I can help it!!!

I finally went up to the counter to ask...they grabbed our boxed up order from the top of the refrigerator and told me that they'd called our name and no one came up. We were 8ft from the counter; we would've heard them. The pizza's are flat, oily, soggy, and the toppings are SPARSE. For our large pepperoni we had one piece of pepperoni PER SLICE. The margherita pizza was just some diced tomatoes with Italian seasoning on it. My Fiance got sick shortly after. A complete waste of money and time.

name: Andrew Bass
text: Worst customer service I have ever received. Employees repeatedly left the restaurant walked around the parking lot laughed and ate food. We walked in after 30 minutes and asked if our pizza was done and the employee was very rude and just said NO! I'm very dissatisfied with this. They need to train their employees or get new ones. Oh and they gave us the wrong order. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and cheese sticks, they gave us tomato and spinach cheese pizza with two calzones. We did not return it for fear of retaliation and they would spit on our pizza. We are never visiting this location again.

name: Wayne Riddlebaugh
text: There is no dine in here, and had to wait longer than expected for the food.  Then they carried no diet beverages, except for water.  My Papadia was nothing special.

name: Kaila Morris
text: If I could give you a zero, I would. I ordered my pizza at 4:15. I did not receive my order until 5:45, BUT did not receive my sides. When I opened the pizza, it was not stuffed crust, BUT IT WAS FREEZING COLD. Worst pizzeria ever.

name: J Mana
text:
This is tough. The pizza is fresh and good, but the thing that turned it bad for me is the employees walking around the food prep area and going in and out of the walk-in while eating, no gloves on, and of course masks down. I say this while giving the employees the benefit of the doubt that either corporate or the owner of this PaPa Johns does provide a place for their employees to eat or take a break, and they deserve a place to do both. It could also be lack of training that you shouldn’t be eating while preparing food, without gloves or washing their hands.
I hope y’all rectify this, it’s a new clean place, the pizza is good, but you have to fix the food handling

name: David H
text: 10 minutes away from the store, 3.5 miles is outside of the delivery range. I have ordered from other stores all over the country and gotten pizza delivered to me further. I haven't eaten from this location and never will now.

name: Lauren Maray
text: As someone who’s worked for two different Papa John’s in different areas, moving back to brewton I was excited that they finally built one here.  But unfortunately this store needs some help.  Whoever is rolling dough an making pizza needs training something serious.  I’m eating more “ crust “ than I am the actual pizza / toppings.  I ordered from them for the second time I came in an was told my order was $40+ without an explanation why , granted she did apologize after I showed her the receipt for my actual total ( $17.59 ). But one of the pizzas I ordered the bbq chicken Hawaiian had little to NO sauce on it. Once again eating straight dough it tastes like.  Horrible job on cutting the pizza an making it.  Employees are sitting out in the parking lot chatting.  Some kinda working on the inside.  People coming from the back that don’t work there. I wish google would allow me to post the images of the pizza to give everyone an idea of what they’ll be getting unless something changes.

name: Gloria Roberson
text: The young ladies and gentlemen that work here at the Brewton branch are truly awesome and work super hard. You got a great crew here Papa John's!

name: Jared Boike
text: If you order delivery, be prepared for your order to never be right. They NEVER make your pizza correctly. I don't know what happened here, 7 months ago they were great. Now they are super slow on making orders. The pizzas are always subpar, crust is as flat as roadkill and literally shoe leather, and they don't even bother putting sauce on the dang thing let alone more than a finger full of condiments, even when you order double pepperoni, they put like 10 pieces on your pizza! They don't even update their order progress bar and therefore, you aren't able to rate your experience because they never update anything. They don't even text you when your pizza is on the way, and they never have tracking for your order. Pretty sad to be honest!

name: JoyAnn Perry
text: Terrible, this is the only pizza place that delivers to my house so I have given them several chances but unfortunately will have to go back to pickup elsewhere. They left out part of my order once, next time my order was over an hour late after the app said it arrived. Now I placed an order to receive a call back and say they were closed and wouldn't be making my order, they wouldn't transfer it to the other dominoes and informed me it would be a few days before I received a refund. Their "manager" Megan is extremely rude and was not concerned or apologetic about tr he situation at all. Note their website said nothing about closing early to check hours or anything, my order was placed, accepted and pd for. The employee said she cancelled my order but I have not received a confirmation on this or any money back!

name: Michael Roberts
text: Honestly me mad my wife hardly leaves review for anything but we have never had any worse service ever.  We’re. New young family with a baby so we do get pizza here and there but every time we have our order has been messed up.  They also don’t were gloves or hair nets while making the pizzas either.  So unsanitary.  We won’t be back until they can actually have a decent staff!

name: Michael Johnson
text:
UPDATE: After cancelling and asking for a refund, the delivery driver showed up anyway unaware. He was awesome and the best part about the whole experience.

Original:
Placed an order online, paid, and got a confirmation. FIFTY MINUTES later, we received a call from the manager letting us know that they do not deliver to our area. I informed her that the mailer we received 2 days ago had us in their delivery area (3 miles away). We are in the range ON THE MAP ON THE MAILER.

I asked for a refund

name: Alex Nelson
text: A friend recommended that I try this new pizza joint, Marco's store 8354, according to my receipt. I placed the order online for deliver and was told the pizza would arrive within the hour. An hour and a half later I call Marco's because my food had not arrived and was told the deliver driver was around the corner. Twenty minutes later I call Marco's again and talked to the manager who finally admitted that they had "lost" their driver. The manager offered a refund which, three months later I have not received. I understand that people make mistakes and would have written a much better review if the manager had kept his word. But hey, that's ok, there are plenty of other delicious pizza joints in Birmingham.

resp.text: Alex, we’re so sorry that we let you down. Please fill out a feedback form at www.marcosguestfeedback.com so we can have someone reach out to you directly and make things right.

name: Kurt Bensch
text:
Had a heck of a time with this one.  Tried to call and place an order for delivery two times.  Both times the person on the phone acted or flat out just couldn't understand when I began to say the address of where I was.  Apparently 18th is hard to understand and when I even included that we were staying at the Hilton,which is literally a few blocks away, there was still confusion.  So, we get in our car and drive there.  We tell the person behind the counter about our 2 phone calls and he laughingly shows us his phone which has a damaged cord.  Pretty sure this guy was a manager of some sorts too.  We tried to ordered a couple sandwiches and of course, they had no bread.

We ordered a thin crust pizza and some sodas.  We got back to the hotel and opened the box only to find the greasiest pizza I have ever seen.  The thin crust pizza was as flimsy as a paper towel.  The grease basically covered the entirety of the bottom of the box.  It was disgusting.  Thin crust pizza should never be that greasy or flimsy.  This was just a horrible experience all around.

resp.text: Kurt, please give us a chance to make it right and fill out a feedback form at www.marcosguestfeedback.com. This way, we can have someone in your area reach out.

name: Ambria Rush
text: Best pizza I've tasted in all my 28 yrs on earth .. Enjoyed the grand opening specials ..Drivers very friendly .. Had no complaint against the company until today 08/16/16.. When we ordered a salad  from Marcos ...and the driver called back and claimed he was lost and he couldn't find our residence .. ( which they have delivered to us many times before) .. They gave the driver the correct address and he repeated it  and replied I can't deliver it AND HUNG UP !! .. So upon calling the store to complain about the "CUSTOMER SERVICE"..  I was informed that because I lived in a "urban " dwelling.. ( south town projects ) we wouldn't be able to receive delivery .. However we could walk and spend our money with them.. I will NEVER spend my HARD EARNED money with them again . they advertised their business in our neighborhood and the entire neighborhood showed up and spent money at the grand opening. Now all of a sudden you can't deliver here. There is a diverse group of nationalities here and believe it or not everyone here doesn't rob and steal. You really don't deserve any stars at all.  ONE STAR

name: John Stott
text:
Worst pizza place I have ever bought from and I travel 4 days a week
The pizza place has complete bozo receptionists that can’t write down an address ...and the driver gets lost when the HOTEL IS A FEW BLOCKS AWAY...the pizza shows up completely destroyed...well over an hour...never called me ...it was cold and they did not replace the pizza. NEVER AGAIN OMG THEY ARE HORRIBLE

name: Steven Newsome
text: I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and sausage and it was delivered without sausage. I called and talked to Marcus, who had good customer service. I told him, "it's not a big deal, just wanted to let you guys know". He insisted on getting the manager on the phone. Skylar, the manager, asked me to send a picture, which I immediately sent. After putting me on hold and observing the picture he told me "you're lying, I did that pizza and I don't make those mistake. You picked the sausage off the pizza." He completely caught me off guard and I had to ask him if he was being serious. I thanked him and hung the phone up. Skylar clearly isn't a business manager and I definitely won't be ordering from this location again.

resp.text: Hi Steven. We’re sorry to hear about this situation. If you'd like to provide additional details about your experience, please fill out this form www.tellmarcos.com. Thank you!

text: Tried this place a few times and each time was bad.  Food was ok but no customer service.  Two employees were having an argument the first time we went.  The last experience, I tried to call in an order and after being on hold for over 5 minutes I was hung up on.  Tried to call back and went straight to being on hold.   Love Pizza Hut but not this one.

name: Logan Fisher
text: I was told the pizza would be ready by 6:45 PM, yet I was told it would be an extra fifteen minutes. I came back in at 7:00 PM waited ten minutes to be helped, then told it would be another ten minutes till the pizza arrived. It is currently now almost an hour since we told it would be ready and at 8:00 PM it would be two hours since we ordered. I would not and I mean absolutely would not recommend this place!

name: Ashley Holliday
text: Great service! A big shout out to Jennifer and the rest of the crew for being so fast, friendly and courteous. Vernon, Alabama has by far the best Pizza Hut we have ever eaten at. The toppings taste fresh and and the staff go above and beyond. Thanks again for another great supper!

We just got up and left and I called Winfield Pizza Hut and ordered. I will never be back again to Vernin Pizza Hut! It's like that every time I've ever been there. 😠

They didn't offer to make him another pizza or refund his money.....I usually LOVE this place, but after today, we won't be back to this location!

Wasn’t even offered a refund, and was treated like it was no big deal. Do not order here and give these lazy workers your service.

name: UR Obsolete
text: Have the oven hot enough to thoroughly cook the pizza.

name: Kendrick Curry
text: I was supposed to take a picture before I ate it... 😓 But it was perfect fresh out of the oven. 🤤... My review: I messed my order up, my online receipt said I messed  my order up... I was going to take the "not my favorite pizza" but the guy who was working offered to fix it. 🤯 Was not expecting that especially since it was my fault and I didn't make a big deal about it. He said he wanted me happy. 🤯 I always get good service and pizza from this location and always end happy. I don't know his name I'm assuming he's the manager as I always see him working late. The last time he helped me was a year ago, when we talked about their wings being fried, and we agreed that baked soggy wings are the worst. I was impressed he took the time out to talk to me and explain their products when he was busy. A year later he's still great and helped me tonight. I felt compelled to leave a review and tip better next time. I took this opportunity to point out to my wife that this was why I tip even if I'm just picking up pizza.

text: I accidently ordered the wrong type of crust online. I called the store and the young man was able to correct my mistake and the pizza was wonderful!!

text: Pizza was fresh and hot. Also, the Pizza was ready as promised

name: Krystal Phillips
text: When I place a delivery order it always take two hours if not longer. When it gets here the pizza is freezing like the driver has been driving around. This place is horrible. Dominos is the best!

name: Brannan Kramer
text: Unacceptable Experience: Placed online order for delivery at 6:16P.M. on a Monday and didn't receive order until 8:26P.M. I called to ask about my order at 7:55P.M. and was told that they were out of the Meaty Marinara pasta I had ordered. They replaced my order and delivered my food to me. I understand busy evenings and being cripplingly short staffed. I worked a pizza place for years. What is absolutely unacceptable about my experience was the lack of communication. As soon as my order was received I should've been called and informed that there was no Meaty Marinara. As soon as any order hits 45 minutes elapsed there should be a call to inform and reassure the customer that there order is on the way. Really disappointed in the management tonight.

name: Jackie Cottingham
text: Great customer  service and pizza  was great

name: Florence Muhindi
text: I made a delivery order from this location, and the people that work here told me that they couldn’t deliver my order to me because their driver had car problems..... so basically they only have one driver in the whole store so I never got my order

name: Nancy Stephens
text: Order medium pizza with cinnamons sticks to go. Food was good, but when I ordered on the website it told me how many minutes it was going to take to be ready. But no where did it say to call when you arrive in the parking lot. I am only complaining because I have ordered before and my pizza was brought out to me without me calling that I was in the parking lot.

name: Donnie
text:
I ordered a specific pizza from the app, asked while picking up the pizza if it was that pizza, the guy running the register (and by running I mean he was kicked back with headphones in) tells me that it is that pizza.

I go home, discover that it a different pizza, call the store to ask about it, and a woman asks if I ordered from the app. I say yeah and she says they don't even serve that food and I shouldn't have ordered from the app.

The receipt clearly says what it was supposed to be. So instead of just not selling me that pizza, they make me a wrong pizza, charge me for it, and won't give a refund. I'm never using this Pizza Hut again.

Update - I gave this Pizza Hut another chance since I was ordering for my father-in-law and it was the closest one to him. I don't know if it's an app problem or what, but I got the wrong order again. Whoever answered the phone did offer me a refund, but I am definitely ruling this place out. Spent almost 50 bucks the first time, and only 12 this time. Both wrong and not worth the hassle of trying to get the right food. I will just order from the one a few miles away in Helena, which has always been reliable.

The employee didn’t apologize and the manager didn’t either. They just said you have to bring the pizza back in or we can’t remake it for you. Even though coronavirus is going around, they said it’s company policy to bring the pizza back into the store. I don’t really believe that, and will be emailing the company. We order here frequently, and never had a bad experience until today.

name: Randall Murphy
text: I remember at a time when Pizza Hut took pride in their pizza. We just ordered pizza and picked it up within 20 minutes after placing the order. Pizza looked and tasted old, was not even cut properly and poorly prepared. I am completely disappointed in the direction this company continues to go down. We basically ate cardboard with a little bit of tomato sauce and a few toppings. Do better Pizza Hut!

text:
When the app says 30 to 40 minutes on delivery and your pixza shows up almost two hours later,  there is definitely a customer service disconnect somewhere. Customers understand busy if they are accurately informed.  You have my phone number,  give a courtesy call and you can gain repeat  business. Keep this up and I'll be headed elsewhere for pizza delivery.
****Update - they have improved noticeably. I am giving them more chances especially the rapper.

Very very uncomfortable

Order from Domino's and you'll be better off.

name: Roy Washburn
text: Excellent atmosphere within walking distance of town shopping in Mountain Brook.  We were quickly seated and enjoyed the excellent service of Eduardo.  The salads were wonderful and the pizza was cooked perfectly in the brick oven.  Would definitely recommend and will return next opportunity I have when visiting the area.

name: Rick Troyanek
text: Went for lunch with my daughter and had the lunch special; slice of pizza, salad, and soup. Excellent! $9.95 each. Excellent atmosphere and service.

name: debbie ash
text: Great service and awesome atmosphere and unbelievable food!

name: Hasin Gandhakwala
text: My wife and I went on opening night and although the restaurant was packed, the staff made us feel welcome and service was excellent. There were a few hiccups (understandable for 1st day of business); however, the staff definitely did everything in their power to make up for it. If you want fantastic service & true Italian style pizza, this is the place to go. We'll definitely be back!

name: Tim Suggs
text:
My wife and I decided to try this fairly new to Mountain Brook "Italian Kitchen". We were seated at a super small table and we ordered bruschetta as an appetizer, my wife ordered the house meatballs, and I ordered their chicken alfredo spaghetti. When the "Bruschetta" arrived, our table was now "full" with the plate containing the "toast" with tomatoes masquerading as"bruschetta", and our two dining plates.  Normally, bruschetta is served on some type of grilled French, or "specialty" bread. Nope, ours was served on 3 pieces of "toast", cut diagonally, and fresh out of the bread wrapper.  Only the first piece was edible because the reason you don't use fresh bread is because it becomes soggy very quickly which is exactly what happened with the following 5 pieces of "toast". Oh, they tried to help it out by charing the bread pretty good, but it didn't keep the center of each slice from literally folding over and dumping the bruschetta all over the plate, table AND my clothes as I tried to eat it. The overly toasted crusts were best used to dip my wife's meatball sauce while she wasn't looking.

Soon, my chicken alfredo spaghetti arrived, and it looked nice, creamy, no place to put it however on our uselessly small table so I had to give up my dining plate and just eat my remaining bruschetta straight off of the serving platter...  AND...  WAIT A MINUTE... that's not spaghetti, it's penne pasta. We summoned our waiter, and he apologized but said that he was pretty sure that the chicken alfredo was always served over penne pasta. After requesting the menu again, I pointed out the word "spaghetti" in the description of their "Chicken Alfredo Spaghetti" and he quickly disappeared. Soon, a woman, whom did not introduce herself, appears at our table and says "So, you're not a penne kind of guy huh?". I replied, "No, I'm not."  She then tells me that they are "out of spaghetti" and that she'll "get them to make me anything else on the menu". What she's really telling me is WoW, you do know the difference between spaghetti and penne pasta, AND noticed that we just substituted what you ordered with whatever we had...

My wife was about half through with her house meatballs by this time so I told that I was fine and didn't wish to order anything else. And she hopped right up and disappeared as quickly as my appetite had, never to be seen again.  I left slightly ahead of my wife and when our server told me "Hope to see you again soon...", I just replied, "You won't" as I made my way to the street.

I really don't understand how anyone can find this sort of treatment "acceptable". I don't, and they've lost me, my recommendation to my friends and family, coworkers, business customers and clients as a place to get a good meal and have a nice time.

name: jeremy irwin
text: The pizza is killer, everything looks and taste so fresh plus the prices are super low...what more needs to be said!! I will be back!

name: John Paul Rhodes
text: We celebrated a friend's birthday at MidiCi.  The food and service were great!

name: Regina Gargollo
text: We had a great server but they were out of almost everything me and my friends want that night and had some issues with the quality of food we received. We addressed it to the manager but we were just told that they will make sure to get it right next time. Didn’t even try to make something right at that moment. As much as I love Italian food I’m not coming back.

name: Fernanda Félix Schwarzbeck
text:
It was a great experience overall! ... Our server was really fast and attentive (Jordan) and all the staff were really nice. Manager (I assume) greeted us when arrived and also when we left.
Caesar salad was deliciouuuus! And we had the Devils pizza which was really good as well. Place is cozy, loved the indoor tree!
I would definitely go back!

name: Lauren Bailey
text: Ordered 6 pizzas for the table to share amongst 6 people (on the second night open I might add) and they were all so great! So flavorful, great crust...We ate it all. Our server was awesome- she was so kind and attentive. Great aesthetic atmosphere also, can’t wait to come back!

name: David Loveless
text: The meatballs are to die for! Also, got 2 pizza's and 2 salads that were great. The atmosphere is very fun, and I love that you can see the 2 big pizza ovens as they make your pizza! Highly Recommend.

name: David Hutchins
text: Very nice host who I believe was also the restaurant manager. I had "The Devil's" pizza ($13) and it was great. Not as pricey as you would think it to be, considering it's an upscale looking place. Definitely will revisit the next time in the area

name: Cole Harvey
text: Loved this place at first, good pizza, fantastic ovens, staff and seemingly great management/leadership. Not sure what happened, last couple times the restaurant seemed lost. Service and quality dramatically declined.

name: Ldj
text: Nice pizza dough.. but their ingredients are average. Also I personally think ambiance plays an important roll when you enjoy food. Unfortunately workers in this place looks stressed and disorganized.

name: Chelsea Lewis
text: We love this place! We’ve eaten at all the pizzerias in town and this is by far our favorite! Better than pizzeria gm, better than blaze, better than pieology, the list goes on! Great atmosphere, great staff, great food! We will definitely be back!

name: Tyler Phelps
text: I can't remember the last time I received this time of customer service from a restaurant. They went above and beyond to make our work group feel appreciated. Absolutely recommenced this place.

name: Jackie Pierce
text: Great Environment, friendly service and the food is awesome. It’s great having another small restaurant in the Mountain Brook area. I have been there twice since they opened and both times the food was great and the service was friendly! The Pizzas are our favorite!  My husband and I have also had take outs (twice) so I don’t really know what the other reviewer was talking about? Actually we are ordering dinner to go tonight! Thanks for opening up in our neighborhood! WELCOME!

name: Eyal Ron
text:
The server was awesome!
Greek Salad was great but the garlic bread test was an F.
Calzone and pizza were good but nothing too good.  The decor is less inviting and some how cold.

name: J Dub
text: Wonderful tasty pizza and strong commitment to service. Gourmet pizzas are 12" ranging from $12 to $15 but definitely worth it!

name: Cristina Dieni
text: The place is nice and cozy! Pizza was good! I will come back.

name: Dave D.
text: Came by for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Staff was genuine and accommodating. Food was delicious - Chicken Pesto Calzone was on point. Will be back.

name: Rachael Gregg
text: We had a great experience at Midici. The atmosphere is awesome and the pizza is delicious. We will definitely be back!

name: GKM Equestrian
text: Food is fantastic the service is getting better. Once they are in sync it will be one of my favorite places.

name: Dallas Gregg
text: Great place. Food and atmosphere were awesome. Wait wasn’t too long and the owner was there and extremely helpful.

name: Elizabeth Crooks
text: European style pizza with an abundance of options in an upscale yet family-friendly environment.  A great addition to dining options in Mountain Brook Village.

name: Chad Brewer
text:
FLAVORLESS! Two stars for the solid wait service outside of that I would give it no stars. My pizza was tasteless.....I’ve had boxed pizzas from the freezer with more flavor. My wife had the spaghetti bolognese and it tasted like well it actually had no taste. An absolute joke for food!

Based on the other reviews I have to wonder if  we might have had poorly prepared the food that night, but I doubt I will give it another shot.

name: Latavia Hinkle
text: Love the food service a little slow

name: Wil Johnson
text: Very enjoyable pizza and calzones. Service and price is very good and is very good quality. Owner greeted us at table and was very friendly. Will return.

name: William Blair
text: Party of 5, 5:30 p.m. seating. The tree dropped leaves in my water 1st thing. Meat Board was very mediocre. Two pizzas & two salads. Tried to order a second bottle of wine, never seemed to get there. Asked about the wine ,was told "We're just getting opened". I suppose we're expected to pay for the staff to learn how to run a restaurant on the job? Asked for salt & pepper, I guess it was got forgotten as well. Had people swarming to take dishes, alas not the case with our waitress.  Sat for 20+ minutes after we finished our dinner  waiting to get our tab. Now the good. The Pizza was A++++ build your own is the way to go.  Salad is a waste of money. But the Pizza will get me back to the place. Get rid of the tree. Outside dining, when it cools off will be terrific

name: Liz Davis
text: Delicious calzone and house salad! We enjoyed the atmosphere and our waitress was helpful and attentive.

name: John Palmer
text: I enjoyed the pizza, I’m not a fan you can not call in a pick up order.

name: Heather Taylor
text: The food was delicious, and the lunch special was a great deal! I will be back! 😁

name: Joe Sanders
text: Great pizza and crust. Faster service than I expected.

name: mike Creel
text: Awful service horrible pizza crust was burnt on the outside and not done on the inside if you like expensive horrible pizza this is your place

name: Harrison Adams
text:
I’m in the business so I can honestly say this place is awful. We were being seated and then the hostess stopped as another waitress jumped in at the table to “seat an investor”, there was no apology and a lot of confusion. The next thing out of the hostess’s mouth was “it’s going to be another 45 minutes to an hour”. I don’t care how average the food may be, customers come second at this place and it won’t be open in 5 years.

Won’t be going back.

name: Katie Fortenberry
text: Everything about it is wonderful. Food & atmosphere, great place all around

name: Nancy Sims
text: Great service and good food.  A reservation helped as it had a 45 minute wait time.

name: Terri Goeman
text: The food was good, the service was friendly, and the atmosphere was nice. However, the menus were dirty, and the tables weren’t promptly bussed. They didn’t have any of the coffee products or italian sodas on the menu. I would go back in hopes the shortcomings were due to it just recently opened.

name: mattia guidali
text: I am Italian, I moved here 3 years ago from Milan. I have to admit that MiDici has the best pizza in town, the only one that I can considered somewhat truly Italian. There were some troubles in the kitchen, they forgot to put prosciutto on one pizza, and they put garlic on another one even though I asked them not to. But those mistakes could easily be forgiven by the quality of the food. The Nutella calzone is something that anybody that goes to MiDici needs to try. The only "bad" thing about it was that the waiter corrected me on my Italian pronunciation of the word "calzone" (I found it very funny). Definitely I will come back.

name: angela ferguson
text: Excellent pizza and very good service!

name: Robert Ashurst
text: Service not so good But they just opened. Food is great!

name: Wanda Bedgood
text: Amazing pizza, but thrifty on the toppings. Caesar salad is a must.

name: Shameka Mason
text: Great food an reasonable prices!!

name: Tim Tha Tyrant
text: Best firewood oven pizza I kno of

name: Julie Schneider
text: Everything was delicious!

name: Eduardo Rodriguez
text: Best pizza in bham!

name: Worth Hanson
text: Good pizza

name: Fonsa Amezquita
text: It was great. Friendly environment,  clean  and food was good.

resp.text: Hi, Fonsa! This is what we love to hear—thanks so much for the great feedback!

name: Saad Ahmed
text: Beautiful looking new store! Great new staff. And of course a delicious pizza. So glad this store has opened in this area, it was much needed!

resp.text: Hi, Saad! Thanks so much for the great feedback—so glad to hear it!

name: Leticia Soto-Burton
text: Got good wings and pizza...

name: Mikal Hardeman
text: Drivers pulling out in front of other drivers on highway almost causing an accident

resp.text: Hi, Mikal. Thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. Please fill out this form to create documentation in your own words regarding this concern. www.tellmarcos.com

name: Fat Farm Fishing (Arc Aerial)
text: I was excited to hear they were opening near us! I live 5 minutes in a straight shot from this restaurant and they don’t deliver here. 4 Pizza Pirates directly across the street from Marcos delivers here. If you wouldn't consider delivery 5 miles i would not consider doing business with you.

resp.text: Aaron, we apologize for the inconvenience. Our stores have specific areas where delivery is available.  We’d be happy to assist with a carryout order.

name: Kameal Lee
text: This is the most unprofessional place to get any food from...There very rude and all need to be retrained on how to work in the plubic..The crew manger is very unprofessional (Jeff) definitely need a new leader..besides him.

resp.text: Hello, Kameal. We take these things very seriously and want to know more. Please tell us about your experience on our feedback form at www.tellmarcos.com.

name: Stephen Bermudez
text: We ordered a pepperoni and one of their specialty pizzas. The pepperonis were smaller but there were loads of them. We got curbside carryout and the whole process was smooth and easy. The food/price is decent, but use a coupon and 👍🏻👍🏻. Overall a good addition to the 431/165 area.

name: Samir Mewar
text: Excellent veggie pizza...great service..very clean

resp.text: Samir, we're so happy you had an excellent experience! Thanks for the review! We really appreciate it.

name: Joshua Hines
text: Great food

resp.text: Hi, Joshua! This is the feedback we love to see—thank you so much!

name: William Daniell
text: Excellent service, ready when promised and outstanding quality.

resp.text: Hi William. We're so happy you had an excellent experience! Thanks for the review! We really appreciate it.

name: Codi Burford
text: I agree with Aaron. 4 Pizza Pirates delivers to me as well and their pizza is always hot, but I would love something different. I was excited to have something new in the Seale area as well even if it was another pizza place, but the delivery criteria Marcos has seems ridiculous and will prevent me from doing business because of the inconvience the drive has to make. 4 Pizza Pirates will continue getting my business every week until I decide to carry out. It's a shame. A suggestion should be recommended to corporate.

resp.text: Codi, we apologize for any inconvenience. Our stores have specific areas where delivery is available.

name: Sharon Thacker
text: Everything was hot and fresh! Customer service was Excellent! They even called to let me know my food was ready for pick up thru the drive thru window.

resp.text: Hi, Sharon! This is what we love to hear—so glad you had a good experience!

name: T Porter
text: Fast delivery and pizza is always hot and delicious. 😋😋

name: Tredis Stanley
text: Good customer service

resp.text: Hi Tredis. Thanks for the great feedback—so glad to hear you had a good experience!

name: Anita Johnson
text: My favorite !!

resp.text: This is the feedback we love to see—thanks so much, Anita!

name: John H Ratliff
text: Personally, I believe that the restaurant inside Lloyd Hall should be called "Harry's," for obvious reasons. The food is pretty pricey here and they have wonky hours in the summer time, but it's quick and convenient and there's something to be said for that.

name: frogstud
text: Friendly people, they are always there to help you get on your way.

name: K Heacock
text: The manager did nothing but walk around and dig in her eye while they were slammed. Her mask was in her bun rather than on her face. She did cut a pizza without washing her hands then left. Still busy and and I’ve been waiting 30 minutes for my refund or at least my food. Don’t do it

name: Antoinette Harmon
text: Quick pick up for Lunch

name: Mollie Newsome
text: It's assembly line pizza these days.....

name: Danny Wolfe
text: It never gets better.   I just got one of the awesome lunch combo pizzas...it had so much red sauce on it, it was literally dripping out from under the cheese.  I understand that true Italian pizza will emphasize the sauce frequently.  But this is Little Caesar's...this sauce is nothing to be proud of.  Not only that, I've used 10-15 napkins trying to drain the grease and it's still soaking wet and soggy.  Pizza dough should at least have a little crisp to it.  Most likely will not be back to this specific LC.

name: Mia Ward & Fam
text: Great atmosphere.  Must keep pizza ready to serve.  Must keep salad items refilled also.  Grew a little impatient waiting for more items to be replaced

name: Keisha Allen
text: Delicious pizza, yummy wings, and the most amazing cheesy bread. My orders are always hot and fresh. There's so many toppings to chose from. I appreciate the quality of their business. Whether its lunch on the go. Or a night I can skip cooking dinner accompanied with a mountain of dishes. I'm most certainly there.

name: Sara Ferrera
text: Wow they changed management and staff! This location which is close to my home has done a complete 360 turn around, staff are not rude the food is fresh I went after 8pm and wasnt lied to about being out of wings I'm very shocked now! Extra most best pepperoni pizza was actually appealing to the eye and not sitting in a puddle of grease. Good job

name: Jasmin Bryan
text: The one by Howells ferry off of Moffett never has the pizza ready, people are rude and they always are out of certain specialty  pizzas. Especially deep dish. If you want a good little chasers go to the one by Walmart.  They are really good.

name: Loren Deagro
text: It took 15 minutes to get a "Hot n Ready" pizza at 4:30pm after being told 6 minutes. I could have been understanding of the time issue, but my pizza was extremely overcooked, the cheese was burnt and only covered 3/4 of the pizza.

name: Jayson Morgan
text: How does this place stay in business or maintain its franchise? They don't answer the phone and when they do they are rude and never have any toppings. When I went in to pick up the two people working the front both had their pants hanging down showing their butts and their underwear. Clearly their is no management overseeing the operation. It's sad that in this day and time this has become an acceptable business practices. With work ethic like this, why on earth should we raise minimum wage? To reward laziness and poor attitudes.

name: Jaylyn Hogan-Duncan
text: I love the pizza here. It's always really good, fast, and cheap. Plus most employees are really nice here.

name: Stephanie Sypsa
text: The pizza was really good. It was busy so I had to wait, but they worked really quick to fill my order.

name: Gacha Gia
text: Bc it's supposed to be hot n READY.. It's NEVER READY.. They open at 10:30.. I get her at 10:49.. I'm still waiting on a cheese pizza to take to my daughter's school😡

name: Jennifer Fraunfelder
text: The pizza was sub-par. I was initially over charged for my order which in turn had to be refunded and charged again. The pizza was just blah, nothing exciting or extraordinary. I think we are done with pizza, or atleast Little Caesars.

name: Samantha Van Kleeck
text: This location is ALWAYS slow! They do not have hot and ready pizzas. I'm currently waiting 20 minutes. The whole reason I come here is because it's cheap and I'm supposed to be able to walk in, order, and walk out with my pizza quickly.

name: Jennifer Carter
text: If only their phones would work grabbing and go would actually work for this store. Food is always good and obviously fresh bc you have to wait for it to be cooked so...not unless you realllly want pizza then yeah, wait!

name: Jonathan Davis
text:
This store specifically is always late on orders. Today I ordered 4 pizzas 2 hours prior to pick up. The gentlemen on the phone seemed like he had no idea how to take an order. Got there to pick up and they didn't have my pizzas in the system. They had them written down on a piece of paper and the man I talked to on there phone said "oh he's here already?" I placed pick up for 6 and showed up at 6. They just put the pizzas in at 6. No real concern for Customer service in this facility from any staff.
Management should be  more aware.

name: Esther Washington
text: This was one of the worst experience in fast food I have ever had. I went to visit Little Caesar pizza place. I ordered one pepperoni pizza and one cheese pizza. There were three females inside of Little Caesar two African American female and one Caucasian female. One of the African American females with a cashier then one day in the African American female in the back and a Caucasian female with making the pizzas. When I place my order Little Caesar around 8:51 p.m. which is the X stamped on my receipt. All of the workers in Little Caesars were on their cell phones or had the above's in the ear. I placed my order with the cashier, then I just watch to see what happened. I washed your Caucasian female put her phone down and take her ear plugs out, then she received it to wash your hands. Then I saw the African American female come from the back aisle set up phone down, but never saw her wash her hands. Then she proceeded to take down crust and lay them flat in trays and place butter on them along with the cheese. Not remember as I stated before, I never saw her wash your hands. Okay so I'll call the Caucasian female to the front and I said excuse me but she did not wash her hands referring to the African American female. Then the Caucasian female he's going to tell me that she washed her hands. The African American female and stated I don't know what you watching me for because I wash my hands. Then she proceeded to use negative language and added to that a very negative attitude. Simply because I requested that they follow safety procedures by washing their hands before touching food. Then the African American female continue to be negative and use and negative body language. I asked for the name of the manager and the district office number. I was told there was no district office for Little Caesar. I was told the manager on duty was the African American woman with the negative attitude and the one that use negative language. I asked who was the owner of this particular Little Caesar on Moffett Road in Mobile Alabama. I was told I think his name is Michael. So you telling me that you're working at a business and you don't even know who you're working for? I tried to reach someone in the office a little Caesar to put this situation. I will continue to reach out to Little Caesar until I get some type of reply. I'm just afraid that the person may not have enough self-control to walk away from someone else being ignorant. So my experience with this little Caesar on Moffett Road and Mobile Alabama was totally negative and I would advise anyone not to go. It's too many other places out there that would enjoy your money and how you spend it

name: Stacy Hollings-Crosby
text: I wish I could give it a negative rating. Please explain to me how a pizza company run out of dough? It ridiculous! Costumer service is a joke!

name: Jessica West
text: ALWAYS out of something mainly any bread and you ALWAYS have to wait for the pizza! 20 mins or longer! Definitely not hot and ready here!

name: charlene lundy
text: Great people. The general manager Sherri is awesome.

name: Christopher Bowler
text: Came to pick up 45 pizzas for Honor Choir after numerous order verifications. Got here at 11:06 for an 11:15 pickup. Need these pizzas at the event by 11:50. Was told by Ashley, "we have no order for you, we don't even have enough dough in the store for that." After another phone call from our director she said "Oh yeah, I remember you now...my bad. You can call Semmes, maybe they can do it. Unbelievable!!!!

name: Anthony Nalli
text: I haven’t had Little Caesar’s in maybe 15 years and this visit today reminded me why. The “Hot and Ready” pepperoni pizza was so undercooked it was almost doughy. And the slices weren’t cut all the way through. The wings were nothing short of disgusting. I had one and could barely keep from spitting it out. To make matters worse, the girl behind the counter made it obvious she would probably prefer having a root canal than working. She was entirely unhelpful leaving me to feel that I was bothering her with my business. There are far too many pizza places out there to have to contend with this and even pay for it.

name: Darcy Long
text: This was the first time I visited this location and I am 110% satisfied with the hospitality and customer service Deandre A. provided.

name: ***Whit*** K
text: March 7 2017....the two working tonight were excellent!!! The pizza tasted really good and they were working hard!! Thanks Joyce and Andre!!!!!! (I hope i spelt your names right) You guys did a great job, the pizza tasted way better than other little ceasars

name: Zora Jones
text: How can you order a deep dish,then they tell you they out of deep dish pizza ,when they   can just lay out the doughto make it.

name: Thesavage Lemon
text: It was nice but it was packed and thats good for a resturant but there were alot of flies and dead ones

name: M.L. Grayson
text: This store needs extra help bad! The  wait time can be as long as 25 minutes,  and there was no pizzas in the warmer.

name: Andreana Nelson
text: The service at this establishment was extremely slow and the customer service sucks. No pizzas were ready, customers were giving a 10 minute wait but the wait was 30-45 minutes. No cashier was on duty with only 2 other employees in the back. The female employee with the large eyelashes had a attitude. TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!

name: Heaven Land
text: The worst place ever i went in with a 20 i spent 11 and some change sho she owed me like 8.00 back she rolled her eyes and said u gotta come back later ion got change so i said ok ill walk next door and get some so i come back with all 5 dollar bills so i hand her 15.00 thats she now owes me 3.00 back she rolled her eyes again and said diddint i jus say i dont have change ....what business dont have 3.00 in the drawer either she is stealing it or eating it her name was ashley by the way because i made sure to go back in and ask for a recipient

name: Veva Moody
text: Service at this location sucks. Ive had to wait 30 mins multiple times for items advertised "Hot & Ready". Not friendly. And what kind of pizza place doesnt have parmesan cheese.. REALLY... WOW 😕😕

name: JMC Blanks
text: They never answer the phone and one time they claim they ran out of dough. How in the world does a PIZZA PLACE run out of DOUGH? We will not eat here anymore. Employees are rude and dont care about the job.

name: Amber Buckley
text: Card reader is always down the bell on the drive through doesn't work. So you have to leave to get cash and they won't take anything more than a $20. The girl working the drive through when she finally makes it to the window has a attitude.

name: Sonny Menner
text: Don't know about all of them. But the one on Moffat has bad service.  Went in a 9:30 pm and was told they were out of dough for pizza.  Had to take what they had in the warmer. It was awful.  Cold and nasty.

name: Lucy Underwood
text: Awful customer service.  One word answers when asking what was Hot N ready. Not even a thank you after purchase??? Will never go back.

name: Rosko Younce
text: Great place for a fast and hot food trip.

name: Patrick julio
text: The staff here are all lazy and rude, they hardly ever have anything ready and always tell you it's going to take 20 to 30 minutes to cook anything you order. It's not kept clean and it's the worst Little Caesar's location I've ever visited, from now on I will drive the 5 extra miles to visit the semmes location.

name: Keith Clarke
text: Everytime i go in this place... they dont have any hot and readies made... and they dont have any change.... so either these homeboys are too stupid to do a simple service industry job... or theyre trying to hustle extra money out of the customers... i will not go back here again... hire some white people... bunch of grown ars blacks dont have the brains to do what 15 year old whote children can do...

name: Kandi
text: Cant beat 5$ hot n ready. Stop here all the time for a quick snack for the kids

name: Janet Johnson
text: Out of ingredients which happens all the time,  but pizza was good

name: Andrew Strasburg
text: Not up to the standards of other little Caesars pizza places.  No real concern for customer service.  You feel like your an inconvenience to them if you ask them anything.

name: Carly Smith
text: The bathroom looked horrible! There was poop smeared on the paper towel dispenser, period blood on the floor and walls along with tampons and pads everywhere! Lost my appetite never going there again! If I could I've no stars I would.

name: David Gorbach
text: Always out of dough. They need to make their own.

name: ashante mccants
text: Some of the staff is always in the back doing nothing and never have pizza done you always have to wait

name: Regina Williams
text: The kids love the taste and I love the price.

name: Adel Niyo
text: I have been here for over 90 minutes waiting on 3 pizzas. This is a record low for me.

name: Raquel Williams
text: Hot n ready is hardly ever fresh

name: Neal MickeyD
text: Why are they even still open? These workers act like it’s a bother every time a customer walks thru the door .

name: Evejt7 Harris
text: Pizza done right at this location

name: Rosko Younce
text: Poor service and very rude people not even trying to help make it a better place to visit..

name: Mekaa Mekka
text: The female mgr acted like she didn't want to be there. They didn't acknowledge you, once you came through the door.. The cooks didn't use gloves,  he washed his hand tho lol...

name: Chris Perry
text: Ok food.crowded

name: Karizma 1708
text: THE ABSOLUTE WORST! BUYERS/PATRONS BEWARE

name: Patrice Johnson
text: Very nasty attitudes. Customer service is horrible!!

name: Marcus Richardson
text: They only had 1 teenager working the entire store. I felt sorry for the guy.

name: Kendra Hollins
text: I wish I could rate it lest than a one star this store needs a new staff entirely.

name: Fre M
text: Purchased a cheese pizza that looked like a cheese  Frisbee. Pizza was so old and hard  the crust was extremely dry.

name: Corey Shenk
text: They just hired more people and it still takes forever to get anything other than a $5 pizza and staff needs to work on lack of customer service.

name: Gaming with Lj
text: Poor Customer service skills, very rude and careless, I walked in to order pizza they completely ignored me while in the back playing, I stayed around for 20 minuets and NO one came to the register, I will Never go back again!

text: How do they continue to do business is they don't answer their phone

text: They are slow, run out, lock doors.

name: Shayla
text: Fav

text: Pizzas are getting smaller but still an ok price.

name: Nelva Mc Neil

name: Christopher Cowart
text: Don't even bother going up there cause they're out of everything. How does a pizza place stay in business when they never have cheese or dough!

name: marco baker
text: Never have food ready and something is always down. Very bad customer service!!

name: B. Michelle
text: The nastiest pizza at this location, literally had a the $5 pepperoni pizza with just pepperoni and cheese no sauce whatsoever and the cashier was on her phone, no wonder why i pass all by them and go to the one in SEMMES

name: Nikeland Nichols
text: Every time I come to this location, there are no "hot and ready" pizzas, and a lobby full of waiting customers. The wait time has ranged from ten to thirty minutes. This is unacceptable.

name: John Keenum
text: One of the worst. Employee was rude and just wanted us to leave. Probably wint be back

name: Cyronic
text: No good

name: Jeff Smith
text: Very good food Very good service 👌

name: Karen Smith
text: Awful!! Took forever to deliver some wings and they were so fatty that we couldn't eat them. Never again.

name: Ellen Maze
text: I love PapaJohn's pizza and wings and the cheesesticks. The Clanton, AL, store has great employees inside when I do carry out. Delivery is often slow, but that's life. I usually do carry out for that reason.

name: Alexandria Epperson
text: Their pizza is always good and they never mess up the orders

name: Todd Benoit
text: It was delicious! Hot and was ready when I got there to pick it up. The jalapeno cheese bites weren't very good.

name: Heather Dumdey
text: Ordered online for pick up. Pizza was very good. Staff members were friendly and helpful. Very satisfied with my order.

name: Sparky B
text: Good food and timely delivery.

name: Silvestre Rodriguez
text: Delivery guy forgot the drink we ordered and the guy said he would be right back with it, after 30 minutes we called and he said he was doing another delivery and said he would delivering right after, never came back, had an attitude when I called him, never came back with.

name: Dorothy Larmore
text:
We order regularly. We are awaiting an order right now. Lets see if they get it correct and hot. Last time time we waited over an hour to get it. Then they did not follow delivery instructions. In the beginning they were really good. Pizza hut is still far far worse!! Will update once i get our order.
Update 10 months later:
We have stopped ordering from here fully which is sad as i love this company. They can't get our order right at all. Last time i ended up cancelling after waiting 4 hours. When i called all i got were excuses and, "It won't get there today. We've had a driver walk out and a store worker quit." We never did get refunded what we paid for the pizza we never got.

name: James Fowler
text: The staff is super knowledgeable and nice. Deliveries can take a little longer because of the drivers mileage radius; 15 miles plus so be patient. But overall the quality of food is great and they're pretty generous with discounts. You just have to ask

name: Nikki Morrison
text: Terrible service!  Can't get them to answer the phone, so placed online order.  Said would be delivered within 1 hours.  2 hours later, still not delivered and then online tracker shows order was cancelled.  Last time I try to order from there!

name: Jennifer Mulder
text: Great service and our order was ready right on time and was delicious!!!

name: Kathryn Childress
text: Loved it

name: Tammy Cloer
text: Luv their pizza it's close to my home friendly staff

name: Bridget Fulmer
text: Staff was friendly and food wasgood

name: Corey Clark
text: Best pizza ever! Not sure what the other reviewer is talking about! Since ordering and eating said pizza, the hair on my head has started growing back and my long lost cat has returned. Along with a golden retriever and a bull dog. Something about homeward bound. Pizza is really good is what I'm trying to say.

name: Allie James
text: Just ordered my 40.00 worth of food today. I ordered my delivery at 530pm. My driver called from store at 630pm. Said he was running late. Ordered online said it would be delivered at 615pm. He said he was waiting on another delivery, I said ok. How long? He couldn't give me a time just said a few more min and he would be leaving. I called back told him I would just come get my own food. I get to the store the driver was still there waiting on his delivery to come out of oven. My food had been sitting there waiting on 2 other deliveries to come out of oven. My pizza was cold and the manager didn't seem to know what he was doing being he couldn't even change my order from delivery to carryout. So therefore I paid delivery charge. No credit back to me. They need more workers or close this location!!!!!

name: Donna Daniel
text: Great service and yummy pizza

name: Susan Beam
text: Delivery is great the drivers are always very polite and do a good job getting us our order. I don't like going to the actual store have not had good experiences doing that , not friendly slow and just didn't give good customer servive. The lady that worked the front this weekend is very impolite and she doesn't like or seem to want to be there working to begin with and she doesn't try to take it at all

name: Joshua Smitherman
text: Great quick friendly service and great pizza

name: Margaret Rogers
text: Great pizza and clean restaurant

name: Brianna Penny
text: I would give one star but for many reasons I won't one being this review is based on my last and most likely final experience since I consider myself to be a loyal returning customer having enjoyed Papa John's for the most part but that part being mostly when I pick up the order.. most of the delivery experiences have been bad.. like most recently I received an email for 50% off my pizza for national Pizza day so I proceeded to order an extra large pepperoni pizza which came to about $7 but since the order has to be a minimum of $15 I ordered wings as well and I had $10 in papa dough but I still ended up paying $15 because of the $3.99 delivery fee and a $5 tip I added because I was paying with my card so anyways the expected delivery time which was about 45 minutes so I called and was immediately asked to hold and I said no I'm checking on my order and I thought lol they still put me on hold and I screamed profanity which I now apologize for but anyway they told me the driver would be there soon meanwhile I'm looking for the driver and I see a car going back and forth like they're lost and then pull up to another house so I'm thinking they pulled up to the wrong house and I'm trying to get the driver's attention he turns off the car and the lights and looked like he was just standing there talking so I call back to tell them this guy is just talking and my pizza is already late and I want a refund so then the driver finally pulls up while I'm on the phone and I'm telling them both I want a refund and instead of being sincere and apologizing for the inconvenience I'm being questioned about why I want a refund when it only "ten" minutes late so unless I get the refund or some type of credit that's the last time I will be ordering Papa John's and especially delivery cuz I don't even have time to tell you about my other experiences. For now it's not delivery it's D'Gornios. Update 11/13/2019: never got a response to my complaint online and I guess their way of responding was to stop delivering to this area. Ordered recently only because my husband really wanted Papa John's but again it was a pickup and like I said before never had a problem when picking up.

name: Christa Gonzalez
text: Was on hold to place an order over 5 minutes

name: Bryan Petty
text:
When this Papa Johns first opened it was great. They were fast and the pizza was perfect. Lately it has been going downhill.  They have gotten VERY slow and be sure to check your pizza to make sure it's what you ordered.

Looks like our pizza for pizza night is going to start coming from somewhere else.

name: kallen carter

name: Kendra Pitts
text: First of all let me say that I have never written a review before. I stayed at some horrible hotels and ate at some not so great restaurants and my experience today was probably the worst I've ever had.  I placed an order over the phone and went to pick it up.  When I got there I noticed a pizza on a tray and as they were calling out names I thought they said it was mine but a diner in front of me said iy was hers. They delivered the pizza to her table and then the cashier started to wait on me. I gave her my name and she looked confused. One of the guys working behind the counter said that the pizza that they gave away was mine. They went out to the table and brought pizza back and start to put it in a to go box like they were giving it to me! The guy was like "no way" I am making you a new order. So I have a seat and I hear a commotion.  The guy is arguing with a "manager" and he tells the guy to clock out. When he leaves he tells me that he's sorry. So I wait for another 20 minutes thinking that I am getting a new pizza. Eventually I asked the girl at the counter where my order was and she says oh I'll bring it right out to you. I get the order and walk back to my car and something told me to check it. I opened up the box and its the same cold pizza that they originally wanted to give me! I mean the bottom of the box is soggy and the pizza is freezing cold! I marched back in there very upset and ask for my money back immediately. As I write this I am livid I have never experienced anything like this and I will never ever go back to that restaurant!

name: Randall Martin, Jr.
text: The pizza is amazing, and breadsticks are even better. Awesome customer service, too.

name: Stephen Foster
text: Definitely the best new pizza place in Birmingham and now my go to for a pie. Their approach to pizza is amazing! Taking true restaurant techniques and applying them to a classic like pizza is the perfect move. Even the size of the pizza when ordering is listed by dough weight. The sauce is the perfect balance of acidic and sweet and the toppings are extremely fresh and have an amazing taste. Having them in 5 Points South is an amazing addition to all the other restaurants in our neighborhood.

name: Nathan Zarzaur
text: Fantastic service, the staff were both friendly and helpful. My food arrived quickly and I felt the prices were fair for what I was getting. My only reservation is that the crust was slightly burnt on the bottom of my pizza, which affected the taste. Still, overall I really enjoy it and I'll be back for more in the future. I'm excited to try some of their sandwich and cast iron pasta options, but the pizza will always be the star of the show.

name: Evan Smith
text: We had the Four Cows and Meat Big Papa and were very impressed. Probably my favorite pizza I've had in Birmingham since I was a kid. The staff was very friendly and it was super reasonably priced (two 10oz pizzas for $20, with almost a full pizza left over between the two of us). Definitely recommend, especially when Domino's would be almost as, if not more, expensive for exponentially worse pizza.

name: Brandon Reed
text: Wonderful friendly staff. Ordered the $14 meatball sub, and when I inquired about the side I was informed one was not included. I was told it was a large sandwich. While the sandwich alone was filling, I hope they recognize sides are more about flavor/texture diversity within a meal vs simply about quantity. Some kettle chips would have been an excellent accompaniment without much added food cost for them.

name: scott garber
text:
Would have loved this place to be great but it was not!!

Pizza by weight, ever hear of such??

ordered 2 pies (large 16 oz?) 2 salads italian chopped ( nothing chopped)
meatballs..... 86.00... party of 5... we were starving when we left....
Pizza was fresh and good, meatballs were LAMB?? not familiar with lamb meatballs at Italian restaurant and suggest they take a look at a cooking book for Italian meatballs... No BEER either ,,,, who wants pizza without beer ???

suggest they go back to drawing board... Owner / chef was supposed to

come to table to address us but never showed up....

name: Lyndsey Patton
text: 1 star is only bc I had to drive such a short distance (4.6 miles) after being told we weren’t in range for delivery. Honestly, if you’re out for pickup I would definitely order at another location other than this one. Service was HORRIBLE. First I called and I called on a landline phone so there would be no issue, well the person taking my order had to have been deaf bc I repeated each word of my sentence at least 3 times and then hung up in my face. So I call another location in Tuscaloosa and the guy that answered the phone there was so nice and told me that we were too far away but he was gonna check the other stores to see which delivery range we were in and he came back and said we were in range for delivery from this location. So I call back and was told again I was not in range, very confused at this point bc I’m sure they use the same system but anyways didn’t wanna argue so I just order and do pickup and when I get there I had to wait at the counter for over 5 mins just for someone to speak to me. Then in the middle of her ringing me up she proceeds to leave the counter to give another customer their order for free I might add. So I’m furious at this point and I ask if the pizza comes with ranch and she says no and doesn’t ask if I need any or anything so I ask her to get me 2 cups of ranch and she acted like it was a problem I needed ranch. So overall the service and professionalism is horrible. 10/10 do NOT recommend

resp.text: Lyndsey  I am so sorry for your poor experience.  We MUST do better!  Please consider giving us another chance to earn your business.  -HOWARD I am so sorry for your poor experience.  We MUST do better!  Please consider giving us another chance to earn your business.  -HOWARD

Somehow the "box got knocked over." What ever that meant. In addition the delivery person parked in handicap space. A very expensive ticket much less the lack of availability for someone qualified to use the space. Pizza was very good. We'll be back.
