resp.text: It looks like we dropped the ball with your order, Bobbi. Please share this with our Customer Support Team at bit.ly/dpz_cares & please include reference# 3521769. We'd like to make this up to you. *Brandon

name: Lisa Martin
text: Quickly arrived but forgot marinara sauce☹️

name: Seth Walker
text: I love Domino's Pizza, I really do. They always have great service. But the problem I have is the ones here in Auburn/Opelika, will not deliver to any address that is further than 5 miles. I find that completely ignorant. I live 7 miles away and you won't deliver to my address. I've never heard of a pizza place not delivering past 5 miles, like seriously? I know of places that would deliver 30 minutes away. Step up your game Opelika Domino's.

name: Bri
text: Called with a customer complaint, requested a supervisor and he hung up in my face. VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

name: Jackie Lawler
text: Great pizza's at a great price

name: Bianca Matthews
text: Everything about Dominos is A1. I used to never order Dominos but then as I started to work late nights, it was also open and convenient. I really appreciate the pizza tracker and of course the bomb pizza! All I suggest is that Dominos starts carrying Dr. Pepper!

name: greg milanes
text: They're understaffed. When I called to check on my delivery order when it was already 40 min late the person on the phone told me it would be another 30m+ because they only had 1 driver on staff. 1 DRIVER ON STAFF. DONT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE

name: CurlE Jones
text:
pizza tracker did not work ?
driver was very nice

text: They are fast and very friendly!!! Great customer service

name: Marty Nelson

name: Amanda Santiago
text: I was very happy with the Dominos in Opelika because they made me feel important when the Dominos in Auburn made me feel very unimportant. But after tonight and a so called manager I will give Pizza Hut or Papa Johns another chance. name: CHRIS Teague
text: Hands down the best Dominos in the world and I have used a lot of Dominos locations all across the map. Service is outstanding, never have had my order made incorrectly or lost or whatever. Most of the people that work there know my name, say most because this is a college town so there's always new faces when I go there. Order is almost always ready when I get there or just coming out of the oven, almost never have to wait around long which makes it super convent. Food is always hot when I pick up my order, unless I am late so can't fault them for that lol. If your going to get Dominos in Auburn/Opelika go to this store you won't be sorry even if your south or west of campus the extra drive is worth it. Also if you use a smartphone use there app or go online makes ordering a breeze but you can call in too they handle that easily as well (just try to know what you want, they will thank you for that and people in the store will thank you for that. Having to recite the entire menu isn't fun when you can get the info online). Hats off to my favorite Dominos crew, thank you for the great food and great service!

name: Dana Williamson
text:
Placed an online order 10/17/18 a little after 5 pm. My husband picked it up and brought it home. The super supreme I ordered was made wrong so we called to have it replaced. My husband went to pick it up and was given yet another pizza that was made incorrectly. When he called back up there the assistant manager Renee on duty argued with my husband telling him that there were not very many olives on the pizza because we had ordered extra toppings and if they put to much they get into trouble. The pizza had no olives at all on it. I called her back and informed her that I did not order extra toppings, only substituted two of the toppings and that there were no olives on the pizza. She continued to argue with me. Made me so angry that I took the pizza back up there and asked for her to show me just one olive on that pizza. She proceeded to tell me there were olives on it when she made it. I told her this is what my husband brought home. I told her how I was treated was wrong and that I would be contacting her general manager and the corporate office.
Update..... Just bit into the third pizza and it has Italian sausage on it.... Of which spurred the original complaint. So still an incorrect pizza.  Three trips for an incorrect order and not even an apology.

text: The community is lucky to have such a friendly, affordable place to get quality pizza and desserts.  Sign in online to order and start receiving points toward earning free food! Came back the following week and she had made a comment on my account to provide me a replacement dessert for the missing glaze. Devan added an extra glaze which I put in the fridge as a back up!  Excellent staff that always provide a smile!  Dominos purchased the old Burger King and remodeled it.  They have a indoor seating area, which I hope will be open for guests to eat inside someday.  I could see many wonderful birthday parties and celebrations there!

The drive thru pickup window is just a bonus, especially if you're in need of pizza and cheesy bread and the lobby is closed. Definitely worth trying.

name: christopher tucker
text: Tried to order a delivery to 801 w Beach Blvd in gulf shores Alabama. The store is located less than 1 mile from our location. They could not figure out where we where. Hung up on us twice. I will never use them or any papa Jon's again!!!

resp.text: Unfortunately the Gulf Shores location flooded during Hurricane Sally! Our franchise is planning to reopen the store sometime in 2021! Thank you so much for your patience! We look forward to servicing our customers again soon!

name: Isaac Barnoskie
text: This Papa John’s has burned a long-lasting humorous memory in my daughter’s mind...and a long-lasting memory of molten pizza on my leg.  The pizza is so good.  You know when it smells so good and the box Is warm on your lap.  You have to sample.  Against bodily well-being you still have to sample.  Even though you know that first bite has the potential to pull all the liquid topping off and scald your tongue, lips, and chin in the process.  I was aware of the swing to the chin.  I dodged it with catlike reflexes...only to have molten pizza toppings fall onto my inner thigh.  I don’t think I’ve ever screamed that loud.  Of course my daughter is laughing hysterically in the backseat.  “Daddy screamed like a girl.”  She still laughs about it every time there is Papa John’s.  All of that to say it’s fresh and hot.  We were back again for another big order.  Ordered online and order was ready as scheduled when we arrived.  Our cashier even helped carry our order to the car.  Thanks again.

name: Ethan Henley
text: Been eating here since I was a kid and hands down its made with love and the pizza tastes amazing..not to mention it’s a good deal. I look forward to saying hello to the owner and eating a pie with my pops whenever I am in town. Thanks for years of Great Eats🍕😋

name: Amanda Klein
text: Pizza is the same as next day fridge cold pizza. Good luck ever receiving it. Estimated time of 35-40 minutes per their app at time of order. Now over 80 min later still no food. According to the app it has been out for delivery for the last 30 min but the tracker is disabled. This is the second time this has occurred with this location. Last time an hour after the pizza was made it was still not delivered and we were able to drive to the restaurant to pick it up before it even left the building despite them saying it had been enroute....UPDATE: food ordered at 640pm. Estimated time per their site 35-40 min. 750pm I call and I'm told that it is out for delivery but there are 4 other orders going out with it. 815pm I speak with the GM, Brad, who also reports my food is out for delivery, apologizes and comps the order after I explain the kids are already in bed after we had to feed them something else....915pm STILL NO FOOD. As I'm on hold and now personally headed to the location, I intercept the delivery driver in the hallway. He hands me the warm but not hot food for free per his boss and i tip him after he admits that he was only given the food less than 15 min prior to his arrival at my house. Foods completion time per the sticker was 708pm. Why would they CONTINUE TO LIE to me?! I could have gone to pick it up like I had to last time. DON'T EVER ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE. 2 for 2 and I've had the same experience.

name: Geoff HockeyDad
text:
Great food & staff !!!!!!
Just remember, when you don't want to drive, thier drivers are out in bumper to bumper traffic. Delivery times varies due to traffic conditions, but you always get fresh, hot food!

text: Ordered half sausage, spinach, mushrooms. Full order of pepperoni.  Delivery was fast. Only had pepperoni and sausage. Did not get get what we ordered.

text: Best pizza I've had in a while! Super Hawaiian hand tossed was great! Really like the pepper and garlic sauce as an added treat! Great fast service if you order carryout. Convenient location to Gulf Shores public beach!

text: This place was a zoo on a Sunday night.  1 hour after ordering pizza still wasn't ready. We had to pick it up because we were told delivery would be 2 hours. Guess we should have just waited for the delivery guy. He and I would have returned with the pizza at the same time!!

name: Craig Baumgartner
text: Pizza is really good. I love their tomato sauce they use and they out on a good amount of cheese. Unfortunately the service was slow. They were slammed with customers (they were quoting an hour + wait time) and it took over 10 minutes to hand me my pizzas after they were put in the warming area.  I tried to get their attention but couldn't. They should take a lesson from Waffle House with their efficient assembly line setup. We will still come back because we love their pizza.

name: Jessie Zucnick
text: 3 hour wait for delivery..I called after 2 hours (internet wait time) and they said it would be another hour for delivery but my food was done.   I had to pay ahead for delivery and tip because they do contactless delivery..I asked them if I could just pick up my order since it was done.   I picked up my order and they refused to refund my tip for the driver and the delivery fee.

name: Cecily Berry
text: Pizza was great as always... employees were very dry, not feeling customer service friendly or just having a bad day. However, the pizza was good.

name: A U
text:

text: I placed an online order at this joint for carryout. After placing the order, their online system said it would take 70+ minutes for my order to be ready...it was one large pizza!? I immediately called to cancel the order and I swear the employee was acting like I was speaking to him in Spanish. I got tired of repeating myself and finally told him to forget it, that I'd just dispute the charge with my credit card company. I would definitely never order from them again. The employee acted like I couldn't speak English...so annoying!

However, whenever I called in after an hour to see the progress they told me that it was on it way and should be the first stop on the drivers list. After another 40 minutes, I called in again asking them to just cancel my order because the wait was ridiculously long and I was told a lie about when my pizza would be delivered. Terrible service. Which is sad, because I actually like Papa Johns pizza. #badservice #PapaJohnsdisappointed

name: Terri
text:
It was great when it first opened ... in fact my family loved the quality of the pizza and freshness of the ingredients! However, slowly the quality has declined. We order from there a lot and usually go pick up our order. They leave out sauces or extras that you order a lot. This really isn't much of an issue because I just ask them when I get there.

However, the consistency of quality of the food hasn't been good since around June. We order bread bites a lot from there and sometimes they are drenched in oil to the point that they ooze out a lot with every bite (not good) and others it is bone dry with not even sauce to dip them in (also not good). Sometimes the bites are REALLY undercooked and sometimes they are just right. I understand it is different employees making the pizza, but sometimes the stuff is good and other times I don't even eat it because it is inedible. Ordering now is a 50/50 gamble on whether I will actually be eating what they give me. The pizza is often the same (undercooked or just right).

Also one time they gave us a cheesy bread instead of bread bites and then when we called about it they basically called us liars. We just wanted what we ordered and we order from there A LOT.

Recently we have cut back on ordering from there because of the consistency issues. We used to order at least twice a week and now it is about once a month.

The manager also told me that 11:30pm is the last time you can place on line orders but the website say 12pm he's losing money for his store and for Dominos.

text: I have had great service from this location in the past until recently. I ordered a pizza and received the wrong one. It wasn’t a super big deal but I was given a free pizza for the future. Well tonight I ordered that pizza and I was told it was going to take between 35-45 mins to get it. I understand there are some nights that you are busy or down a driver but in the mean time watching the tracker the pizza had to go back in the oven because it had been sitting on the self for more than 30 mins. Finally, after waiting an hour I called in am was told it would be out soon. The gentleman was very polite and apologized for the inconvenience but I did end up canceling the order just because it was already so late and I was hungry. So it may be sometime before I order from this location again.

name: Melissa Marsh
text:
Online ordering was down so I stopped in to order and had to wait about 10 minutes for them to make the pizza and I was SO impressed by the comraderie between the employees there. Almost every employee made an effort to speak to me, they were cutting up with each other, helping each other, and simply enjoying their job. What a pleasant and professional group of people. I may wait on pizza again there.
Also, they do have seeing if you want to eat there and a special step for little ones to stand on and watch them work the dough.

name: Ailee Slaughter
text: If you're depirate or a job don't work here. You're under constant threat of termination, constant accusation and ridicule. The manager and owner harass and bully staff only to pay off customers who are unsatisfied or even robbed by employees, meanwhile  workers in the store can lose their job over giving one too many coupon or giving away sauce. Employees are not allotted breaks or even allowed to eat while on the clock all the while being yelled at and cussed out by customers unhappy with a policy that t cant change or bend out o fear of losing the only thing supporting their families. Workers are expected to close with one driver and one manager(sometimes from 9-close)as well as clean,sanitize,mop, make pizzas,handle money,deal with customers and not cancel any orders AND be out of the store within an hour of closing or run the risk of being accused of stealing time,money,or product. if you value our sanity you wont work here, an i you think you're a decent person try to be understanding because they're always being watched and cant help or comp as much as they'd like.

name: Beth Johnson
text:
Dear Lord. This Domino’s is so, so incredibly awful, words can’t adequately describe it. I’ve had a couple horrendous experiences w/ the McClellan Blvd. Domino’s-the time before last even warranted an apology call from a bigwig regional manager/owner in Birmingham, and he mailed me free large pizza coupon directly to my house...yea-the big guns got pulled, and the red carpet rolled out for me. 🙄
The very next order I placed (Nov. 2017, I believe) after receiving the Domino’s manager apology call-and while using the damn free pizza coupon he had just sent me-I wound up getting completely comped, and I didn’t even have to use the free pizza coupon! The food was THAT late, and prepared incorrectly THAT badly!
Now here I sit, waiting for a pizza delivery.....it’s been over an hour.....the app told me it got pulled out of the oven 45 minutes ago.....the store told me the driver “just left, he had like, 3-4 deliveries BEFORE yours”...and I tell myself, for the last time, I will never order Domino’s again-no matter HOW badly I don’t want to call Papa John’s.....at least Papa John’s does what they say they’ll do, and they actually deliver my order in under 2-3 hours...

text: I use to work there and I know for a fact they will clock out on a drive and still be there. I have order food twice from there and both times it took over an hour to bring my food I got tracker on my phone and when I called both times to ask where my food was she gave me an attitude and told me its on its way dame I thought that if it says 27 to 37 min and it takes 60 to 75 mins you was supposed to give me my food free or give me a discount next time I'm calling corporate

text: Not happy with what I ordered at all! I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and sausage,  it arrived plain, I  ordered BBQ wings and instead of them being cooked on the wings as they usually are. Delivery drivers have came to my brothers door asking for a tip while still smoking a cigarette. Also on the few occasions I ordered the delivery drivers had me get my own food out of the hot bag.

name: Deon Brown
text: I was there this evening and they were super busy. This worker with a big shaggy beard say man its gonna be a hour before you can get your pizza. I smiled and said i didn't mind waiting. 30 mins pass i walk outside to get away from the constent phone ringing with no answer. A little girl walks in and make an order as i watched thru the window. I went in the after the girl had order and asked the worker are you taking orders now after i been here now for 45mins. He told me once again sorry man we running behind i said sir u told me that 45 mins ago i dont want to argue that ill even write down my order on this napkin and did so,he said i got you. I step back outside watch him thru the window look at my order on the napkin. 10 mins after that i saw the worker look for someone(customer) i walked in and he said as to me as he walked by me toward outside i got you man. A second worjer came in and said why we only have to drivers im bouts to walk out on yall. First worker look at the second worker who just walkef in to get my order. I said to him you said you had me a hour ago he said he will get your order. The second worker shouted out take his order, i dont even know how to take orders. I then told the first worker im ok i understand here and left Dominos and went to lil caesars. The reason real was i believe i was a man of color and second worker was also a man of color... It still exists smdh.

name: Ricky Whitt
text:
GAVE IT A 1 STAR. BECAUSE ZERO STARS WERE NOT AN OPTION. I ORDER FROM THIS PLACE ONCE A WEEK. ALWAYS SPEND $45-65.00. BUT TONIGHT; CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER, DID NOT THINK MY $65.00 ORDER WAS A BIG ENOUGH CONTRIBUTION TO THEIR PROFIT MARGIN. I ORDER THE SAME ORDER EVERYTIME I ORDER. PAY SAME PRICE EVERYTIME I ORDER; BUT , TONIGHT CHRIS WAS GOING TO MAKE ME PAY MORE. $20.00 MORE. WAS HE NEEDING GAS MONEY. DID HE NEED GROCERY MONEY. WAS HE OUT OF CIGARETTES. I ASKED HIM HOW COME IT WAS HIGHER. HE SAID BECAUSE OF COUPONS. IMAGINARY COUPONS THAT HE IS THE KEEPER OF & GIVES OUT AS HE PLEASES OR DOESN'T PLEASE. HE DECIDED THAT DOMINO'S HE WORKS AT TONIGHT WAS SO FAR IN THE BLACK THAT HE DID NOT NEED MY SMALL CONTRIBUTION TO THEIR PROFIT FUNDS. CHRIS DECIDED TO TO LET HIS BIGGEST COMPETITOR;  PAPA JOHN'S , SHARE IN THEIR PRFIT SHARING. I AM SURE THAT CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER'S BOSS DOES NOT THINK THEY ARE FAR ENOUGH IN THE BLACK TO GIVE A $65.00 ORDER TO HIS COMPETITOR, PAPA JOHN'S. I BET THE OWNER AND FRANCHISER DOES NOT THINK THEY ARE FAR ENOUGH IN THE BLACK THAT $65.00 WOULD GOTO PAPA JOHN'S. SOUNDS LIKE MANAGEMENT TRAINING AT DOMINO'S IS NOT ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE. BUT MORE ABOUT CHRIS'S TITLE THAT HE WAS VERY PROUD OF. AND IN TELLING ME THAT THE MANAGER IN THE MORNINGS WOULD TELL ME THE SAME THING. GO TO PAPA JOHN'S THEN. I DONT THINK THAT IS PROPPER MANAGEMENT OF THIS SCENERIO. I COULD BE WRONG; BUT, CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER , PRETTY MUCH TOLD ME TO GOTO PAPA JOHN'S. WELL THANK YOU CHRIS, THE ASSISTANT MANAGER. I DID ORDER FROM PAPA JOHN'S. AFTER TELLING THEM THE ORDEAL I WENT THROUGH WITH YOU AND YOUR ORGANIZATION. THEY APOLOGIZED FOR YOUR ACTIONS, THANKED ME FOR MY BUSINESS, GAVE ME A DISCOUNT &  TOLD ME TO HAVE A GOOD NIGHT. PAPA JOHN'S EARNED MY BUSINESS TONIGHT. NOT ONLY DID THEY ESRN IT, CHRIS THE ASSISTANT MANAGER GAVE THEM MY BUSINESS.  CONGRATULATIONS ON YOUR PROMOTION CHRIS, THE ASSISTANT MANAGER. AND THANKS AGAIN FOR GIVING MY BUSINESS TO PAPA JOHN'S.
RICKY WHITT

name: Tracey Ferber
text: Last time I will ever go to this place. Called ahead and ordered. Had to wait for almost an hour after getting there for 3 hot n ready pizzas and an order of wings. Again I had called and placed the order in advance and was told 20 minutes. Arrived 30 minutes after placing the order and still had to wait another hour. There was literally at least 30 other people inside and outside waiting also. Got home and it was the WORST food we had ever gotten. A house full of 7 teenage boys and 2 adults and there was still 2 1/2 pizzas left afterwards. The wings were inedible. They looked and tasted like they were made the day before and set out overnight. Horrible...just horrible. Corporate will be getting a major complaint. They were refusing to refund money to those of us that were tired of waiting. The excuse was noone in the store was allowed to refund money and we would have to wait until the next day for the manager to deal with it. This store has gone downhill recently and is a waste of time and money. Never again!!!

text:
(Translated by Google) When you order your order over the phone, the service is bad when you get to pick it up. They give you 15 minutes and you arrive and it takes 1 hour for that reason it is a lousy service in the city where I live just a local

name: Bo sanders films
text:
(Translated by Google) Best pissa

(Original)

name: Katrina Bonds
text: My husband recommended dining here and it was walking distance from the Battle House Hotel where we stayed. The place is small but they offer some tables outdoors for dining. We opted to dine inside. Since it was a bit busy, there were a few tables needing to be bused. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. We order the Le Cadillac pizza, beer and Caesar salad. The food was very good! The playlist was 80’s music which we enjoyed.

name: Shalayna Goza
text: Pizza was great, they let us tweak a speciality pizza they had, server was friendly, we recommend the one called Le Cadillac.

name: Chris Wilson
text: Pizza and pasta dishes are great.  Nice to enjoy dinner out on the sidewalk

name: Jennifer Conroy
text: Got there the place look like it had been shut down for at least a couple of months. Don't know what's going on maybe it's due to the 19 but be aware call before you go

name: Joseph R. Elder
text: The pizza was wonderful and the Chianti was good. Our server was extremely competent and at the same time delightfully entertaining!

name: Katie Corley
text: We went around 7pm on a Saturday night. It was pretty busy but they were able to serve us quite quickly. We thoroughly enjoyed the fresh pizza and the calzone! The fresh mozzarella cheese made the calzone perfect. Highly recommend it.

name: Priscilla McCants
text: My husband took me here for a date and we both left disappointed and underwhelmed. The place is small but I was actually excited about that because I thought the food would be authentic and tasty. I ordered a calzone. Husband ordered spaghetti and meatballs. I cut into my calzone and noticed that the dough on the inside was raw and undercooked. It was so undercooked in the center that the cheese crumbles inside hadn't melted. The servers were nice but after waiting 10-15 minutes for them to replace my calzone for spaghetti and meatballs, I told my husband to get the check so we could go. I left hungry. My husband said the spaghetti and meatballs weren't that good either.

name: Jenny Mclester
text: My best friend has been talking constantly about this place so she finally took me to try it.  It did not disappoint.   We went on Thursday afternoon.   We ordered a couple of glasses of wine.  We started with the small Greek salad and the bruschetta. I can’t describe how good those 2 items were.  For our entree,   I had the Clam Sauce and linguine and she got the Shrimp Alfredo.    I can’t wait to bring my family back to try it.  This was amazing. The prices were very reasonable also!

name: Stephanie Creel
text: So so good! I highly recommend Le Cadillac!

name: Alec Bauman
text: A very nice and quaint little place. Great food and a good menu full of easy italian!

name: Ophelie Desmet
text: The pizza was fine, not bad and not great. The price was really cheap so I guess you get what you pay for and for the price I cannot complain. The service was lacking. They made several mistakes (wrong order, no cutlery) but that could be because the person was new. The place was cash only and charges for paying with card, however no one said anything until we noticed this charge on our bill.

name: Barbara Lambert
text: Best Calzone we've had. Nice, light crust easy to cut.  Very bug we could have shared one.  I got sausage and ham, hemusbamd got meatball. Buth scrumptious. Next time we're in Mibile, AL we will go back. Highly recommend

name: Isabelle Moseley
text: After coming here for the first time a couple of weeks ago we came back because everything had been so fantastic!! This round was pretty disappointing. About ten minutes after ordering the chicken Florentine pizza our server came back to tell us they had run out of spinach. Not a huge deal, but a little frustrating. I ordered an extra side of sauce with my pizza and was brought a bowl of sauce and charged $4. Not a bad price for a bowl of alfredo sauce, but not what I was expecting when asking for a side of sauce. Maybe a 2 ounce ramekin for $1-2, or even just a warning that it would be a larger portion for $4. Whatever, still not a huge deal. Service was slow and by the time we ordered dessert(about 20 minutes til close) they had run out of sweet tea. The cherry on top was tiramisu that was frozen completely solid. I will definitely be back to give this place another chance because the pizza is so so good. This trip was just not good.

name: Kristin Byrd
text: The food here was so delicious!!! I’ve been thinking about the pasta primavera since I left. I don’t know how the garlic sauce is cooked but heaven is in it. I had the meatball as an appetizer- delicious. Pizza- delicious. Absolutely NO complaints, at all. If you visit here, you will not be disappointed.

name: Christina McDaniel
text: Amazing little Italian restaurant in the heart of downtown Mobile. Amazing service and more amazing food!!

name: Nikki Gruner
text: This is a cute little Italian place with pizza and pasta. We had the gardenia pizza and it was fantastic! The service was very good and the food was inexpensive.

name: Meli Harrison
text: Very good service and the food was great and price was very reasonable also. Huge bowl of soup was $4. That plus a calzone was more than I could. Definitely recommend.

name: Baron Degenhardt
text: Had their Chicken Alfredo to go. Delicious! I would highly recommend.

name: Barbara Lambert
text: Best Calzone we've had. Nice, light crust easy to cut.  Very bug we could have shared one.  I got sausage and ham, hemusbamd got meatball. Buth scrumptious. Next time we're in Mibile, AL we will go back. Highly recommend

name: Scott Edwards
text: Great spot for pizza and pasta in downtown Mobile   fresh mozzarella tomato and basil antipasto and 2 types of pizza.  Small spot where you seat yourself.   No frills but the food is solid

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: You have to stop by when you are in the area. The pizza and pasta was delicious! The service was top notch. Also, the portion sizes were incredibly generous. The place has a homey feel and is simply decorated with pieces from local artists. I'll be back! #favorite #letsguide #mytopten

name: Sandrina Vaughn
text: The pasta was so yummy, and more now.

name: Baron Degenhardt
text: Had their Chicken Alfredo to go. Delicious! I would highly recommend.

name: Vijay Alagarraj
text:
Service was good but food was not: Cesar salad didn’t have enough dressing or croutons.
We got Gardenia pizza: it was soggy (May be from too much toppings?).

name: Ovad A Metab
text: Amazing pizza 🍕

name: Clay Lambert
text: This place was just a short walk from the Hampton Inn and had good reviews.  My wife had a sausage and ham Calzone and I had a meatball Calzone.  They were both delicious.  If you are in the area you should definitely eat here.

name: Pennie Ferrazzano
text: Excellent food and great service! Oh so yummy! The pasta Bolognese and Alfredo pasta were soooo good!

name: Soul Seasoned
text: Tiny pizzeria with authentic artisan pizza crust, nestled in a beautiful location with plenty of treelined, southern scenes. We got mushroom, onion and green olive on ours.  It came loaded with cheese.  Service was succinct but adequate.

name: Garrett Munguia
text: Pizzas were delicious. But they didn't have bottled water! I was only left with the option of coca cola products or alcoholic beverages. Very tasty!

name: Scott S
text: Wow... most excellent food! Home made! Large portions and a great staff!

name: Pennie Ferrazzano
text: Excellent food and great service! Oh so yummy! The pasta Bolognese and Alfredo pasta were soooo good!

name: Tarun Mutukuri
text: Good food for the prices they offer it at. Didn't know that the place was a cash only place and was charged a little surcharge when we paid with a card and we weren't informed of it before they charged the surcharge.

name: Jennifer Carter
text: Even though I just had a salad it was still good. Others had a meatball calzone that I tried and it was beyond good. Definitely worth another visit.

name: Kristen Cheek
text: Awesome food,  awesome service.  Definitely recommend! Can't wait too come back and visit. Best chicken salad sandwich ever.

name: Ashley Johnson
text: The single pizza slices were excellent 👌 but the inside of the establishment had flies disturbing us the entire meal. For 60 we expected to at least be served on regular plates and glasses not plastic. Lastly our pasta was completely disgusting and noodles we're over cooked. Not one person  finished their food. We definitely will not be returning here

name: D Workman
text: The Greek salad was amazing!

name: TheChowington
text:
I had one bad experience with this restaurant- I contacted the owner and he immediately went out of his way to make it right.
I waited a few months before I took him up on his offer of replacing my meal. I picked up my replacement meal today and it was spot on. I am glad they have a good owner who truly values his customers.

name: Shane Singleton Sr.
text: I work there we have good pizza and pasta any kind of pasta you want come on by and check it out

name: Talitha Wilson
text: I went with my family while they were visiting Mobile before heading out on a cruise. So we simply walked in off the street and received great customer service, the chicken Alfredo was the best I had ever tasted. And every dish that my family had eaten that evening was thoroughly enjoyed. I will be going back for sure. Please try this Italian pizzeria out if ever on Dauphin Street or in the area.

name: Vijay Alagarraj
text:
Service was good but food was not: Cesar salad didn’t have enough dressing or croutons.
We got Gardenia pizza: it was soggy (May be from too much toppings?).

name: Mike B
text: Pizza was great but waiter short changed me by $10.00

name: Michael Maree
text: In from out of town, some of the best pizza I've had. Crust is crisp on the outside and chewy inside. Real whole milk mozzarella! Pasta primavera was pretty good, slightly overcooked noodles but great veggies. Recommended.

name: Tecno-Advanced Concepts
text: Kindred, Arlene and Mellissa makes every visit to this place a memory to cherish... thx for feeding me... and treating me and my collegues so well... specially Kindred whom let us all enjoy her awesome blue and purple hair.   🥰😍😎😉

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: You have to stop by when you are in the area. The pizza and pasta was delicious! The service was top notch. Also, the portion sizes were incredibly generous. The place has a homey feel and is simply decorated with pieces from local artists. I'll be back! #favorite #letsguide #mytopten

name: Robin Luck
text: Stayed at a nearby hotel they delivered very quick.   Love love their Pizza and the Greek salad was so amazingly fresh and delicious.  I will order again,  great food!! Impressed

name: Michelle L.
text: Absolutely incredible. The whole place is charming and tucked next to the coolest bookstore. The pizza is incredible, and what I would describe as being the best pizza I've ever eaten. The Cadillac pizza tastes like the chef absolutely loves to cook. The staff is so friendly, the ambience delightful. I don't know when I've enjoyed a meal more.

name: Abdul Kader Surti
text: The pizza's are good, a bit on the pricey side. Wish the place looked better and has good seating options.

name: kraig Kitchens
text: Service and food were good, but the 75 health rating was concerning and they were understaffed for a Saturday night

name: Brian Shillingford
text: If I could rate this place higher than 5 stars I would.  "Pizzeria Delphina" is an adorable small local restaurant that serves fabulous pizza and possibly the best "Fettuccine Alfredo" I've ever had. If you're passing through downtown Mobile and feeling hungry. You have to stop here.

name: Chris Williams
text: Food was good, but not the best. Service was great. Prices were comparable to other restaurants around. They have beer and wine. Wish they had liquor.

name: John Leverette
text: Because I was a part of literally building the restaurant grand opening it and running it for over a year I have a hard time saying this because I'm no longer a part of it. They are excellent everything is top-notch you will not find better fare anywhere if you want truly good cooked food done properly and from scratch you will go there.

name: Aaron Headley
text: Excellent pizza! Tried the greco and a custom and both were excellent.

name: Mandy Touchstone
text: Always 5 star meal and service...DELICIOUS!

name: Bruce Whaleham
text: I’m allergic to gluten and I’m lactose intolerant and I ordered the normal fettuccine alfredo. I paid for the meal and the pain that came from my bodies inability to process those ingredients and I don’t regret my decision at all. 10/10 fantastic food and service, they were understaffed and they were very apologetic about it but still not a long wait.

name: ben barnett
text: The food tasted very fresh. It was great.

name: Minio Rodriquez
text: Absolutely loved it, was blown away from the flavor and value.  We sat inside, by a window.  Had the brushetta...large pie, a couple of sandwiches 😋 👌 and all was stellar.  Very large portions.  First time in mobile, we will be back.

name: JGirl Do
text: Friendly family style Italian food. Had the Puttanesca and it was delicious.  They chopped the olive mixture (Muffuletta style) in the sauce. The restaurant was busy. The prices were good and the service was great.

name: Damian Ferguson
text: Cool little spot close to the square. We were passing through on I-10 and was worth the stop. The pizza was great and the service was good - plus I love the name.  Good food for a good price.

name: Jessica Watkins
text: Great pizza..

name: Nicholas Bertagnolli
text: Best food around mobile and baldwin County by far.

name: Rocky Oubre
text: I love their pizza dough. 2 for 1 🍕 on Wednesday too🔥

name: Caisy CG
text: We ordered 2 Stromboli's and a pizza. Everything was delicious! The marinara sauce has such a fantastic, fresh basil and roasted garlic flavor(make sure to add some as a side if you get stromboli!) This was our first time trying it- I will definitely be getting dinner from here again! Next time, maybe,we will try pasta or a poboy, yummy 🙂

name: Ovad A Metab
text: Amazing pizza 🍕

name: Tammi Chase
text: Best little whole in the wall Pizzeria you will find. I recommend  the Cadillac pizza or one of their extremely large calzones!

name: Judah Sixsmith
text: My mom and I recently sat down for a late lunch and wine on the patio. If it's a beautiful day, sit outside! There's great Sundance Square people-watching. I usually prefer to sit inside at the bar, I love a good bar and Bird Cafe's is up there! But when the weather is great, it's definitely patio time

name: Po La
text: Ordered a large parma pizza (their largest is 14 inch which is medium at other places) and 2 small greek salads which cost me $43.50. Totally tasteless like they forgot spices exist. Dough was wet and soggy from watered down sauce which had zero salt and also no taste. Greek salad was ok, not a big fan of the chopped olive salad on top, surprisingly dressing was very good. Pizza was not good so I'm  giving only 1 star, Italian restaurant should know how to do it right as pizza is a staple.

name: Colt Mandy
text:
Great hole-in-the-wall Italian join downtown. Very casual, laid back place with a handful of patio tables. I ordered the Greek salad (which came with feta and shredded cheddar cheese?) which was decently sized for a small salad, with a giant scoop of olive salad on top. Good if you love olives!

For my main I had the pasta primavera which was a huge portion for a small (they also have a large option), and had plenty of fresh slices of zucchini. There was too much olive oil, but it had a nice flavor and will make a nice lunch tomorrow!

Pizzas and calzones look solid but the pastas and salads looked the best from what I observed.

Service was just ok but pretty efficient. The bar selections are limited to a few beers and wines, but definitely enough to wash down a hearty, carby meal. Will definitely be back for a quick bite.

name: caitlin walsh
text: If I could give this place zero stars I still don't think that would be enough. We heard good things about this place and were in town visiting so decided to try it. We sat down and ordered almost right away, and over an hour into waiting still had not received the side salads. After finally getting the salad, not even two minutes later we got ONE of the two entrees. The pasta dish was cold and lacked anything exciting. The breadstick it came with was stale and could break teeth. 35 minutes later the second entree arrived(a sandwich) that was supposed to be salami and but had bologna on it. Before the sandwich arrived we had asked for boxes and a check. We also ordered half of the items, and was charged for a whole. We had to take our food to go, after over 1.5 hours of waiting, and then did not eat it because of the quality. Save your money, squid inks just around the corner is way better. The staff was less than welcoming or apologetic.

name: Sean O'Neill
text: Very pleased with our pizza.  Not the best pizza I've ever had but definitely a repeat place to visit when back in Mobile.  The service was very nice and quick.

name: Clayton Stanley
text: Terrible customer service. Were basically told we couldn't eat there.

name: Jason Whiddon
text: Excellent Italian, just stay away if on diet!

name: A Hunter
text: Food is good, more than enough on your platter. Staff could be a bit more welcoming. Pricing, well it is on Dauphin St downtown so I guess that's why they charge so much? Overall good food, great location.

name: Katherine Blankenhorn
text: Had an amazing dinner the last night of the 1065 concert series. The food was great and so was our service.

name: Susan Nettles
text: I love the cozy atmosphere, but the food is the star of the show. The calzones are incredible and the pasta is authentic and fresh. I highly recommend.

name: QUAWON BATTISTE
text: Best 🍕 in Mobile! I even forget my credit card and they were able to make accommodation for me.  P.S. No, I didn't have to wash the dishes.

name: Jasper Brock
text: Great pizza even better staff

name: TJ McMeans
text: Great food as always!

name: Doris Windham
text: When you are in Mobile do eat here.

name: Jaime Asatsuyu Hammack
text: Get the marinated feta. The bread that comes with it is magical even on its own, and paired with the herby, oiled feta cubes? Incredibly delicious.

name: Jessie Quarterman
text: A Great personal and comforting environment! Very Professional staff helps your experience here worth every visit!

name: Thomas Moynihan
text:
LOVE this place. Such a quaint hole in the wall that serves some of the best pizza I have found in the Mobile area. I absolutely enjoy the Le Cadillac and the pasta dishes too.

I will say that because it's a small place, it's hard to get a table sometimes, so make sure you get there before 6 or so on busy days!

name: Dustin Judice
text: Pizza and pasta is excellent, great service for dine in or take out. My favorite pizza place is Mobile.

name: Theodore Veterinary
text: Great Handmade Pizzas!  Our staff loves when we order pizza for everyone.

name: Monica Raybon
text: The Le Cadillac pizza with added feta cheese was the bomb..... there is not a bad menu item  in this place

name: Dylan Daughety
text: Pizzeria Delphina is a cozy little restaurant with great food and quality service. I highly recommend  a visit if you are downtown Mobile looking for a bite to eat.

name: Jim Valente
text: The BEST Pizza and Pasta in downtown Mobile.

name: Gage McLain
text: OMG you are missing out if you don't go eat here. The atmosphere is great for dates and family dinners out. They give you so much food that you can't eat it all. The waitress we had was so nice. I highly recommend coming to eat here

name: Jennifer Gardner
text: Wonderfully delicious pizza!! Stromboli was delicious as well. Good prices. Large portions!

name: Diana Propper de Callejon
text: Excellent pizza, crispy crust! The salads are delicious. Nice casual place with seating outside. Highly recommended

name: Stephanie Young
text: Food is always good.  Today there was a long wait and we had to get out food to go.

name: Charlotte
text: I am vegan and the Capellini pasta is phenomenal.

name: Lorenzo Winters
text: While recently in Mobile, my wife and I decided to check out Pizzeria Delphina given the good reviews. My wife, being the adventurous one, suggested we try the La Greco. All I can say is Wow. The feta cheese was generously spread over the pizza but the olive salad (a mixture of several olive types) was the big surprise. We love a thin crust and this crust did not disappoint. The pizza was magnificent. We sat in the front window and enjoyed the people watching and pizza. The service was excellent. It was a special lunch.

name: Noble Taylor
text: I can't count the number of times I've had a cheese pizza before. This place makes cheese pizza that tastes better than most other stores Gourmet Pizza. Best mozzarella I have ever had at a restaurant

name: Eric Jones
text: The food is superb. Highly recommend if nearby.

name: Dillon Allen
text: Great handmade pizza in the heart of Mobile. I never end a night after Pizzeria Delphina with room left in my belly. Great menu, but also offers fully customizable pizzas. The meatballs are wicked good. Just give it a try!

name: Coty Alexander
text: Delicious pasta and pizza in a little building. Service is always amazing.

name: David Carpenter
text: Food is delicious.  Atmosphere is quaint.  Every time we have been there the service is good.  If you are in Downtown Mobile, this place is definitely worth a try.

name: Dillon Allen
text: Great handmade pizza in the heart of Mobile. I never end a night after Pizzeria Delphina with room left in my belly. Great menu, but also offers fully customizable pizzas. The meatballs are wicked good. Just give it a try!

name: Noble Taylor
text: I can't count the number of times I've had a cheese pizza before. This place makes cheese pizza that tastes better than most other stores Gourmet Pizza. Best mozzarella I have ever had at a restaurant

name: Stephanie Dwyer
text: The best Caesar salad I’ve had in a long time. Definitely an establishment where you get more bang for the buck and I loved the simplistic atmosphere. The waitstaff works as a team so you interact with several upbeat personalities. The meatballs were perfect and the Alfredo Sauce is worth going back for. I was even happy with the 𝑯𝒐𝒖𝒔𝒆 Pinot. Highly recommend!

name: Wendy McElroy
text: Had the BEST pizza and service! Such a neat little place!!

name: Coty Alexander
text: Delicious pasta and pizza in a little building. Service is always amazing.

name: Edward Newman
text: The wait staff were all very pleasant small cozy atmosphere but that was all that was small the portions are large. You by far get your money's worth and then some. I had the chicken fettuccine alfredo and it was delicious

name: David Clark
text: I have had their pizzas a few times and they are very good. They also serve a variety of typical Italian dishes which are mostly good. The service is usually good, but sometimes getting your food can be a little slow. The restaurant is fairly small and can get crowded at times, so plan accordingly. Pizzeria Delphina is located in a old storefront in downtown Mobile and the surroundings are pleasant.

name: Casey Roberts
text: Great food and wait staff. If I'm downtown I usually eat here for lunch. Never a disappointment. Try the marinated feta

name: Erica Davis
text: The food was good, but the place is tiny with hardly any seating. We sat outside and the table felt like it was about to fall apart. Really an awkward experience

name: David Carpenter
text: Food is delicious.  Atmosphere is quaint.  Every time we have been there the service is good.  If you are in Downtown Mobile, this place is definitely worth a try.

name: Ina Washington
text: The pizza was GREAT! We come here every year when we go to our conference.  The staff was super nice!

name: Valarie Smith
text: Good friendly businesses. The PIZZA was great!   After a visit  to the Monsters Truck. I was happy to see they stayed open to serve us'Thank all and Tia :~)

name: Laura W
text: I went here twice. Once with my sister and once with my boyfriend. Both times it was absolutely amazing. I ordered a margherita pizza and it was delicious. My boyfriend actually grew up in Italy and he said the pizza was amazing too.

name: Lloyd Logue
text: Great service and pizza...Pesto Scampi!

name: Stephanie Dwyer
text: The best Caesar salad I’ve had in a long time. Definitely an establishment where you get more bang for the buck and I loved the simplistic atmosphere. The waitstaff works as a team so you interact with several upbeat personalities. The meatballs were perfect and the Alfredo Sauce is worth going back for. I was even happy with the 𝑯𝒐𝒖𝒔𝒆 Pinot. Highly recommend!

name: David Clark
text: I have had their pizzas a few times and they are very good. They also serve a variety of typical Italian dishes which are mostly good. The service is usually good, but sometimes getting your food can be a little slow. The restaurant is fairly small and can get crowded at times, so plan accordingly. Pizzeria Delphina is located in a old storefront in downtown Mobile and the surroundings are pleasant.

name: Chris Davinroy
text: We are on vacation from St Louis and only in Mobile for one night. I had a huge lunch in Memphis so I wasnt very hungry but my wife was. We decided on pizza and splitting a salad. Knowing the portions back home, we ordered a large salad - that was a HUGE mistake. The operative word is huge because that's the size of the portions! We also ordered a small pizza (which was the perfect size for us to split) and the only thing "wrong" with it was that I could have used extra cheese on top to help hold on the toppings. Thanks for taking care of us PD!

name: Erica Davis
text: The food was good, but the place is tiny with hardly any seating. We sat outside and the table felt like it was about to fall apart. Really an awkward experience

name: Brett Williams
text: Best pasta in the city hands down. They were packed and our service was still prompt and courteous. Dope atmosphere too.

name: Shoals Yakkin' with Hatch
text: Awesome little pizza place with an awesome Stromboli and good red wine.

name: Christopher Goens
text: Cozy atmosphere, great food at a reasonable price for such large portions, and friendly service. Will definitely be going many more times!

name: John Martin
text: Best chicken ceasar salad in a long time, her pasta primavera with added shrimp was good as well.

name: Peter Trivanovich
text: Good pizza.

name: Connie Caraway
text: Fun little store. Nice restrooms :-)

name: Chase Nelson
text: Flies everywhere, rude staff when we walked in to place an order, and when paying they do not even inform the customer they charge you to pay with a credit card. They simply don’t want to pay the merchant processor the small fee when collecting profit. So they just double up. Last time I checked, we you take money from someone without notice or permission it’s called theft!

name: Jason Fountain
text: The servers and food is fabulous

name: Shane “LIL KILLA” Singleton Sr.
text: Thjs is where i work at....

name: Yaminou Oyeossi
text: Drove off the highway to get some real food. Came to the closest pizzeria I could find and then walked around downtown Mobile. A lot of history in these buildings.

name: Aimee Sherrod
text:
**update**
Server was super nice and the food is amazing. Food is 5 star for sure, but couldn’t get over the first impression. My advice? Order takeout from them.

First impression is a one star. I’ll update if anything changes.

Just walked in. There were two other couples in line in front of us. One couple walked out after being ignored and ran over by staff. The next couple consisted of a very pregnant young woman and her date. They also were ignored and ran over. They finally left.

I stopped a staff member to inquire if we were to just seat ourselves or??? I was told there’s a waitlist and then she rushed off. No idea where this list was. Open table. Open seats at the bar. We waited a bit longer and finally got seated.

I’ll update when the food comes out.

name: Tosha Thibeau
text: We went in here while on our way to Gulf Shores on vacation and they treated my family and I so great. The waitress we had was amazing - especially with our autistic son. She really made him feel special!

name: Chase Nelson
text: Flies everywhere, rude staff when we walked in to place an order, and when paying they do not even inform the customer they charge you to pay with a credit card. They simply don’t want to pay the merchant processor the small fee when collecting profit. So they just double up. Last time I checked, we you take money from someone without notice or permission it’s called theft!

name: Chris Jones
text: Best greek salad my wife has ever had. Friendly and speedy staff. Cozy atmosphere indoors. Outside seating available.

name: David Hawkins
text: I'm from NY and am always on the hunt for good pizzeria/Italian places and this was a great find! Not very many places along the gulf coast do pizza and Italian very well, but Delphina is one of the best. Very reasonable prices and very generous portion sizes.

name: E Davis
text: Was ok decent prices ok good cozy atmosphere and friendly staff.

name: Jason Fountain
text: The servers and food is fabulous

name: Yaminou Oyeossi
text: Drove off the highway to get some real food. Came to the closest pizzeria I could find and then walked around downtown Mobile. A lot of history in these buildings.

name: Nicolas Bertrand
text: Stayed in Mobile and saw that this pizza place had a lot of good reviews. Sadly, I was disappointed. Ordered a large pepperoni for $17 and it was the size of most mediums. The cheese was the best part. Other than that it lacked flavor, sauce and the crust was burnt and hard in a few spots. I expected a lot more and was let down.

name: Jordan Greiner
text: It's a small quiet pizzaria, amazing location, interesting menu options, and the most amazing Feta appetiser that I've ever had!

name: phillip zangas
text: Awesome food and even better service!

name: James Daigle
text: Meatball app was awesome. Pizza was made with fresh veggies. Overall really good experience.

name: James Daigle
text: Meatball app was awesome. Pizza was made with fresh veggies. Overall really good experience.

name: Paul Griffin
text: I ordered a Chicken Parm PoBoy. Couldn't eat it all. Largest PoBoy I've ever seen. Ever.  Cheap too. Highly recommended.

name: Dave Hardin
text: Pizza was tasty with homemade sausage. Maybe a hair on the pricey side but I'll be back for sure. Great service and place was clean.

name: Oscar Manuel Castillo Jimenez
text: Best pizza ever!!!

name: Esteban Serrano
text: Top 3 pizza I've ever eaten! Great food, great attention and it is located in a good place of town. I easily recommend it to anyone who likes a great thin-crusted pizza or would like a great almond cheesecake. Just yum.

name: Alexis Cole
text: Simply delicious & great service!

name: Christina Smith
text: Amazing Mexican pizza and chicken alfredo!!!! Definitely recommend!!

name: Laura Lee
text: Great local pizza place. It was a little tough to find, but well worth the hunt. We had bruschetta and a couple of pizzas. So delish!

name: Patrick Robison
text:
Staying in downtown Mobile and hotel suggested this establishment.  Never got the opportunity to try the so called "amazing" food!  I'm sure it is good as it came highly recommended.  I would not spend one dime of my $$ in here as the owner is a complete jerk.  Servers were more than happy to help us with a party of 7, but the owner made us move the tables that the servers said to put together.  Now I didn't mind that and completely understood the issue but his attitude was terrible.  Told me there were plenty of other places to eat around there. Lol.

Okay....we did and had an amazing dinner right down the street.  Maybe he was just having a bad day but don't think so...everyone seemed scared of him.  What an idiot!  Still sorry I didn't get to taste the food cause we did hear it was great.  Probably cause he's not cooking it.  Feedback given to hotel as well.

name: James A. Mazzaro
text: Tried the caprese salad, a meatball, and the pesto scampi pizza. The caprese was good, the tomato was the only weak spot. The meatball was very tasty, well complemented my the house marinara. The pizza was also top notch. Too bad I don’t live anywhere near here or I would definitely be a regular. Service by Melissa was exemplary.

name: Jake Apperson
text: Went on the advice of local hotel employee while we were in Mobile for the weekend. Could not have been happier with the place. The cafe area was a bit small but we were there before a rush started so we had a great table and view. Food was AMAZING!

name: Garrett C
text:
BEWARE: Current Google maps information is misleading. The website and a few of the images displayed are from another restaurant in California.

We went expecting something different, given the images presented on Google, so when we first arrived we were a bit confused, but decided to go with it anyway. No appetizers are offered, which is disappointing. Our service was friendly and our pizza was served quickly (within 15 minutes or so). We were both pretty impressed and would most likely return.

name: Oscar Manuel Castillo Jimenez
text: Best pizza ever!!!

name: Alexis Cole
text: Simply delicious & great service!

name: Max D
text: Pizza was excellent!

name: Christina Smith
text: Amazing Mexican pizza and chicken alfredo!!!! Definitely recommend!!

name: Harvey Ozbirn
text: One of the best pizzas I have eaten!  Geaux Cajuns!

name: Kellyn Dickerson
text: Every time I go here it's always great customer service, great prices, and amazing food. I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a local pizza place.

name: Katherine Sprinkle
text: Their calzones and breadsticks are awesome! I'm picky about my pasta, and didn't quite care for theirs. Quick service, great prices! One order of breadsticks is enough to fill me up (it's the size of a small pizza) and is less than $4 after tax.

name: Dottie Byron
text: Great pizza. Great atmosphere. Great place. If there's a wait, sit at the bar. It's worth it.

name: John Sipperley
text: So delicious. Friendly staff, but easily overwhelmed. So go when it is slow. I go at lunch and sit at the bar, typically alone with easy access to service.  But I can see this dropping stars, having watched the service to other tables. Fortunately, that has not yet been my experience.

name: Matt Cobb
text: The pasta, especially the carbonara, is very good and you get a lot of it. The pizza is very good as well.

name: Nik Martin
text: Good pizza, but there's a weird vibe in the restaurant, and previous reviews suggest it's due to the owner's personality. The staff is friendly, but act like they're scared to be too friendly or else they might get in trouble. It's like everyone is under a lot of stress, and it sort of transferred over to my party while we were there. We just couldn't get relaxed while we were there. They have an old school gas deck oven that turns out really good pizza, but it would honestly be 100% better without the stressful vibe we got while dining. Maybe the owner should step away and hire a manger to run the front-of-house, that has better customer service skills.

name: Todd Fowler
text: Cadillac Pizza and Carbonara Pasta are fantastic!

name: Tabatha White
text: The best pizza & pasta I have ever had every thing is made from scratch and to order. If you ever get a chance I promise you will love it!!!! The staff is very friendly and service was top notch!!! Will be back for sure!!!!

name: Mari Flores
text: The food was good, especially the pasta dishes. They have large portions and great friendly service. I would eat there again.

name: Jesse Jordan
text: TBH the pizza was average, our large margarita was a little oily but did have good flavor. Crust was also very well done. Staff was quick with our order and had no shortage of great stories to tell. Not gonna find anything better downtown.

name: Agent Phrosty
text: Glad I didn't pay much attention to the one star reviews. Came to Mobile overnight to visit with a friend for his birthday. We walked in around 930 and we were promptly greeted and served drinks. Ordered the Cadillac pizza... Ten minutes tops from ordering to the table. Toppings were generous, crust and sauce both were very good. Never had to ask for refills. Would definitely recommend.

name: Mike Baucom
text: Went during Art Walk so it was packed as expected. Good food, "hole in the wall' atmosphere, friendly staff. Will definitely go again.

name: Kevin Henry
text: My favorite pizza in Mobile comes from this restaurant.

name: Katherine Sprinkle
text: Their calzones and breadsticks are awesome! I'm picky about my pasta, and didn't quite care for theirs. Quick service, great prices! One order of breadsticks is enough to fill me up (it's the size of a small pizza) and is less than $4 after tax.

name: Ashley Wiggin
text: Amazing pizza! Some of the best crust I've had. Service was not so great on the other hand. Not very attentive.

name: Marcus Tollens
text: Really good pizza.

name: Joe Carrizales
text: I ordered take out. The pizza is good. Had a glass of wine while I waited. Ladies were friendly and awesome. I would definitely come back.

name: Mike Keown
text: Absolutely the best place we have eaten in a long time. Everything was excellent. Really glad we stopped here.

name: Ryan Reiff
text:
Dropped our pizza. Only told us about it after the fact.  Pizza was ok, but dripping with grease....like the crust was wet with a slight crunch. So if you have a hour before you want to eat,  this place is for you.  Btw carryout your food  because the restaurant is like 200sqft, plus you'll actually get your pizza in a timely manner.

Other fun fact: charges you a cc fee to pay them.

Oh one more thing if you walk there,  bums will ask you for money.

To sum it all up. If you want to wait to eat wet pizza ,pay extra, and feel like you're a  burden. Eat here.

Oh and I thing the manger hate kids.

name: Sally Wood McDonald
text: Wonderful service and delicious food;

name: Chris Golden
text: Washed it down with some strawberry cake.  And get this.....with me and my party of 3 teenagers and 3 kids, we were only $7 more than my ChickFilA order.  Whereby my mobile app order crashed and burned for the ChickFilA option.  But that's another story.  And don't get me started on Subway nearby.  Dude!!!!

name: Kari Carlson
text: Portion sizes are huge.  Greek salad was great.  Lunch service is a tad slow for getting your order or refilling your drink.   Food is very filling.

name: Stephen Diamante
text: Depends on the staff for what sort of expirence you will receive during your visit. Do not call in a pick up order because they will overcharge you for an incorrect order.

name: Kari Carlson
text: Portion sizes are huge.  Greek salad was great.  Lunch service is a tad slow for getting your order or refilling your drink.   Food is very filling.

text: Very small. We spent $50 including tip for the two of us. The marinara sauce is wonderful.

name: Deana Keefer
text: Way too much food on small spaghetti plates. I assume some people like that.  Then my son got diarrhea right after eating there and my daughter in law got had heart burn.  Neither are usually sensitive to such stomach ailments.

text: Pizza had too much of a spice on it. I'm not sure what. It was a strange taste. Spaghetti lacked flavor. Kind of over priced for the quality you get.

text: Cute little place with friendly staff, but poor food, hardly flavored. Ridiculously large portions. Hygiene seems issue. Food gave us indigestion afterwards.

text: Really good place. The food was great and the staff was nice. I will return.

name: alex poston
text: Service wad awesome.  Friendly staff.

name: Gail Jackson
text: Tasty Shrimp Alfredo!   Ordered small portion.  Large enough for two to share.

name: Jesse Almodovar
text: Pizza and chicken Parm is really delicious and the Marinara sauce is also delicious. Price could be better being that a large is only a 14' pizza..I'm grim NY and over their a large is at least a 16 or 18. So if give them a 4 out of 5 because of that. Would not recommend to take a big family either as they don't have a lot of space to sit.

name: Mark Roche
text: Great food and a good atmosphere... pizza was classic and delicious. The pasta was traditional with great flavors.

name: Carl Smith
text: Very good pizza. Brusetta was the best

name: Noah Weitkemper
text: Took well over an hour to get a cheese pizza and a bowl of fettuccine Alfredo with chicken.  After 40 minutes I asked the waitress if she forgot to drop my order to which she told me no and began to argue with me only to produce the receipts and show that she had waited almost 9 minutes to drop my order my problem was I paid when I ordered a to go order the owner showed up before my food came out and one of his regular customers that had been sitting at the bar the entire time I was waiting for my pizza told him that there was an issue with me. He comes over to find out what the issue is and I explained to him how it's been forever since I ordered a cheese pizza and a bowl of pasta for my kids that are in the hotel Room starving to which he apologized and went to ask the waitress what was going on. She whispered to him that I was being belligerent and rude even though that is entirely untrue the patron at the bar can attest to that. The owner then turned to me and explain to me how the customer is not always right as if I had been causing a problem to which I explained to him the only issue I've created was when I asked where my order was at no time was I ever belligerent and he should talk to people around to find out the truth before just blindly believing his head waitress. In the end he felt he should give me my money back I got my pizza the fed achenia turned out to be linguine the chicken was so overcooked it was in edible. The pizza was great the service was total  Krapp. The airconditioner in the front of the store is leaking water so much that they had to empty a picture and it was all over the floor entire time. There are plenty of other eateries around I would not waste my time here unless you are in absolutely no hurry at all whatsoever and there's no other customers in the restaurant.

resp.text: Yea Noah i did talk to the customer at the bar after you left. He told me a total different version than the one you told. You gotta admit you were acting way over the top about a ten minute dispute. More than one customer came up and said not to reprimand the server that it was you that was being rude and belligerent as soon as you came in. You got your order in a reasonable time. And I did comp it for you. Your reporting a leaking ac unit on a review? Really? It leaked for a couple hours and was repaired. Thanks Noah business is bustling, ac is fine.

name: Paul Rondem
text: Good pizza, cold beer and friendly folks.

name: Jordan Carr
text: Food was great, portions were larger than expected.

name: Michael Funkhouser
text: Great pizza and reasonable prices. Server was friendly and fast. They genuinely want you to enjoy your meal and enjoy your visit. Will visit again when in the downtown area.

text: Nothing like a fresh hand made pizza

name: Dave M

name: Aphry Olafsen

name: Autism Mom
text: It is always a "must go" while in Mobile or on our way through to the beach. We absolutely love it!

name: Eric Trice
text: Got takeout. Pizza was good with a good selection

name: Roy Austin
text: Nice laid back place to have a drink a good pizza or pasta.  Friendly servers.

name: George Leyva
text: RUDE, very very disorganized. Badly run. I don't care how their pizza is because guess what I was unable to eat it. Besides they probably getting the business because they have no competition. I waited 1 hour for my pizza only to learn I got the wrong pizza. No apologies, NOTHING. They get easily overwhelmed. Run by a bunch of amateurs. Sad Mobile Alabama does not have other choices to give these clowns a run do their money. Go somewhere else if you can but whatever you do don't order from them if you see they are busy. They're gonna mess up your order.

name: Casey Hughes
text: Great food!  Service was slow but the food made up for it!

name: jeremy johnson
text: Food wasn't bad. Only 2 servers in the front of house. One must have been new.

name: Justin Jay Wiley
text: Absolute best service I have experienced in a long time. The server knew I just moved to Mobile earlier today and really welcomed me with attentive service, excellent food and overall caring attitude.

name: Jamelle Jones
text: Great place when u have time to sit down and eat. Local artist paintings  are sold inside.

name: Shannon Bender
text:
A note to the owner / manager:

We had a TERRIBLE experience at your establishment because of the awful service. Would give no stars if I could.

We came to Pizzeria Delphine on a Sunday evening based on the great reviews of your food, however we were not even able to try the food due to the horrible service we received, on top of the fact you made us the wrong pizza after we waited nearly an hour.

When we arrived, it was clear that your restaurant was busy, and the three young girls you had as servers were CLEARLY OVERWHELMED and NOT PROPERLY TRAINED to handle more than a handful of tables.

We stood in front waiting for someone to acknowledge us, while your servers ran around stressed out, and a woman whom I assume was a manager sat behind the counter and was writing things down on a clipboard, and answering the phone - even though we had called three times prior to stopping by to place our to-go order and NO ONE ANSWERED THE PHONES.

Eventually, I stopped one of the servers on her way to a table and told her we want to place an order, she wrote it down in her notepad and then ran out the door to take care of other tables. Didn't ask for our name or number to call when it was ready.

We stood around for another 10 minutes waiting for her to come back so we could tell her to get our number to call us when it was ready. She told us it would be about 30 minutes and they would call.

Almost an hour later, we received no phone call and I had to call them to ask if it was ready, which they said it was.

I walked back over from our hotel, paid for our pizza, only to find out when I opened the box (because they clearly didn't check it) that she had put the wrong order in for our pizza.

At that point we told them we just wanted a refund.

WE RECEIVED NO APOLOGIES FROM YOUR INCOMPETENT AND UNTRAINED STAFF, JUST AN ATTITUDE.

I don't care how good the pizza is, your service was awful.

name: Mallorie Halsall
text: Hands down, best pizza in Mobile.

name: Lynne Cary
text: Great cozy place. Food is very good.  We will be back.

name: Sebastian Santiago
text: Best pizza in town. Great atmosphere and affordable prices. Come in !

name: David Gray
text: Awesome pizza in an authentic Italian pizzeria

name: Doris
text: Their Calzones are delicious! Today my husband ordered a Stromboli. Oh my! So delicious! That's what I will order on our next visit.

name: Stefan Stefan
text: Great little Pizza and more place in downtown Mobile. Downtown Mobile is great

name: Burl Ratcliffe
text: Great pizza, wonderful service, really good meatballs

name: Aaron Howard
text: Amazing pizza, great service right in downtown Mobile.

name: Clinton Hernandez
text: Found this buzzy pizza place after a parade. Friendly atmosphere and good service. We had Linguine Bolognese and a pizza. The portions are huge so go for the small size. Generous pour of wine too. Recommended. During Mardi Gras we ate here 3 times. Once we got Pizzas to go while staying at the Hilton Garden Inn then dinner the next night and again a late lunch the next weekend before the MOT parade. The service is excellent.

name: Clay Ponder
text: Nice cozy place right down town. Good food and good service.

name: A C
text: Best pizza and PASTA place in downtown! Very kind and attentive staff also.

name: Charles Benjamin Jr.
text: Only one word for this place excellent awesome service awesome food friendly atmosphere excellent menu choices I will definitely be back

name: Courtney Bradford
text: Omg I love there pizza's I can eat there jus about ever day 🍕🍕🍕🍕🍕👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾

text: Come hungry because the portion sizes are huge. Very tasty to boot. Will definitely be returning.

name: Payton Rogers
text: Had the ham and sausage calzone which was absolutely delicious! Will for sure be coming back again.

name: Frank Rubino
text: Great service!  Pizza delicious!  We will return (from Fairhope).

name: James K Ball
text: Best pizza in Mobile.

name: Michael Waters
text: Amazing pizza (we had pepperoni and also the Cadillac), Greek salad great, meatball delicious, great service from Kennedy! Definitely recommend it!

name: Bob Fox
text:
I am staying at a local hotel on business with no transportation as we are transported to our events so I thought I would order something delivered. I called Delfina's and a rude young female answered. I told her I couldn't see her on line menu & she insisted it was there. When I asked her the cost of a small pizza delivered she told me they don't deliver even though the ad says different. When I asked her what the costs would be she said she didn't have a clue. Maybe she's got that right.
Too many good restaurants in Mobile SO I'll not recommend & will find something else.

resp.text:
Bob sorry about the confusion.  We do not deliver but we sub it out to people who do. They charge a small percentage and delivery charge. We do not know what your total will be after they include their fee. If you go to the Port City Delivery App or the WAITR App you will see the menus on there with the pricing. It's all gone high tech now days. We are only a couple of blocks from most of the hotels and you can call to p
ick it up and usually ready within twenty minutes. As far as the rudeness I apologize. This restaurant is very small and can get very loud. We have to speak loudly and have a difficult time hearing so it can be confused, HE. Thanks Bob

name: Kirsten Schwehm
text: We ran through on the way from Florida to Baton Rouge - holy moley, that is authentic Italian food! We had pizza, pasta, and salads, and everything was fresh and delicious. The service was great and we were in and out quickly, thoigh everything was clearly cooked to order. The bathroom is tiny and ramshackle, but that could not diminish our enthusiasm!

name: Tanisha Williams
text: Finally made here and boy was it everything I thought it would be!!! It was packed due to  Mardi Gras and the service was friendly and fast!!! The pizza was delicious I couldn’t believe how good it was being from Pittsburgh were you have real Italians cooking your pizza I am very picky about my pie. But these guys blew me away I felt like I was home again!!! It’s a must try and I will be back more often to try other dishes they all looked amazing while I was there!!! But again the pizza was a hit!!!

name: Zack TX
text: Great pizza, good place for lunch, friendly stuff.

name: Justin Congo King NYC
text: I'm a Mobile native and vocalist! I left here in 99' for college! I recently moved back home after 5 years in New Orleans!! Upon coming back home 6 months ago,  I was treated as an outsider in my own hometown ! I'm a street performer who will sing anywhere, and usually scoffed at while performing on daulphin St. ;however there are some Managers and business owners that welcome me to sing near their location!! I've never eaten here,as I'm a poor man who eats at home, but I do know that the Owner,  Management , and Staff are warm, friendly, and hospitable! THANKS GUYS FOR LENDING YOUR EARS AND BEING SUPPORTIVE DURING THIS VERY DIFFICULT TRANSITION!! LET'S SPREAD THIS ETHIC TO NOT ONLY DOWNTOWN MOBILE, BUT ALL OVER THE CITY OF MOBILE, BUT ALL OVER THE WORLD!!

name: *Top Tier Predator*
text: Ive had just about every pizza available in mobile county especially all the top rated pizza spots according to the online ratings & pizzeria delphina is the best ive had so far! After having my first slice of there pizza i dont see how pizza could get any better.. when i took my first bite it was unexplainable how heavenly it tasted.. i literally felt like i melted in my seat as i chewed on that scrumptious bite of heaven.   I love the fact that the pizza seems to be cooked in either a coal fire or wood fire brick oven as it gives the new york thin like crust a good crispy crust but yet not hard like a brick.. it was perfect & just the way i like it 😁 i never been to new york (home of the supposedly best pizza in the world) but it would be hard for me to believe they can can make a pizza any better than this.. its a little pricey but its well worth it whenever u got the money to spend.. do yourself a favor & stop by.. this is now my favorite pizza place of all time but i will continue to look & taste test other pizza places in near by areas & hopefully get to go to new york one day & test there pizza to see how it measures up ☺

text: So I had never ordered pizza from papa johns prior to this location, and this location has converted me to solely purchasing pizza from papa johns! I just wanted to say thank you to the kind staff for keeping the store clean even during a global pandemic! The pizza tasted emmaculate and they were even super considerate enough to avoid putting mushrooms on my pizza, despite my life threatening allergy! Raven and his staff will never fail to amaze me with their hard work and dedication to the Papa John's chain and they deserve nothing but the upmost of praise and recognition. Thank you for such a pleasant and amazing experience! :)
