name: Latiffany Thompson
text: If I could give this Dominos 0 stars I would. I was traveling through town and due to the fact I just had surgery on my ankle I didn't want to go out, so I proceeded to call this Dominos for delivery. I had to wait for 15 min for them to answer the phone and when they did they just sat the phone down while I heard them laughing in the background. I called back I asked what were the specials I was placed on hold again, after about 5 min the girl finally came back to the phone I placed my order she told me we will get it to you when we can, after an hour passed we called back and were put on hold another women came to the phone and said the delivery driver was on her way. I waited another hour and forty minutes, no pizza I proceeded to call over and over again they would not answer the phone. The 2 women that I spoke to need to be fired I waited from 3 to 7 at night and needless to say I never received my pizza. This is truly bad business and very unprofessional. I will never eat at Dominos again if this is how you allow your employees to treat customers

Another hour goes by and they finally call back to say "Uhh, do you still want your pizza?" No I want a refund. Thankfully they managed to do one thing right.
That was the last time I ordered from them, but it was not first time they completely dropped the ball (If you order any bread product expect to get bread with no seasoning). This was a couple months ago, but I was looking for a new place to order from when I saw that this store somehow has 3 stars despite how big of disaster it is.

name: Danielle Christopher
text: It doesn’t make sense to be open until 11pm. I specifically called at 10:30 to order a cheese pizza and the guy told me that I couldn’t over the phone and that I had to walk in. So I walk in 2 mins later and he said we’re no longer taking orders and it’s 10:35pm. He then proceeded to say that they were not taking orders at 10:30pm or later, but failed to relay that to me over the phone. Regardless it’s says they close at 11pm so why was my order not taken???

resp.text: Hi, Danielle. Please give us a chance to make it right and fill out a feedback form at www.tellmarcos.com.

text: Placed and paid for pizza over the phone. Went to pick up pizza, lady said it was $3. I asked why, it was paid for over the phone. I paid the $3 but she could not explain to me why I had to pay an additional $3. Pizza was greasy!!!

resp.text: Hi, Jeff. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're so sorry we let you down and we'd like to look into this. Please provide your contact information on our feedback form at www.tellmarcos.com

text: They make good pizza here. This location can get very busy during game times (as expected)  but the staff could really do a much better job handling the volume and providing better customer service for people waiting.  Seems like I was more of an inconvenience than a welcome guest on a busy busy day. Otherwise they do a good job.

resp.text: Benjamin, we’re so sorry that we let you down. Please fill out a feedback form at www.marcosguestfeedback.com so we can have someone reach out to you directly and make things right.

text: Great pizza! Great staff! I went in to pick up a carryout order and the pizza was still in the oven. Guy at the counter said I could wait in the car and he would bring it to me, which he did.

text: Marco’s hands down has the best pizza as well as the fastest delivery time. Regardless of what time you order, your pizza will always be delivered fresh in a timely manner. I can’t recommend this place enough!

text: Tasty large pizza with plenty of toppings. Price are pretty reasonable. Quite greasy and strong for me, I should try different toppings next time. I recommend this to people who likes strong taste of their pizza.

resp.text: We're so happy you had an excellent experience! Thanks for the review! We really appreciate it.

name: Cindy Gulledge
text: The pizza  was delicious! Delivery was fast! Delivery guy was friendly both times. I'm very happy with my Marcos experience and recommend it highly.

resp.text: As long as you're happy, we're happy, Cindy!

name: James Joyce
text: Though on the pricier side, Marco's is noticably better than other quick service pizza. This location is consistently great - accurate, fast, and not skimpy on toppings. I have to give credit to the owner, who I've spoken to once (on a Saturday, via his personal cell phone, of all things) after submitting some feedback about the corporate-run online ordering system. This person clearly cares about customer service and it's reflected in how well his franchise is run. My only complaint is they're not open later.

name: David Ihde
text: Went here for take-out with my two grandchildren (one in a stroller).  My order was ready when I arrived and even though we were walking the girl at the counter offered to help us carry the order to our car (she didn't know we were walking).  She was friendly and made us feel welcome.  When we got the pizza's home I thought they were a little salty, but maybe that's just Marco's style of pizza.  I'll probably go here again and would recommend it to people.

This place is the worse at making pizza.  They never put enough cheese and they always overcook and we have to tare pieces apart as the cuts never go through all the way.  There are usually lots of bubbles in the dough too.
I prefer to drive across town to the other one in Alabama city.  They are extremely slow  but MOST of the time the pizza is better quality.

I know it's loud and all plexiglass up but I said it and he heard it. Also the night before I wanted a    "Hot and ready" and they didn't have any hot and ready. Done not going to LC's again

text: Seems like my order is ALWAYS messed up anymore. The fella up front never gets the order right and the pizza looks terrible ! The only time my order is good anymore is when the lady manager is working during the day!

name: Skyvs van
text: I am a huge fan of Pizza Pizza! My family isn't. Recently my family went out of town and I was on my own. So of course I close Lottle Ceasar's. Getting a supreme with extra cheese. My fav. As I thought it was amazing. Then the next week I got that for myself and some cheesy bread and a pepperoni for the family. It was also amazing. Then tonight I got the same thing as last time and my supreme was really bad. I dont know what was added but it burned my mouth not by temperature but by spice. And the pepperoni pizza looked like it had been sitting there for hours. So disappointed some consistency would have been appreciated but I'm done

name: JOSH DRUMMOND
text: Good store. I'm just not a big fan of little Caesars pizza.

name: Sherry Rylander
text:
The Hot and Ready pizza is a wonderful idea. $5-$6, you walk in and get a hot pizza and walk out. Very seldom do we have to wait. The place is always clean the staff is always pleasant.
The newest addition is the thin crust pepperoni pizza. If you don’t like a lot of bread, it has just the right combination a crispy crust, the perfect amount of  sauce and lots of spicy pepperoni to make a very tasty meal. I like to dip it in ranch dressing myself. Get a large because you will eat the whole pizza.

name: Jeff Nations
text: This group of foreign workers are very rude!

name: Mizzuz Mo
text: Saturday, April 6 2019. My entire household got food poisoning from lil Caesars in Rainbow City. From the hubby to the baby. It was absolutely awful. Maybe 3 hours after eating... a little less. (Edited to spare you the details) And it was far worse for the adults. I ate for the first time today(2days later). No virus strikes the entire family simultaneously. It was definitely food poisoning.

name: Sarah Reaves
text: Pizza was great and the cashier even told me about their newest pizza. I can't wait to try it!

name: Chuck and Rachel
text: Love this place. Always quick and easy it never takes long, even if you stop in at rush time (5ish) and have to wait on your order, it's never no more than five minutes or so. I also love how sweet the boss (possibly the owner?) Is so sweet to my son. He always gives him a balloon and free cookies. He's always so kind and I've heard him asking his younger employees about their grades and encouraging them, which is very nice to see. I've never had an issue of any kind and they are open until 10 u Believe, which is also nice. It's in a super convenient location and when I use the app and preorder via the "pizza portal" it literally takes me two minutes to pick it up. If you need a budget friendly, convenient and quick dinner, this is it.

name: Lurae Morgan
text: Used pizza portal. Pizza was not ready. Had to tell women what I wanted. She said sometimes it Don't work.  Then they got pizza wrong.  And acted like it was my fault. And refused to give refund.  At that point I had been there over an hour and just wanted my money back did not want to wait 30 more minutes for wrong order.

name: dusty carroll
text: I bought pizza and crazy bread at around 5:15 tonight, and both tasted like they had been there since lunch. Horrible! Even had that sitting under a light for too long taste. Very disappointed!!

name: Thomas Gregerson
text:
The amount of time you spend at RBC location waiting for pizza has increased dramatically. When I order on their app and arrive when the app alerts me the pizza is ready, I would assume it is ready. No such luck. This is not a one time event.

Tried this place again and waited 30 minutes for cheese pizza, italian bread, and a 2 liter. Stay away unless you have all day. If I could give negative stars I would.

name: Dimika Bozeman
text: This particular location always had the best service but then they started letting the rude big man from East Gadsden come over there. We try our best to just not go when he is there. Outside of that  everyone is always very helpful and nice. They always have FRESH hot pizza ready. Most don't realize when you hear "hot and ready" that doesn't necessarily mean fresh. This location does it right! Btw their deep dish has that buttery bottom and crust that I haven't gotten with other locations.

name: Matthew Niessen
text: Surprisingly good for a budget pizza joint. Quick(ish), friendly, and never a mistake.

name: Richard Burleson
text: Fast friendly service. Like going there on weekends when I'm off work. Knowing that the wait won't be long if I order or just to pick up a ready made. Thanks 😊

name: Jake Samples
text: Never has the extra most bestest hot and ready pizza ready. Defeats the purpose of being called a hot and ready when it's never available

name: Courtney Turner
text: I've visited numerous little ceasars' restaurants and every time I get a bowl of grease, so much grease! I had to stop eating their pizza cause my stomach can't handle it, however they have good wings. When they have enough sauce anyway.

name: Kelly Slezak
text: Don't worry about calling in an order. It won't be ready. I called in a pizza and cheese bread, got the 30 minutes later and it wasn't ready. Had to wait another 10 minutes. This isn't the 1st this has happened. It seems to be a regular occurrence.

text: Ordered by phone .got there and was told they sold my food because they did not know if I was coming.  Stupidity  at its finest.  You had my number. You told me it would be 15 minutes.  I got there in 17. Minutes.  Food is good. Not the best services.

text: Good, quick service.  Busy location.  Got ten pizzas for me pretty quickly.

name: Bippe Good time
text: Had to wait 25 mins for my order that I called in 30 mins prior to my arrival time finally got my under cooked,bacon throwed on top only in the center pizza

name: Holly Poe
text: Don't watse you're time calling in a order they either put wrong name own order or they dont get all of you're order or they tell you they dont even have it this has happen to me 2 times now  they need to get there stuff together

name: Dawn Frost
text: Clean  and professional service. Employees seemed very nice and professional also!

name: Laurel Adams
text: It's always great pizza every time!!

name: Jeff Harvey
text: Good stop been going there along time.

name: Hollie Moon
text: Always hot and fresh 5 Dollar pizzas!

name: Mary Ragsdale
text: Ok but greedy with the parmesan like it's unicorn gold.

name: Mike Reaves
text: Pretty fast,  even when busy. No complaints

name: Melissa Strawder
text: Like most lil Caesar's, sometimes it's actually hot n ready and sometimes you have to wait a couple of mins. Nice staff.

name: Miguel Hernandez
text: Good food, good prices(Samsung pay✔)

name: rodney Peterson
text: Good food, great service, community sponsorship.

name: Sonya Tinker
text: Great place to buy pizza, especially when you are about to have a party or gathering.

name: Carrie Evans
text: Food is good, accept for avwait on weekend evenings

name: Desmond Lewis
text: Fast and friendly service...

name: Rebekah Rodgers
text: What you'd expect from a little Caesars. Cheap food. Staff is usually super friendly or you can tell they want to go home.

name: Allicia M
text: Horrible service. I waited on a cheese pizza and pepperoni pizza for 20min. The people working there did not seem to care to even take anyone's order when they walked in.

name: Danny Powell
text: Great service

name: Andrew Caudle
text: Hard to beat $5 pizza.

name: Cindy Clardy
text: Great Value

name: David Templeton
text: Decent pizza, good price,  but always horrible customer service

name: Kimberly J Lipham O'Barr
text: Great Pizza!!!!! Love the Deep Dish!!!!

name: Richey Eli
text: Best pizza ever

name: Toni Jones
text: Not that great of pizza.

name: Cynthia Gutierrez
text: Love it

name: Nancy Beasley
text: Love the $5 pizza

name: Martha Barnard
text: Sometimes they cook the pizza too long and the crust is tough.

name: Susan Robertson
text: The food was great

name: Kerry Griffith
text: Fast, friendly service.

name: David Tucker
text: Great Place for Quick Lunch.

name: M.J. Barnard
text: My husband likes to eat here when he is in the mood.

name: Vandelia Pinkard
text: Cheapest prices around when you are starving and on a budget

name: Henry Mcfarland
text: Food was hot and fresh

name: shawn caine
text: Good pizza.....

name: Joseph Garrard
text: Good pizza

name: AJ Socolow Burns
text: Terrible service very rude. Horrible customer service.

name: Brittany Gray
text: Great

name: Asaji5 (Team Asaji)
text: Bacon Wrapped Pizza!

name: Joseph Pullen
text: Love this place

name: JOE FERRELL
text: Hot and ready

name: Slymm Gilbert
text: Most bestest

name: James Battles
text: Fast food

name: Pamela Bishop
text: Hot good pizza

name: cindy walker
text: Old and cold pizza

name: Wynema Cangialosi
text: Great seevice

name: Drew Lee
text: Last several visits had to wait more than twenty minutes, one if these visits took 40 minutes to get pizza

name: Molly Waddell
text: Alway very busy.

name: Chatori Scott
text: A little slow but hey..thats every one I've been to

name: Amanda Stephens
text: 1 male in there is super rude.. first time I have ever seen him. We come often

name: Brittany Gray
text: Great

name: Stephen B.
text: The food here was great. Pizza is excellent! I would definitely recommend the spinach and artichoke dip as well. Very friendly staff who are working short-handed. Atmosphere was great for children.

name: Jacimashburn Mashburn
text: I just want to say this was one of the best places I have been to since being in the Alabama/Florida area. They were extremely busy tonight due to it being Memorial Day weekend and by the time they seated everyone on the waiting list, it was about 20-30 minutes until they closed. They continued to serve us all in a timely manner without rushing or being annoyed that we were there. Some of the most kind staff I have ever encountered. I would recommend this 10 times to people. Keep doing the best Lillians!!!

name: ErrantSquire
text: Good place overall, the pizza was packed with cheese which was a plus. They seem to be a little under staffed right now which led to some delays. Most of the restaurant industry is rebounding due to 2020. Lots of interesting pizza, calzone, and stuffed pizza combinations to try out.

name: Hallie Wemmie
text: We had a good experience here. Were here on a quiet Wednesday with three kids. Ate on the deck and had a very friendly server. We ordered two original crust pizzas which were delicious. Recommend the house supreme! Kids enjoyed the classic pepperoni and was very filling. Generous toppings very very good service today.

name: Sam Kaczor
text: Lillian’s is a great place to stop when you’re craving something different than seafood - however, I still got the shrimp Alfredo. The Alfredo was thick, but you could tell it was homemade. Lasagna was a huge hit with our party. Great priced, especially for a southern restaurant!! Would recommend sharing your next trip! :)

name: christiana williams
text:
Got to-go and it was great! I like the large amount of cheese. I'd personally probably prefer a thin crust.
Good prices for what you get. They are severely understaffed, just like everyone else, so don't hold that against them.

name: Healing Earth Ceramics
text: Service was good but pizza wasn’t that great. Under cooked dough, sparse meat scattered randomly and more cheese than anything else.  Ordered a thin sausage pizza hoping for a nice crisp crust and a uniform layer of sausage. Crust was limp and doughy, sausage was vague and limited and the whole thing was abundantly heavy in cheese. If you like a soft crust with a ton of cheese this place is for you. Just not my style.  Dated atmosphere needing a makeover.

name: Rosemary Lilla
text: We loved the pizzas but was disappointed that they have discontinued the cheeseburger pizza. Service was great. Everyone very friendly and attentive.

name: Sam Kaczor
text: Lillian’s is a great place to stop when you’re craving something different than seafood - however, I still got the shrimp Alfredo. The Alfredo was thick, but you could tell it was homemade. Lasagna was a huge hit with our party. Great priced, especially for a southern restaurant!! Would recommend sharing your next trip! :)

name: Curtis Carter
text:
Great Pizza at a reasonable price. Service was acceptable and attentive.

My wife had the white pizza, (shrimp and Alfredo) and it was delicious.
I had a pepperoni and green olive stromboli (large) and I devoured it. It's probably enough for two, but I love green olives. It was slightly different than the description.

My sister ordered a pizza with pineapple, bacon, banana peppers. She got jalapeños instead of banana peppers, but said it was good.

My parents split a Big Dave's. They loved it.

I'll be back but I'll either be coming during the hot day or sitting inside. The outdoor seating has misters that run even late evening and sole the menus/tables.

name: Bill Murchison
text: Brianna was the best little server in that whole community, super sweet with a fantastic personality and checked on my wife and I often. The pizza was delicious and fresh. I would give it 6 stars if I could.

name: Healing Earth Ceramics
text: Service was good but pizza wasn’t that great. Under cooked dough, sparse meat scattered randomly and more cheese than anything else.  Ordered a thin sausage pizza hoping for a nice crisp crust and a uniform layer of sausage. Crust was limp and doughy, sausage was vague and limited and the whole thing was abundantly heavy in cheese. If you like a soft crust with a ton of cheese this place is for you. Just not my style.  Dated atmosphere needing a makeover.

name: gregg pap
text: Amazing food and Amazing service.Lillians came recommended by a friend who lives in the area. We also got dinner to forblater.

name: Pam George-Tieman
text:
Inconsistent and unaccommodating.  I'm local and try this place about once every 6 months and say I will never bother again.   We've had good food there , but we've also gotten $13 Stromboli with one piece of sausage in it.  Just like other reviews- sometimes its great, some times it's just "meh".  This last time may finally be it for me.  Manager was so rude and unaccommodating even though we were spending a LARGE amount of money there.
And I cannot imagine why they have to charge extra to swap out mushrooms for a different topping on a pizza- is it that difficult?  Maybe for them.

I gave them 2 stars because some of the food was good.   It's a shame their inconsistency and horrible attitude drive people away.
Next time guests are in town we will go elsewhere.

name: tom mcculloch
text: ALL AROUND BEST PIZZA IN THE SOUTH! I’m a global disaster responder and travel all over the United States. This pizza is New Jersey New York status pizza. I should know, I’m from new Jersey and lillians made me feel like I was home. Everyone needs to go here for pizza, it’s against the pizza gods if you don’t!

name: Scott McNamara
text:
Our background- from Indy- love pizza.  Giordano's, Ale Emporium, Scampy's, Pizza King, Pizza Hut and Papa John's when eating chain pizza- ALL GOOD!
Ordered a Veggie pizza- traditional crust (7.5 rating), a Chicken Bacon Ranch pan (3 rating), a pan Pepperoni/Onion/X cheese (4 rating), a 14" Meat Lovers (7 rating), and 2 orders stuffed bread sticks (2 rating).  The pan crust and bread sticks were very dough-y and had little flavoring.  Would not recommend and will not return.

name: Daniel Lane
text: We were a little worried when we pulled in and the parking lot was almost empty. Glad we went ahead and tried it. The pizza is awesome and our server was really good. We just got a pan crust pepperoni with some drinks. The crust is soft and they are generous with the cheese. Nice to beat the crowds weve been used to too!

name: Brad Hill
text: Nice pizza restaurant. Cool manager who was very knowledgeable about activities and cool beaches in the area . Cool young waitress as well. The kind of place you want to hang out and chill. Good vibes.

name: Billy Cline
text: If you like pan pizza then this is a must visit.  Staff super cool.  We got 4 18" pizzas and had so much we ate for days.

name: Boogie Randy
text: I’m always amazed at what people recommend as “great”. I mean, Publix has better frozen pizzas than the “House Supreme” at Lillian’s. Very few ingredients covered by lots of cheese and average thin crust. So average- and when the bartender coughs in his hand and then touches my beer bottle-well that is 2 Stars in my book. I’ll never go back. Do yourself a favor and get a frozen pizza at Publix- for half the price.

name: Sandra Allen
text: Barbara and I love Lillians' pizza. Nice efficient waiters & waitresses. Also pleasant place. 4 plus stars.

name: Jeff and Sue Albaugh
text: Great food and service! Caesar salad was wonderful.  Pizza was delicious.  Wings superb!

name: Tracy Matteis Dix
text: Awful! I wanted to rate a 0 zero but have to say the best thing here is knowing the beach is across the street and the tea is sweet, otherwise....food was super slow from order to delivery to table it had no taste whatsoever and ICE cold.  Waitress never returned to table to take appetizer plates away nor refilled drinks...we sat unattended for 45 mins until I decided to call front cashier and spoke to a manager and asked what the heck is going on? Did the cook quit?  Did the waitress walk out??? Manager stated short handed but made no effort to approach our table and clear things up, we were here for business meeting but NOT again!  I guess when miss Lillian passed away in 2014 she took her secrets of good customer service and food recipes with her!  Sorely disappointed and embarrassed! Don't come here! Waste if time and 🤑

name: Josh May
text: Biased, have to admit it up front, I have a family member named Lillian. ;) Pan pizza is pretty good, really like the cheese garlic bread. We visit whenever we're at the beach.

name: R Sek
text: A few years ago I was working for a riad construction company and had the traffic control duty. Couldn't take a conventional lunch break so I googled pizza delivery near me, and the driver pulled right up and  I halted traffic while I paid for the pizza and two liter. Great pizza too.

name: Kristi F
text: Our server Rachel was amazing!  The food and the atmosphere was great!  Awesome Mother's Day dinner!

name: Ann Pesson
text: Most amazing pizza we have had in a long time.  Great crust, lots of cheese, great quality ingredients.  Very friendly staff

name: Lindy Walls
text: Pizza was great! BUT we also ordered spinach and artichoke dip and received a very very small bowl of dip with a ridiculous amount of chips. There might have been enough dip for a fourth of the chips! 🙄🤦‍♀️😔

name: Greg Hale
text: Great Pizza.  I usually like thin crust but would highly recommend the pan pizza here.

name: Brian Busch
text: I used to look forward to Lillians Pizza. Tonight was the worst visit ever.  Waiter forgot our drinks. Then forgot the salad. And when my calzone came out it was burnt.  He did offer to remake it but didn't feel it would be worth waiting another half hour or so for it. Although it was a lil busy when we first walked in it slowed up quickly.  The Misses compared her spaghetti dinner to that of Chef Boyardie. Over cooked.  Wasnt a great experience and the staff didn't seem to think our dissatisfaction mattered.  I always try to find the good side of a bad experience but couldn't find one in this visit. Not sure I'll be in a hurry to go back even tnough I live close by.

name: Natasha Miller
text: For a chain restaurant this location serves very good food.   Service was also very good, fast and accurate.   The combo were more than enough for our lunch.   If we're in the area, we will return.

name: Julie Paulston
text: May take a little bit longer, may cost a little bit more...but it is my favorite pizza so far. We tried the Veggie Patch with Alfredo sauce. It was amazing!!!

name: Megan Taylor
text: Ordered a delivery and not only did it take over an hour to get here, but they sent us the wrong drinks. However; the pizza itself was absolutely fantastic!

name: C C
text: I travel the country and this is the best pizza I have had.  I'm shocked its less than a 4.8.

name: Julia Rae
text: We were a little worried when we pulled in and the parking lot was almost empty. Glad we went ahead and tried it. The pizza is awesome and our server was really good. We just got a pan crust pepperoni with some drinks.

name: TRACY DIX
text: If I could have rated a zero than that would have been great, it was diasterous, and food did not live up to all the hype! Terrible trip there for pizza, next time we will order from dominoes!

name: Meesh Shanmugam
text: Fantastic pizza and some of the friendliest service you'll ever get. Definitely worth a visit.

name: dana sullivan
text: Excellent service! All the food was great. We closed the place down.

name: McKinna M.
text: I've been coming here ever since I was a kid. All the workers are so friendly and they work hard to make their food delicious and their customers happy.

name: Melanie Lindsey
text: Pleasant experience, great tasting pizza. Their salads were very fresh!!

name: gregg pap
text: Amazing food and Amazing service.Lillians came recommended by a friend who lives in the area. We also got dinner to forblater.

name: Kevin Barnes
text: We arrived and asked to be seated outside for dinner. The server that was over that area looked at us and walked past us at least 4 times and said nothing. Dint even ask if we needed anything. We got up after waiting for 15 minutes and then we told the hostess that we were going to leave due to not being helped and she said ok. Terrible customer service and couldn’t tell you if their food or drinks are good seeing no one helped our family. I do not recommend!

name: MaLinDa Bell
text: The place was great, kid friendly, waitresses was very nice, the appetizers were the best. Once our food came....nope! Good was over! Shrimp Alfredo was so thick it couldn't be stirred, the chicken parm was good until you at the spaghetti and  tomatoes.  There was no flavor in anything but the Chicken. Our total was 102$, and we carried everything home for our pet except the salads, spinach/artichoke dip, and some bread. I was very disappointed.....no pic of main course!

name: Melissa Carroll
text: Pizza and chicken parm was delicious! Good family place and kids loved drawing on the chalkboard walls.

name: Tom Hogan
text: Good Deep pizza.   Dog friendly on the deck.  Pretty good variety on the menu.

name: Lindsey M
text: It came highly recommended to us.. we thought it was decent

name: Catherine Collier
text: Happy New Year to us! On a quick beach getaway- had not been to Lillians for three years. Ordered the pan pizza supreme and it was fabulous! The crust was thick and tasty, the toppings were fresh and first class, the sauce was seasoned perfectly. You can order online and they now have a separate entrance for pickup. It was ready in 30 minutes on a  busy Saturday night I highly recommend Lillians!!

name: Daniel Lane
text: We were a little worried when we pulled in and the parking lot was almost empty. Glad we went ahead and tried it. The pizza is awesome and our server was really good. We just got a pan crust pepperoni with some drinks. The crust is soft and they are generous with the cheese. Nice to beat the crowds weve been used to too!

name: Kevin Barnes
text: We arrived and asked to be seated outside for dinner. The server that was over that area looked at us and walked past us at least 4 times and said nothing. Dint even ask if we needed anything. We got up after waiting for 15 minutes and then we told the hostess that we were going to leave due to not being helped and she said ok. Terrible customer service and couldn’t tell you if their food or drinks are good seeing no one helped our family. I do not recommend!

name: Deana Kelly
text: OUTSTANDING staff and food!

name: Caroline Papageorge
text: Awesome food! Great service. Relaxing atmosphere! Love this place!

name: Tom Hogan
text: Good Deep pizza.   Dog friendly on the deck.  Pretty good variety on the menu.

name: Melissa Carroll
text: Pizza and chicken parm was delicious! Good family place and kids loved drawing on the chalkboard walls.

name: Jess Mason
text: It was good and very pleasant

name: Lindsey M
text: It came highly recommended to us.. we thought it was decent

name: Catherine Collier
text: Happy New Year to us! On a quick beach getaway- had not been to Lillians for three years. Ordered the pan pizza supreme and it was fabulous! The crust was thick and tasty, the toppings were fresh and first class, the sauce was seasoned perfectly. You can order online and they now have a separate entrance for pickup. It was ready in 30 minutes on a  busy Saturday night I highly recommend Lillians!!

name: Darick Jones
text: Friendly service and lively atmosphere! The dough is exceptional too!

name: dolla gametight
text: Great place get the 18" stuffed pizza omg 5 toppings huge slices hehe i eat big lol

name: Shawn Treadway
text: Great pizza, great bar, great staff, overall just very happy with my visit

name: Kit Chan
text: Not the worst pizza or Italian food I have ever eaten but it’s close! Sauce is straight from the can. The drinks aren’t bad. The staff is great! Just wish they spent a little more time and effort on the food. It could be a great place to eat with the family.

name: Jonalyn Schismenos
text: I never leave reviews but I am extremely dissatisfied  with the food here!! This is the worst Italian food I've ever had. I was skeptical at first anyways because of the mixed reviews but then thought "oh what the heck I'll try it."

name: Allison Longmire
text: My favorite part was the large glasses they have. Service was good, food was fine just on the pricey side.

name: Brian Lee
text: You guys need to update your hours on Google it's a long drive out here to find out your closed.

name: Alexander McCoy
text: Lillian's was a great little pizza place by the water. The atmosphere was fun and the food was delicious. It was a little pricey for me. My wife and I spent $50 plus tip on two personal pizzas, an appetizer and a salad.

name: Sarah Brown
text: We are staying right across the street and just had our order delivered. We had our order within 15 minutes and the food is awesome!!

name: Douglas Phillips
text: the pizza was really good but it took a while & was a bit expensive.  this is more of a treat than an average pizza experience. if you have the resources, it is worth it.

name: Lisa Myers
text: Bought what they call a stuffed pizza but it's actually a pizza pie to me.  it was and is so delicious ..ya'll try it if you get a chance..hope you enjoy

name: Lisa
text: Lillian's has the best (thin crust) pizza around! I think it has to do with the quality of the mozzarella they use. It's very creamy and has a great "pull" and they don't skimp on it either! We also enjoy the Greek salad and their Caesar salad - the dressing is the bomb. Pastas are also really good. Never had a bad meal there!

name: Cody Holland
text: Got the hummus, antipasto salad, and Dave's special pizza. All delicious. Plenty of meat on the pizza and good flavor. Generous portion of hummus and simple garlic flavoring. Salad is large and amazing. Might need extra dressing.

name: J Ranz
text: Atmosphere was a bit boring, as there's no sound in the restaurant other than the few other tables they have...but the food was great!! It's unfortunate they did away with the lunch buffet.

name: Cole Hagar
text: Lillian’s was a welcomed surprise upon our visit of Perdido Key, Florida. We got in late and it was right across our condominium. We enjoyed a lovely thin crust pizza. Service was very kind. We definitely went back for seconds on our trip and enjoyed many different pizzas. Definitely will be coming back and getting more of Lillian’s Pizza!

name: Kevin White
text:
Stopped in for pizza. Monday night, not busy at all. Waited over 5 minutes to be acknowledged and seated. Got seated and were abandoned. 10 minutes, no server, no drink order. We walked out and went somewhere else.

I could not recommend this establishment unfortunately.

name: Linda Gagyi
text: Lillian's was recommended by the front desk supervisor at our hotel. We were not disappointed! The pizza was delicious and sevice was good.  I would recommend Lillian's to any other out of towners, although it was obvious that it was also a favorite with the locals.

name: Jessica Holden
text: Went to this place based on the good reviews but the quality of the pizza doesn't measure up to some of the outstanding reviews on here. For the price, I expect a higher quality product.

name: shaderfaderf
text:
Best. Pizza. Ever.
My husband and I came in to eat after a swim in the ocean and ordered a 12 in. with sausage, pepperoni and extra cheese. I also ordered a mixed drink, the twisted mermaid if I remember correctly. Everything was awesome at a great price. Whenever we come back to Pensacola, we will definitely be coming back to Lillian's!

name: Holly Ali
text: "Great food good atmosphere prices aren't bad either, staff is very friendly"

name: Robert H
text: Not worth the wait, overpriced mediocre pizza. If you have 17 minutes drive to Gulf Island Grill.

name: Ann Sullivan
text:
We went there on Friday night . This is our to go to place for pizza we don't go often .But the time before this about 4 months ago was delicious and service was great .This time Friday night they had two servers for a busy Friday night..  I had wings and 10 inch pizza My Husband had salad and 10 inch Pizza of course we had left overs. But I found the Pizza not having that much flavor . I don't know if they changed cooks or not.but the pizza was not nearly as good as we had before. There prices are higher which is understandable ,bc everything is going up .But if the quality isn't there for the price than its not worth it. The chicken wings were ok but they were not  hot they were just warm . I didnt bother sending them backever for our food took foreverto
come out.server was playing bar tender and waitress the other waitress had to take over for our waitress . I don't think we will be going back. .the vibe just felt so different Friday night . What ashame bc it was delicious just a few months ago.

name: Josh Crane
text: Angela was a great server! Fast, friendly, and helpful! We got the chicken bacon ranch pizza and it was yummm. Will be back next year!

name: Abby Danny
text: Food is good, staff are very accommodating but they need more spacious place.

name: morgan bond
text: The service here is great and the food is amazing. but the floors are always so sticky it nearly pulls your shoe off your foot.

name: jay j
text: Poor service employees had bad attitude does this place have the same owners from 2 yrs ago it was excellent than.

name: Joe Fendley
text: Fast service. Great pizza.

name: Lilliana Rayes
text: I never leave reviews but I am extremely dissatisfied  with the food here!! This is the worst Italian food I've ever had. I was skeptical at first anyways because of the mixed reviews but then thought "oh what the heck I'll try it." The negative reviews describe the food impeccably. Where do I start? Everything I ordered was a disaster in a container and I'm not even exaggerating. It takes a lot to infuriate me, but the way this food was I'm shocked they're even still in business. The spinach dip was tasteless and watered down, and still even less than a cup was given to me, the chips were not homemade, which at $8.99 I feel they should be instead of the $2 bagged chips at walmart, which I'm sure they were, the pizza was awfully made, the sauce was bland, Pizza Hut and Dominos taste better for way less money, the Alfredo was so thick I could barely stir it, the noodles were stuck together, the dressing tasted bottled. It's no wonder the place is always dead. If I could give zero stars I totally would because at almost $100 disappointed isn't even a fitting word, livid is. Guess I'm making a trip across town to either Tuscan Oven or Carabbas next time because I tried to find somewhere closer to home and it ended up being a depressing nightmare.

name: keith dubose
text: Local...understand everyone is short staffed .. but took.a long time to get the food after ordering..  and tonight was told they were closed  at 910 pm when their website says 10pm

name: Ben Cunningham
text: Our family absolutely loves Lillian's! It is always our first and last stop on our vacations...and we usually take some home with us as well.😁

name: Brittany Schurtz
text: My go to pizza place! Great service, friendly staff, and fantastic food!

name: Rosalind Clowe
text:
My family order for delivery or pick up regularly.  Growing up in Chicago, the pizza here is the best in Pensacola by a long shot.
They don't hold back on toppings. Pricing is good. Bon Appétit!

name: morgan bond
text: The service here is great and the food is amazing. but the floors are always so sticky it nearly pulls your shoe off your foot.

name: Lilliana Rayes
text: I never leave reviews but I am extremely dissatisfied  with the food here!! This is the worst Italian food I've ever had. I was skeptical at first anyways because of the mixed reviews but then thought "oh what the heck I'll try it." The negative reviews describe the food impeccably. Where do I start? name: jay j
text: Poor service employees had bad attitude does this place have the same owners from 2 yrs ago it was excellent than.

name: Jonathan Cooper
text: The Florentino Pizza is very tasty.. Perfect texture too.. Greek salad is a meal in itself...

name: Rosalind Clowe
text:
My family order for delivery or pick up regularly.  Growing up in Chicago, the pizza here is the best in Pensacola by a long shot.
They don't hold back on toppings. Pricing is good. Bon Appétit!

name: Clarence Miller
text: We had pizza pick up one night, place was so busy it was 1 hour when I placed the order and another 20 after that. We then tried sitting and eating another day and it was good food and great service(Jordyn L).

name: Brittany Schurtz
text: My go to pizza place! Great service, friendly staff, and fantastic food!

name: Joe Fendley
text: Fast service. Great pizza.

name: Ben Cunningham
text: Our family absolutely loves Lillian's! It is always our first and last stop on our vacations...and we usually take some home with us as well.😁

name: T. T.
text: This place was recommended to me by a friend. I was disappointed. To sum up the food I would say, bland! The cheese pizza tastes like the pizza served in the 3rd grade lunchroom. The chicken alfredo had no flavor at all. Would be more tolerable if the quality of ingredients was much higher maybe.

name: Chuck Kenyon
text: Some of the Best Pizza around.  This is not a chain restaurant,  everything is fresh and home made.  I do like the thin crust best.  5 Stars.

name: Brian Oconnor
text: Very good food and the waitstaff was extremely attentive

name: Amy Davis
text: Muffaletta was huge and delish!!!

name: James Evans
text: We have eaten here the past two nights and the food is great. My Autistic son normally will only eat Pizza Hut pizza but Lillian's Pizza he says it better. Wished we had one in Jonesboro AR!

name: Brandon Rhymer
text:
Lillian's is the ideal place to come in, cool down, have an adult beverage, and enjoy a massive and delicious 18" pizza.

The service we experienced from Brianna  was polite, fast, and the sort of friendly that made you feel at home.

The pizza was on point! I've tried to get multiple pizza joints to match the Hot Hawaiian, since I've moved away from Pensacola; I've failed so many times.  The day I came back I had to come back to Lillian's!

The pizza is just what I remembered, amazing.  They say sometimes things are as great as the memory, this place is way better than I remember.

10000000% recommend you come in off the beach and try Lillian's.

name: Gwen Robards
text: Food and service was excellent

name: rani shanmugam
text: Very good Pizza and friendly staff.

name: Tasha Redick
text: Lillian's has amazing employees. And THE BEST spaghetti I've ever eaten! Even their side salad was awesome!!

name: radman444
text: I have been eating at Lillian's for over a decade now.  When I first ordered their pizza back then it was amazing and up until 2 or 3 years ago it has always been good.  Not so much now.  The past several times we have ordered the pizza has not been good.  We gave them one last try yesterday and it was bad.  I no longer recommend their pizza.  The problem is there are very little options around.  Great opportunity for someone to open up a great pizzeria.

name: robert pellerin
text: Best pizza in Pensacola and Perdido area filling tasty plenty of sauce may like the real Italians because they're really Italians enjoy eating there every chance I get

name: Lisa Cochran
text: Lillian's is always our first stop at the beach and has been for our twenty years. The first bite takes me back to the days our kids were little and the memories we have made in Perdido.

name: Bernice Villamor
text: This place has a great rating for a reason! We came in at 530pm on a Sunday and we were seated right away. We ordered cheese-stuffed breadstick and a 16” MYO pizza with 2 toppings and we paid $32 (pre-tip). Definitely pricey but worth it. Our server, Angela, was very pleasant and gave us the best customer service!

name: Peggy Neff
text: Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Food was delicious and plentiful. The restaurant was open Christmas eve till 8:00  serving people like us that went to church at 5:30 and were looking for a place to eat after church.   There weren't many places open but Lillian's restaurant was. We all had dinners all different and everyone of us enjoyed them.  I would recommend the restaurant.

name: Rob
text:
Great place for dinner. Happy hour is until 7 PM. All beer is bottled, no tap. Full bar.  Sandwiches $5. Beer $2.12. (Nov. 2017) Pick up and delivery available and a gift shop on site.
Enjoy.

name: Gretta Mesta
text: We came to visit from out of town , we stopped randomly wanting pizza and ended up here. This is the best food we've during our whole trip! Everything was great customer service, food and atmosphere!! Great, we recommend !!!

name: Anne Hoffman
text: Great local pizza place, friendly service and a nice family environment!

name: Jen Wisby
text: Always great pizza!

name: Amber Gray
text: Love there pepperoni pizza with extra cheese

name: Nikolas Barron
text: Friendly staff. Great pizza and the wings where simple but delicious

name: Clarence Miller
text: We had pizza pick up one night, place was so busy it was 1 hour when I placed the order and another 20 after that. We then tried sitting and eating another day and it was good food and great service(Jordyn L).

name: radman444
text: I have been eating at Lillian's for over a decade now.  When I first ordered their pizza back then it was amazing and up until 2 or 3 years ago it has always been good.  Not so much now.  The past several times we have ordered the pizza has not been good.  We gave them one last try yesterday and it was bad.  I no longer recommend their pizza.  The problem is there are very little options around.  Great opportunity for someone to open up a great pizzeria.

name: Lisa Cochran
text: Lillian's is always our first stop at the beach and has been for our twenty years. The first bite takes me back to the days our kids were little and the memories we have made in Perdido.

name: Zurisadai Diaz
text: They have good pizza but if you get to go don’t ask for the cheese one. It wasn’t our favorite 😬. This one was really good

name: Nikolas Barron
text: Friendly staff. Great pizza and the wings where simple but delicious

name: Anne Hoffman
text: Great local pizza place, friendly service and a nice family environment!

name: robert pellerin
text: Best pizza in Pensacola and Perdido area filling tasty plenty of sauce may like the real Italians because they're really Italians enjoy eating there every chance I get

name: Jen Wisby
text: Always great pizza!

name: Gretta Mesta
text: We came to visit from out of town , we stopped randomly wanting pizza and ended up here. This is the best food we've during our whole trip! Everything was great customer service, food and atmosphere!! Great, we recommend !!!

name: Bill Darnall
text: I rarely give bad reviews. Don't do this place.

name: Amber Gray
text: Love there pepperoni pizza with extra cheese

name: Benjamin Rediker III
text: My Favorite Pizza Place in Lower Alabama/ Florida area

name: Bee Me
text: Usually pretty good pizza. Last night June 3, 2020 we had a terrible experience with the food. They were busy and the staff was friendly but something was horribly wrong with the dough. It was so dense and flavorless, way too much cheese. Almost broke a tooth. Not sure what the issue was but None of the 3 of us ate a full slice. $30+$6 tip for pizza we couldn’t eat. Disappointing. Least we had ice cream at home. I’d like to try again, but we’re not sure.

name: Danielle Singleton
text: Was recommended by a friend to try this place and it did not disappoint! The food was amazing. I will return everytime I am in this area.

name: Wreth
text: Delicious local chain. The staff is always courteous and experienced!

name: matthew mulhall
text: Living in Gulf Breeze,  hailing from CT,  I am spoiled on pizza. Tired a lot of pies, not fond of most. Tried Lillans on Sunday. Best I've had in the area since I came here.  I will be back.

name: Francis Pepin
text: Favorite hide out for italian

name: Sarah Bjorklund
text: Everything we ordered was mediocre. Spinach dip tasted like it came out of a can from a grocery store. Disappointed to say the least.

name: Lori Copelan
text: Definitely the best pizza in the area.  I'm from Chicago and have a hard time finding  a pizza outside of Chicago that compares.  Lillian's Pizza is pretty darn close.  I prefer the thin crust over the deep dish.  For me all the dough takes away from the wonderful sauce.

name: A Harris
text: The pizza is excellent. The atmosphere is very unique. A must if you are in the Perdido area.

name: Larry Loorya II
text: I really like the pizza could be a five stars if I was just going on the pizza I've had in the area. The staff is good really friendly.

name: Ashley Richardson
text: The food was decent, however the toppings that I ordered, the toppings that were rung up, and the toppings I actually got on my pizza were three separate things. The waitress was nice but she was a little overly attentive. We were seated on the patio directly under a misting fan and our table was soaked.

name: Scott Walters
text: Crust is a little bready for pizza. Good atmosphere.

name: Al Fowler
text: Wonderful. Especially the pan pizza. Great family atmosphere.  A regular stop when we are on Perdido Key.

name: Greg Webb
text: Not one single staff member was wearing a mask. Horrible customer service. The food was disgusting. Chicken parm was so tough, you couldn't cut it. This place used to be really good, but I will never return. Beware.

name: Bill Dedrick
text: Consistently good food and good service

name: Cindy Redick
text: My favorite restaurant when we eat out on vacation everything is wonderful service is top notch

name: Sarah McCoy
text: Pizza was fine, spaghetti meal was quite small for $12.50 and they forgot the meatballs but the phone lines stayed busy and I couldn’t get in touch with them to try and remedy it. I was also overcharged and sent an email to try to figure out what I was charged for but they also didn’t reply to that. Perhaps there is an insane delivery fee added? Or maybe they go ahead and add a tip? I have no clue but it was our first and last time.

name: Lydia Rosato
text: Very Good Salad & friendly staff

name: Art Stanton
text: Stopped by on the way home from the beach. Pizza was delicious and the wings are always great.

name: Jason Airlie
text: Always good. Great calzones.

name: Tanya Greiner
text: Family friendly atmosphere.  Quick service.  Good pizza

name: Ben C
text:
An always stop for us when we visit Perdido Key.  We've been visiting since it was on the beach side of the street.  The pizza remains amazing.   We love the Orange Beach Express.  We were disappointed to learn that the lunch buffet was stopped from late May until early September.  We had started going back to Lillian's multiple times for lunch to get our pizza fix.

We always have great service.  I do wish they would get draft beer and stock more local craft beer.  They should consider working with many of new local breweries near by to develop a mutually beneficial relationship.

If you want good pizza and salad, you must stop here.

name: John Broussard
text: The spinach dip is basically spinach in warm. Pan pizza dough was rubbery and difficult to eat.  Save yourself $30 and get a frozen pizza at Walmart.

name: Glenn Gatlin
text: I was in the mood for wings, so I saw they had hot wings on the menu and thought I would give them a try. I was not disappointed. They were ,I believe the best wings I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, not small, and the right amount of heat. The flavor was spot on. Great job.

name: Blake Bradford
text: Great service and great food

name: Vickie Mahrt
text: Pizza is good, but they don't care a bit about their customers. Not a mask in sight. Never going back.

name: Gini Barker
text: Great pizza and service!!

name: Char B
text: Great place to eat since we only had to walk across the street. Spaghetti was really good. Lasagna was wonderful!! Service was just okay. Pizza are good but kinda pricey.

name: George Berry
text: Excellent pizza. Wonderful memories from my childhood. Set the bar for pizza when I was 9. 21 years later, still hasn't been surpassed!

name: Zurisadai Diaz
text: They have good pizza but if you get to go don’t ask for the cheese one. It wasn’t our favorite 😬. This one was really good

name: J Nuss
text: Great pizza and service.

name: Megan Peters
text: Quickly became one of our favorite places to eat at the beach. Best pizza I’ve had hands down! The entire family agreed. The largest will definitely feed a hungry family of 5 and then some. We sat outside and it was the heat of the day in May but we were not hot. They have huge fans and misters and it’s completely covered and shaded. It was so pleasant and the staff was great. Super fun, family atmosphere. The prices are awesome too!

name: Mallory Forrest (Agent Skully)
text: This is literally the best pizza I've ever had in my life. I highly recommend it!

name: Soul Asylum 13
text: They have the best pizzas and desserts and cheesy garlic bread which is amazing! And the salads are great as well!

name: D Scully
text: Lillian's is always good. I have never had a bad pizza and the staff is always friendly. I highly recommend them if you are ever in the Perdido Key area.

name: Laurie Rials
text: Not impressed by the pizza. Enjoyed Frank Brown Songwriters' Festival performance.

name: Cassaap
text: Great pizza! This place gets really busy, so you may have a wait before you can get a table. However, the pizza is amazing. Get the pan pizza, the crust is delicious. Don't get the wings though, they were very mushy and over sauced.

name: Deana Kelly
text: OUTSTANDING staff and food!

name: Diana McMurchy- Amato
text: The best pizza ever!

name: Stacy Akin
text: What's a trip to Perdido Key without a pizza from Lillian' s pizza?  ANSWER: a missed opportunity! It's tradition and just dang good food!

name: Kevin Deesten
text: Great pizza and cheese bread.

name: Jonathan Cooper
text: The Florentino Pizza is very tasty.. Perfect texture too.. Greek salad is a meal in itself...

name: amy burgett
text: Love their food

name: Steven Riley
text: Great service and finally a Chicago style pizza that's perfect!!!

name: kurt witter
text: Love this place we stayed in gulf shores and ordered our pizza they said they would deliver to us so we got our pizza and gave the driver a 40.00$ tip for bringing it and it was hot to.  We were there for vaction for two weeks and ate there two other times when were on vaction we don’t care what food cost it’s  called vaction only one time a year so we don’t care

name: Paula Byrd
text: Went here for lunch with my furkid and the food and staff were amazing.they were very friendly and the pizza is one of the best I've had.

name: Ed Willcoxon
text: Wonderful huge pan pizza. Loved it.

name: Leandra Rasmussen
text: Pizza was great, garlic cheese bread was very cheesy but not so garlicky, artichoke dip was ok, and ranch was good.

name: Don Draper
text: Pretty good pizzer

name: bradley thompson
text: Got a chicken and ranch pizza and it was so dang good! Highly recommend!!

name: Cassaap
text: Great pizza! This place gets really busy, so you may have a wait before you can get a table. However, the pizza is amazing. Get the pan pizza, the crust is delicious. Don't get the wings though, they were very mushy and over sauced.

name: Ed Willcoxon
text: Wonderful huge pan pizza. Loved it.

name: J Nuss
text: Great pizza and service.

name: bradley thompson
text: Got a chicken and ranch pizza and it was so dang good! Highly recommend!!

name: Stacy Akin
text: What's a trip to Perdido Key without a pizza from Lillian' s pizza?  ANSWER: a missed opportunity! It's tradition and just dang good food!

name: Paula Byrd
text: Went here for lunch with my furkid and the food and staff were amazing.they were very friendly and the pizza is one of the best I've had.

name: Diana McMurchy- Amato
text: The best pizza ever!

name: Matthew Blackburn
text: Great Pizza and friendly service!

name: Don Draper
text: Pretty good pizzer

name: Ed Buckley
text:
Have been coming here for many years, started going there when in their original location, have always enjoyed food & service, until tonight. My wife & I dined in, i ordered my usual, Big Dave’s 16” pizza, $22.50, & told the server to please make sure has plenty of sauce, because sometimes dry, I’ve always ordered it this way. My wife got a Calzone, which the crust was a little burned in places & i told my wife not to eat if tasted burned, but being the nice lady she is, said no its fine.
When i got my bill, i saw i was charged an extra $1.85 for sauce & asked the server when they started charging for sauce. She said she wasn’t sure, but thats the way it was billed.  I told her she didn’t say anything about & extra charge &  i had never been charged before. The manager came out & I explained to her that i just asked to make sure pizza had plenty of sauce on it like I always have. She just bluntly told me they consider extra sauce as another topping & thats why i was charged. I told her I didn’t order extra sauce just wanted it not to be dry, like normal & thats why i always asked to make sure had plenty of sauce on it & I wasn’t told there would be an extra charge by server. I can afford the $1.85, but for a $22.50 pizza, it needs sauce, & there wasn’t extra sauce on it, just what i would consider normal.  This manager was very rude, didn’t even offer to remove the extra charge, even though ive been coming their for years, & i know if Lillian were still a live would be disappointed in her attitude.
Also, was shocked that non of the servers were wearing masks & their social distancing was very lacking.   As customers came in, they just filed right by our table.
Hate this manager has run off a loyal customer over $1.85 over charge, been coming there for 20 years.

name: Kevin Deesten
text: Great pizza and cheese bread.

name: Jennifer Ethridge
text: Pizza was okay, service was great until we wanted out check.

name: jeff durbin
text: Food was good.  Person taking phone order on 6/29/20 at 4:42pm was rude and unhelpful. Person working cash register was also rude.

name: Luba Dyker
text: Very Good

name: Bill Watkins
text: Best pizza I have ever had

name: B Batt
text: The pizza is amazing after a long day on the beach (but so are pizza rolls lol). Order double toppings. Also watered down homemade ranch cups are $1.00 :/

name: Sizergh
text: Amazing place for pizza. It beats anything else out there, highly recommended.

name: Angel Rodriguez
text: Omg their pizza is incredible!!! Aside from the amazing area this is why I chose Perdido Key. No other pizza in the area is like it!

name: Carole Bell
text: Delicious we visit here every time we're in town

name: Judy Schmidt
text: We had the calzones which was very good. The gentleman that waited on us was very nice and checked on us to see if we needed anything. The only downer was the spinach artichoke dip. It was a lot of spinach in a pale white thin sauce, not a dip mostly spinach. The artichoke part was missing, zero artichokes in it. I had the same kind of stuff at a different restaurant so I wonder if it's something that comes premade and they just heat it up.  I gave it 5 stars because it really is good food and service but next time I'll get a different starter.

name: Kelly Cano
text: Excellent service and great pizza, right across from the Gulf of Mexico. Outdoor available on the back deck. Inside, the kids can write on the walls, they're covered in chalk board paint.

name: Renee Anderson
text: Sorry Lillians... We order your yummy pizza all the time...💕 it!  But tonight I decided to change it up!😒  by far the worst meatball sandwich I have ever had!!! YUK!

name: heather mcleod
text: Great customer service,  not so good pizza

name: Britni Myers
text: Always enjoy going here with the kids

name: Brian Armentrout
text: Don’t expect them to answer the phone. Ever.

name: Misty Dunn
text: Definitely need to give this place a try! Honestly I dont normally eat pizza, but my child does... I had Chances Meltdown and the nachos and oh my!! It was so so good!!! Nice staff, relaxed family friendly atmosphere too.

name: Robert Otto
text: Pizza was good. Waitress was super nice.

name: Holly Pettis
text: One of the smartest places to eat in the area! Delicious pizza, fresh Greek salad, cheesy calzones and more! The prices make this place (almost) too good to be true! Cost friendly, friendly servers, and sure to please!

name: Ethan
text: Ordered four pizzas, and they were all DELICIOUS. When we come to visit on vacation we always talk about Lillian's Pizza.

name: Jessica Edwards
text: Terrible and disgusting. We ordered carry out, which took an hour! Then the pizza was dry and they didn’t even bother cutting it. We also got a calzone that wasn’t cooked all the way and had a powdery taste! 🤢expensive and I think Pizza Hut would have had better tasting pizza! Yuck!!!

name: josh hibbard
text: Pretty average pizza

name: R L.
text: First time visiting and the service was ridiculously slow. We had group of 7 and 2 kids. We waited an hour before receiving our food. Our waitress didn't come and update regularly. The food once arrived was good but the pizza came uncut. We had to ask for a pizza cutter to cut our dinner. Beer is also bottled which is weird. They also don't have local beer. The chalk drawing wall kept kids busy but I would probably recommend somewhere else just based on how long it took.

name: Kayla Charniaux
text: Took 2 hours to deliver. At least it was free. Huge size

name: bamabound
text: Best pizza around especially for a beach town. Away from the tourist trap of Orange Beach

name: Jim Brown
text: The family and I stopped in to eat here are last night on vacation and I am kicking myself in the you know what for not stopping in sooner. This review is going out to Parents. I have 3 boys at the time 16, 14,and 10. They laughed and played joked around till the pizza's came out, for 35 minutes not a word , peep nothing that right there is priceless.

name: Dilan Burns
text: Man, I came in to Lillian's with high hopes when it was recommended by family but then ended up waiting for more than 45 minutes to be served food, then when the waitress comes around about 10 or so minutes before  she asks to refill our drinks after having to wait that long, that takes another 10+ minutes for our refills. On top of that the waitress has the nerve to put her hands on her hips waiting with an attitude for us to give her my card for the bill when I'm putting the leftovers in the to-go box and readying all of our other stuff. The pizza was lackluster at best and hardly had any sauce. My wife asked for extra sauce and received marinara sauce. Clearly not the same. Extremely disappointed. Won't be recommending.

name: Penny Bowen
text: First time getting pizza from this place since we are new to Florida.  The pizza was excellent,  and the young girl who took my order was so sweet. We will definitely be going back!

name: Chad Jackson
text: Has salad and pizza and both were excellent . The dough was fresh and and the toppings were loaded on. Salad was very crisp and fresh as well. Service was quick and polite. Enjoyed eating lunch there.

name: Jeffrey Mikulan
text: The service was okay. We waited just shy of 2 hours for our meals. Luckily the outside vibes were nice. May try it again, but definitely recommend not going there with timing on your mind. The food was good though.

name: Levi White
text: Great pizza

name: Lisa Epstein
text: Pizza was good needed to be cooked a little longer crust was kind of white on bottom  nice looking place inside pretty big

name: Mike Bonds
text: Best pizza!  Even delivers.

name: Strong Bear
text: Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Highly recommend.  Great service and staff. Prices are very reasonable.  Got their largest pizza with an appetizer for 4 people and still less than $50. Even got a dessert.  Still had leftovers for the next day.

name: John Butalla
text: Great food

name: Eddie Stewart
text: Great food, excellent service. Not cheep but worth the price.

name: Theresa Horton
text: Best pizza in the world!  They have the best crust and they put lots of tomato paste in the pizza, which most restaurants don’t.  I usually go to the days when they serve the buffet.  They have all kinds of pizza served at the buffet and they also have other kinds of food such as spaghetti!  I recommend that you try this out if you haven’t already, believe me, you will enjoy it!

name: Hillary Talburt
text: Our favorite meal on Spring Break was at Lillian's! We got the large stuffed pizza (still had leftovers even feeding 3 adults & 2 teens), cheese bread and a couple side salads. Delicious, fresh and ample servings! Make this a priority stop when you're in the area. Side note: I'm a traveling nurse and have had pizza in NY, Chicago, St Louis, etc... This is in my top 2 pizza places!

name: Randy Hall
text: Best pizza 🍕 on the beach..worth the short drive! The staff is great !!! Make plans to go. We make it point to go every trip down !

name: mac wright
text: Just got overcooked pizza, undercooked and under stuffed calzone .USALLY  our food very good first time we've had a bad experience.

name: Anita
text: Outstanding!

name: Penny Bowen
text: First time getting pizza from this place since we are new to Florida.  The pizza was excellent,  and the young girl who took my order was so sweet. We will definitely be going back!

name: Lisa Epstein
text: Pizza was good needed to be cooked a little longer crust was kind of white on bottom  nice looking place inside pretty big

name: Nathan Turpin
text: Hands down the best pizza in Pensacola. I order the shrimp scampi pizza every time. It's simply incredible; the taste and flavor are in my opinion better than the dish it is replicating. The staff is super friendly and they offer a full bar and great selection of local, domestic, and international craft brews. Huge dining area which ensures hardly having to wait to be seated and food is brought out very quickly. Completely replicates the 80's/beach pizza eatery we all reminisce about. Try it and you won't be disappointed.

name: William Alexander
text: I've been going here since kindergarten. It's as good today as it was 30 years ago. I moved from Perdido key a long time ago, but I make sure to stop whenever I visit.

name: Jeffrey Mikulan
text: The service was okay. We waited just shy of 2 hours for our meals. Luckily the outside vibes were nice. May try it again, but definitely recommend not going there with timing on your mind. The food was good though.

name: Kayla Bordelon
text: Over the phone ordering sucks every time I call there is an awful static where i cannot heat or able to place my order. Online ordering is not on which is way easier but over the phone ordering is impossible

name: Linda Doud
text: The guy was very attentive at our table but wasn't a lot of people in there, though. He was a good waiter. Pizza was extremely good.

name: mac wright
text: Just got overcooked pizza, undercooked and under stuffed calzone .USALLY  our food very good first time we've had a bad experience.

name: Rachel Sefcik
text: Love them and right next to my work

name: Dave Courington
text: Saw a review saying that they had two small pizzas and a salad for $50... Not sure how that can happen. Prices were very reasonable and the food was good quality. We liked it enough that we will go back next time we go over to the beach.

name: John Butalla
text: Great food

name: Randy Nichols
text: I read several reviews and was a little bit sceptical. Went anyway and it was great!! Food was excellent service was great and the wait was no longer than any other restaurant. Would highly recommend Lillians and hope to go back soon. BTW the wings are outstanding!!!

name: Jonathan Allred
text: The food is really good. The staff is also friendly and alert. The only down fall is when you order delivery they do not have a set distance, for example one day they deliver to this hotel and the next day they won’t.

name: mac wright
text: Just got overcooked pizza, undercooked and under stuffed calzone .USALLY  our food very good first time we've had a bad experience.

name: Anita
text: Outstanding!

name: Jesse Baird
text: Pizza was good and the staff was friendly.  They have indoor and outdoor seating with chalkboard walls for the kids to draw on which was a nice touch.  The prices are a little high across the menu, probably just because it's at the beach.

name: Linda Doud
text: The guy was very attentive at our table but wasn't a lot of people in there, though. He was a good waiter. Pizza was extremely good.

name: Kenny Graves
text:
I will NOT give them a good review, I give them a bad review and recommend going anyplace else to get pizza. It would be better to go to publix and get any box pizza and cook yourself.  I did read the reviews first and figured we had a 50/50 shot at it being good. Well you see I'm not pleased and giving a poor review.
Half our pizza only had sauce and pepperoni no cheese. How could any pizza place send a pizza out like that.
Make the right decision and go elsewhere, don't take the 50/50 chance that we did from reading the reviews.
Owners should be ashamed of this place. We will  NOT recommend them.

name: Dave Courington
text: Saw a review saying that they had two small pizzas and a salad for $50... Not sure how that can happen. Prices were very reasonable and the food was good quality. We liked it enough that we will go back next time we go over to the beach.

name: Tanya Albritton
text: Delicious Pizza, Nachos and Spaghetti.  Homemade spaghetti sauce that is delish!  Our server was great and we did not wait long for our food.  My family of 5 picky eaters cleaned all of our plates!!!  We will definitely be back next time we come to town.

name: Sara-michelle Johnston Mays
text: Their pizza is SO good and they're a great local fixture the family looks forward to when we can visit the area. Really good specialty pizza and salads!

name: Kenny Graves
text:
I will NOT give them a good review, I give them a bad review and recommend going anyplace else to get pizza. It would be better to go to publix and get any box pizza and cook yourself.  I did read the reviews first and figured we had a 50/50 shot at it being good. Well you see I'm not pleased and giving a poor review.
Half our pizza only had sauce and pepperoni no cheese. How could any pizza place send a pizza out like that.
Make the right decision and go elsewhere, don't take the 50/50 chance that we did from reading the reviews.
Owners should be ashamed of this place. We will  NOT recommend them.

name: stephanie paasch
text: Took an hour to get 1 pizza and 1 side salad. Only 5 tables were being used. Waiter was super slow. Pizza was really good but order your carry out and save the long wait!

name: archer lee
text: My family ordered a large pizza and was extremely disappointed, on the pizza there  was way more then enough cheese. The pizza dough underneath couldn't rise due to the sheer amount of cheese on the pizza. Most of us ended up taking the toppings off and just eating the crust of it. Not to mention the pizza was falling apart because the grease from the cheese was making the pizza soggy. Just thinking about all the grease and cheese makes me kinda nauseous.. but if that's your thing then go for it

name: Kellyn Green
text: We visited here on vacation. It must be the only pizza place around though because our wait time to get a table, order, and get food was WAY TOO LONG. We waited in total probably 2 hours until we got food. The lines for pick up were around the building as well. Food was good though.

name: Roger Shelby
text: Bounced back well after hurricane Sally.

name: Charles Dohs
text: Best pizza on the island! Legit good! The lasagna is amazing. Our server Rebecca was awesome.

name: Brian Jackson
text: Best on Island

name: George Marsh
text: extremely pleased with the location (right across the road from our condo). The food was excellent ( we had the Calzone's and Stromboli). The staff was very nice and friendly and the prices were reasonable. Would definitely return next time down that way.

name: robby economides
text: Pizza is ok very slow service.

name: Linda Weaver-Melton
text: I LOVE  their Greek salad.  The thin crust we always get is never "burned tasting" as many others are.  We drove >15 mi. One way for our LILLIAN'S PIZZA fix...worth every mile!

name: Joseph DeGennaro
text: The toppings were less unsatisfying very thin 2 pizzas a salad and a stumboli were $90

name: MrAustinpen
text: Always way too much cheese, the crust rarely has a chance to cook properly and is doughy.

name: kingbigbamafan
text: Great pizza

name: Robert Bailey
text: Beats any pizza place anywhere close and they deliver. We are residents and this is where we get our pizza. They also have entrees and a bar. They also have TVs if you want to watch a game!

name: BD Clone
text: We loved it. Here on vacation and this place is just up the road. Food was great. We had a Scampi Pizza,  Cheese Pizza, and 2 Lobster Ravioli. We also had dessert, Chocolate cake is huge, Cheese Cake is good, Key Lime Pie is great. Service was great as well

name: Holly Huml
text: From Wisconsin /Chicago area.. Really hard to beat those pizza places... But Lillians is really good! Great service,... And you MUST try a bushwacker!! Add the floater, you will not be disappointed!!

name: Maivious Summerlilly
text: Awesome pizza!!

name: Douglas Shine
text: Great favor but is price a bit expensive i paid $20 for 12in Hawaii

name: Michael P. Jackson
text:
Food was decent, but not great. For the price we paid, it should have been really exceptional.

I guess this is to be expected in such a touristy location.

name: B Matt
text: Too much cheese, very doughy, undercooked, no offer of any pepper or parmesan. Just a place that banks on its proximity to tourists

name: Mae Rosales
text: Absolutely lives up to its reputation ! Delish deep dish!!

name: ShilohandJenn Engles
text: Pretty good food. Good service, very attentive staff.  Prices are a little bit expensive. Definitely give it a try.

name: T dawg
text: We waited a little while for our food to come out and it seems like theres very few people who work here. Do NOT get the Alfredo, the noodles are very dry and taste as if they haven’t been cooked and the shrimp is cold. The garlic bread that comes with the Alfredo was burnt to the high heavens. The pizza and nachos is good, but there isn’t much lettuce on the nachos. i read other reviews about how the take out is better than eating in. the staff is very polite but they all seem overwhelmed

name: Dillon Allen
text: Great toppings. The pan pizza is super doughy and ours was a bit undercooked. Not enough to go back and complain about, but it was dough not crust in the middle. I would go for thin crust next time... And they certainly earned a next time.

name: Ironfeather Chavez
text:
The lunch buffet has a decent selection of pizza's that they continuously
And feverishly keep keep will stocked, with that being said if you plan on eating there during? I advise get there early or be very patient their young energetic staff is on it I can assure you. The pizza is worth it that's why it's so busy.

name: J Cee
text:
We had a late night pizza craving, being on vacation, we do whatever and Lillian's Pizza was delicious! Fast service, awesome pizza. It was great for left overs as well!

Next trip to Perdido, we will try to dine in for a new experience!

name: Jon Neyman
text: Better than the chains but still overrated imo.  You never know how much toppings you’ll get.  Sometimes when you order extra they barely put any.  Sometimes you don’t order extra and it will be loaded down like it should.

name: J Kincer
text: Awesome pizza 🍕 and service 😋

name: Angel Rodriguez
text: Omg their pizza is incredible!!! Aside from the amazing area this is why I chose Perdido Key. No other pizza in the area is like it!

name: Cindy Preston
text: I didn't care for the buffet. It had 3 options with chicken and BBQ sauce, neither I'd which I think belongs on pizza. I think I would have been happy ordering of the menu as the crust was good. Staff was super nice

name: Jeff Jones
text: Awesome pizza place. Been going here for years and quality is consistent.

name: nina mann
text: Tasty pizza and enjoyed the happy hour with chiefs friends.

name: Dee Mitchell
text:
Today is August 4th! Placed Ordered
No good afternoon,  didn't even say your name of restaurant! What happened ! Now...Can I take your order,  this is not Burger King!!
U r better than this!

name: Colleen Rizzo
text: Delicious. Got pizza as well as a quesadilla and both were fantastic. margaritas and daiquiris were excellent. Lovely staff. Want to go again!

name: DC Comics Justice league
text: The pizza was real good. We got two 18” specialty pizzas and they were delicious. Don’t get the house salad, not worth the price and the salad dressing was watery. Service was mediocre at best when we went.

name: Lance “Gascan” Howard
text: If you like pizza then you should try this place. Phenomenal food. Can seem pricey but once you try it you'll understand.

name: Danna S
text: Good food, terrible service.

name: Joseph Harris
text: Great service. If you want a great pizza... GO...

name: Amy Hatcher
text: Great calzone and stromboli..can accommodate large groups

name: Triquetra
text: I love coming here for their buffet. The pizzas are delicious and I have never been to another pizza place that comes close to piling on the cheese like they do here. Staff is always friendly and dining area is clean. They also add funny stuff on their chalkboard as you enter. Kid friendly as they can chalkboard draw on the walls.

name: Matthew Cunningham
text: The stuffed pizza is to die for. Absolutely die for. The environment is cute, but not over the top. Just enough to show they care. The chalkboard wall is a nice touch; there's definitely some political heat. Overall fantastic

name: Misty Evans
text: Best pizza ever!

name: Mary Meglis
text: This place was really great,after wedding we all went here. They were very accomedateing. We even had cake there. So good Thank You so much.

name: Jim Moreland
text:
The best pizza, sandwiches,  and enchiladas  in town. The service is great and the delivery was prompt. I will order more before I leave here. You will not be disappointed.

Jim Moreland

name: Shon Mcwhorter
text: Great food. Friendly staff. Will definitely be a returning customer

name: Kirk Willmann
text: Comfortable family friendly pizza joint with friendly service and great pizza.

name: Paula Greathouse
text: Very nice Worker's

name: Corey Stiles
text: Excellent pizza and service!

name: Walt Del Vecchio
text:
Lillian's Pan  Pizza provides many choices with pan or margherita style crust and six different sauces, as well as toppings.
While I'm not a crust aficionado, I did find the crust tastier than what I would usually find at a pizzeria.

name: Cathlene Norris
text:
The pizza was so good!
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the people also.

name: Dawn Berg
text:
Mixed feelings about the dish I ordered, the Pesto Ravioli. The pesto with sun-dried tomatoes was very flavorful. The dish was supposed to have grilled chicken, and there might have been 2 ounces, but that is questionable. Ravioli...there were 5. There was an abundance of the pesto sauce, which I ended up putting on the garlic bread, since the   Pesto Ravioli didn't have much ravioli! Now, my aunt ordered a ravioli dish and she had at least 10 ravioli.
So, yes, for $14.99 I was a bit disappointed.

name: Matt Scott
text: Great food, terrific family atmosphere.  Service is a vital slow, but over all a great meal at a fair price.

name: Donny Dogood
text: Called place for carryout at 825 said they are not taking carry out calls till 830. Started calling at 830 they picked up phone twice and hung up

name: Julie Webb
