text: Really good pizza, the pan crust is wonderful.  Lots of different pizzas to choose from and the prices are great.

name: Stacey Sullivant
text: The staff is excellent. Our server,Maddie, was great and attentive to our needs. The pizza is also very good. Best pizza in Perdido for sure.

name: Tina Miller
text: Disappointed...my husband and I ate there a month ago and it was amazing!  Best pizza I ever had.  Last night I placed an order for three different pizzas for pick up and was very disappointed...crust was hard like saltine crackers and full of flour.  They tasted old and dry.  One was a margarita pizza and was nothing but diced tomatoes.  The pepperoni pizza had no pepperoni?  So I guess eating in is entirely different from pick up!

name: Cody McDavid
text: The house pizzas here are awesome, and they've got some great drinks as well. The hot Hawaiian is one of my favorites.

name: Darren Durham
text: Been to Perdido Key once, if not two or three times per year, most years since 2000 (weather permitting). Always amazing pizza.  People back home say all of the time, " you mean you drive 12 hours to the gulf coast, freah seafood everywhere, and you eat pizza on the first night?".......YEP.😁

name: jessika young
text: The pizza in absolutely awesome!  Very nice, laid-back atmosphere. Just moved to Perdido a few months ago and we usually eat at home but since we have had several guests and birthdays we know a great place that doesn't fail so we have been here several times. Great food and service every time so far.

name: LANDYN BURRISS
text:
ONE OF THE BEST PLACES EVER
and you can't disagree

name: Chris Rippy
text: Great service and great pizza. Waitress was super patient with 5 little kids in our group. A staple visit for us when we come to this area!

name: Scott Jensen
text: We were told an hour for pickup and it was almost 2.  There was not enough sauce on the pizza,  it was very dry.  We also couldn't tell the difference between the thick crust and the thin crust.   Otherwise,  the pizza was decent.

name: joyce Spann
text: Pizza ok  not lot of variety and small salad bar. Atmosphere is nice and staff very friendly and pleasant

name: Xerxes Griffen
text: Had very good pizza with my family and good service all around

name: Willie Ard
text: After a long week, decided to place an order for pickup (1st time). The stuffed breadsticks were very good, but the stomboli was less than desired. It was the 1st time we ordered it and we were very disappointed. It was not cheesy and seemed to be less toppings than the pizza although we ordered the same toppings as normal (supreme).

name: Gier Henderson
text: Great family atmosphere! Service was phenomenal and the food was delicious and reasonably priced.

name: Danny Evans
text: Service was excellent. Food was excellent. Had the mushroom pizza thin crust and wife had pizza scampi thick crust. Both very good. MIL had spaghetti and meat sauce very good. Came with large salad that was not eaten but taken home for lunch the next day.

name: K
text: While visiting, we wanted to try a different pizza spot besides the normal Domino's or Papa John's. Let me tell you, this place is great, from the pizza, wings and potatoe skins. I would highly recommend this place.

name: Kim M
text:
The pizza (we ordered Hawaiian, pan crust) was ok, but very soggy. There were holes in the crust, which caused the tomato sauce to leak through. That made it unappetizing from the start. But the actual flavor was good, if you could get over the soggy part.
We dined in, and when we asked for the check, the waiter (so was very nice and pleasant) let us know that their credit card terminal was down due to an AT&T outage. We (and the other 4 families dining) were given three options: wait at the restaurant until it was resolved, drive to the nearest ATM, or leave your credit card number with them. We didn't feel comfortable with the latter, and our bank has a charge for external ATMs, so we decided to wait. It was talking longer than we'd expected, and our plans started to be affected, so the "manager" came out to talk to us. She identified herself as such, but I doubt she was, because she had no managerial qualities. She didn't offer to discount even $5 for having to go through the wait or eventually having to pay ATM fees at the gas station ATM. In fact, she got defiant and said, "This is not our fault, it's AT&Ts". We were aware that this was something out of their control, but we had a family who was waiting to go to the beach, and because they have AT&T for their phone and CC services, they should've ensured their customers left happy and then resolved that with AT&T. As a manager, she should've apologized and offered something, whether it was a % off (even if small), or a gift card to return. But this "manager" did nothing but blame AT&T.
We will not return!

name: Mary Brangers
text: Best pizza on the beach!  We were staying in Orange Beach so it was a bit of a drive, but more than worth it!  We will eat here every time we come.  Great service and even greater pizza!

name: Shaun Terry
text: Shrimp alfredo was very good, large portion & served with large salad. Their ranch dressing is THE best! Casual atmosphere.

name: Jennifer Fineran
text: Frankly, I'm shocked at all the good reviews for Lillians. I would compare the pizza to Domino's on a bad day. We ordered a pizza for carry out and it was tasteless, the sausage was not fresh and there was very little cheese on the pizza. As someone else said in their review, you are better off picking up a frozen pizza from the grocery store than wasting money on this pizza. Definitely won't be back and don't recommend.

name: Therese Bivins
text: We love Lillian's. They have delicious pizza, salads and sandwiches and pasta. They have a lunch buffet during peak season. Very reasonably priced.

name: Marlo Deguzman
text:
I would give this more of a 3.6 star rating but I'll be nice because the server compensated for it.

The food was delicious, server was nice, but there were errors with their system that made our food come out approximately 40% to 60% slower than it should have. Server never let our drinks get empty, kept us informed, and even offered to box up our many leftovers himself.

name: Zebulon DucoMoore
text: Pizza is great.

name: Kim Gann
text: We eat here every time we’re at the beach. So good! Never had a bad experience. Try the taco pizza! We love you Lillian’s:)

name: Fouad Shar
text: I just want to thank the staff here including kitchen staff and everyone behind the scenes. Great job year after year. This is the most consistent place and I go all of them.

name: Courtney Justice
text: My boyfriend and I are here on vacation and we decided to try this place out so we placed a delivery order of lobster ravioli. Came with a side salad and garlic bread. It was AMAZING!! Salad was fresh, I think the best part of the salad was the croutons! And the lobster ravioli was delicious! Will definitely order from here again. Delivery was faster than the ETA which was also a plus! Thank you!

name: Richard Ward
text: Lillian's is a wonderful family restaurant. The atmosphere is great and the outdoor eating area is a hit. The prices are a little steep for some menu items, particularly the spaghetti. Service is usually very good, however we have had a couple issues in the past. All in all, great restaurant.

name: Shawn B
text: Consistency runs the roost here.  Good pizza, island pricing, young staff, quick service. Been eating here since it's original location in the 80s....or was it yhr 90s?

name: Jessica K Dugas
text: LOVELY pizza prepared perfectly! Outside dining was nice and and shady and allowed us to dine comfortably with sand on us,  being straight from the beach. The wait staff was very knowledgeable and friendly!!  Restroom was clean!

name: Laura
text: Super nice people, excellent service, and the BEST pizza!

name: Walter Fieldsa
text:
The chances melt down is good and all but it’s greesy.
I miss being able to order the club sandwich.
Or that steak and mushroom sandwich.
If it was still up I probably would still order atleast one club a day again.
PLEASE ADD THE CLUB BACK!!

name: Jody Braxton
text:
Our child was injured in Lilian Pizza a few years ago.  He received a concussion and a scar on his face that he carries to this day. A large chainsaw sculpture of an alligator, kept in the waiting area fell on him and smacked his head between it's snout and the floor. The hostess on duty at the time of the injury said the same thing had happened to other children.  He was bleeding profusely and the restaurant had NO clean towels or rags on site. They were, however, glad to sell us a T-shirt to try to stop the bleeding. We sped all the way back to Pensacola with our child screaming the entire way.  It was a very frighting time..    I personally called and spoke to the owner asking him to rectify the dangerous situation; he refused, saying the sculpture had "sentimental value" to him.  I didn't ask him to get rid of it, just to move it.  Again, he refused.   The unsecured statue is top heavy due to it's protruding snout, yet he insisted on leaving it in the waiting area where other kids could easily pull it on themselves.
Needless to say, we will not return.

name: Ashley Stuteville
text: The best pizza I've ever had! I got a 10" cheese, and the cheese was an inch thick 😍 also ordered cheese-stuffed breadsticks which were phenomenal! Recommend 200%

name: Amanda Owens
text: In the past, we've always had great food and really enjoyed our visit, but our most recent trip was very disappointing! The potato skins were barely warm and the cheese wasn't even melted and the middle of our 16" pizza was complete mush. Our server suggested it wasn't cooked long enough and offered to put it back in the oven. He did and it was slightly better but still very soft and runny. Quite disappointed with the lack of quality of control after so many good years.

name: Tom White
text: One of our most favorite spot's on The Key! if you have not been you definitely need to go!

name: Kim Moore
text: Pizza had good flavor, but traditional crust was very thick, under cooked and doughy.  Thin crust was great.  Would go back for thin crust. Service was very good.  Will take pics next time.

name: Robin Jay
text: Excellent Food and Excellent Service .  Enjoyed the visit and meal .

name: Dave V
text: Great pizza. Have eaten in the restaurant and had to-go as well. Always good. I recommend it. If you are visiting Perdido Key/Orange Beach and sick of places like the Shrimp Basket etc., check out Lillian's and you will be pleased.

name: Paul Emery
text: Me and my wife stopped here for dinner on our honeymoon after a local suggested it. We had the Margarita pizza and it was absolutely amazing. Our server was very friendly and our glasses never got below half full. If we are ever back in the area we are absolutely eating here again.

name: Samantha Allen
text: Quality of the food has declined greatly. We are long time local customers and are VERY DISAPPOINTED!  It's been brewing for quite some time now but continued to give them a chance. Called to complain about the pizza we had delivered, as the toppings we quite skimpy,even completely missing an item and somewhat over cooked and the 'remake' was even worse. The Greek salad was substandard-lots of black and brown lettuce that had to be picked out.  Although we were told that remake pizza were priority, we waited over 45 minutes. Done. Frozen pizza is a better option... at least it's less money and the quality is dependable!  Shame on you Lillian's!

name: Craig McGee
text: Best pizza we've ever had.  Great atmosphere, location, and staff was amazing. You will not be disappointed stopping here. Ask for Geoffrey!

name: Kris D
text: This is the second time I've eaten here, over a year apart. Still great and delicious!

name: Haven sheriff
text: Best pizza around! Worth the 40 minute drive from Pensacola!! And the customer service is always on point!!!

name: Larry Hughes
text: Excellent

name: Kira Hill
text: Customer service was fantastic. Everything we order was delicious!

name: Ann McFadden
text: We had a party of 9 and we all enjoyed

name: Leslie Patterson
text: Good pizza & lasagna.

name: Tim Kent
text: 3 cheese pan pizza is phenomenal . Shrimp scampi pizza(thin crust)  out of this world! Strawberry smoothie 5stars! Spicy crabmeat and black bean pizza (National award winner). House salad w/ bacon vinagrette dressing!!! Everything at this restaurant is great. Must try! Best pizza in the south!!

name: Kelsie Brink
text: Went here for the first time a couple nights ago. Incredibly laid-back atmosphere, amazing pizza, and an incredibly priced happy hour. It’s a quick walk from the public beach access. We will definitely be spending an ample amount of time here over the summer.

name: Jordan
text: Good pizza and quick delivery, but way too pricey. I’ll order again but at $30 a pie, it will probably only be once every couple months.

name: Patricia Wheeler
text:
Update Aug 2020.... As if Covid -19 isn't bad enough, my trip to Lillian Pizza today was the worse. I drove about an hour from Foley to enjoy some pizza today. Have not been out for a meal since this pandemic and social distancing started. Arrived about 1:40pm. Nobody at the restaurant at all. Great no worries about social distancing. (important to us due the fact we a disabled and medically challenged seniors). Took a minute for the server to come and seat us. Ordered right away, just a 14" large half and half pizza, nothing fancy. The server was OK, not very polite.

About 25 mins later she comes out and tells us our pizza got burnt and needs to be remade. No checking on us the whole prior 25 mins. Again , we are the only people in the restraint. 3 people in the kitchen and 2 servers on the floor. Didn't offer us anything to eat while waiting for the remake on our pizza or even a I'm sorry. She walked away with an attitude.

10 mins later she comes back by and asked if we want a salad. We said no, but that you need to take some money off our bill for having to wait for another pizza to be made. She said no. (take the salad or get nothing attitude) Another 5-10 mins, she comes back by and said, OK talked to the manager, we will take something off of your bill. And your pizza will be out in 5 mins. About 7 mins later, she brings the pizza, sets it on the table, no saying sorry again, and walks away.

Here the kicker.... The second pizza was raw, yes raw. I go find the manager, or who I think is the manager, and show her. She said we can put it back in the oven. This is against  safety or health codes, or so I thought. She said we can order another pizza, with a 25 minute wait. Or we can get some other type of food. We have been there now for about 45+ mins, no food. Told her my husband is on dialysis and need to eat that we can't wait any longer. And told her we will just leave.

You'd think after all that , the manager would understand and offer a meal on the house if we would ever like to come back and try again. Got nothing and not even a true apology.

This is how you treat people now? who come out and try and give your business  our money during the pandemic. On top of being disabled seniors. I will not be back to Lillian Pizza again unless they make some important changes. I would post zero stars if I could.

I really enjoyed the pizza here. Lillian has a pretty wide variety on their menu. I ordered the meat and a plain cheese pizza.
The wait is a bit long even when there was only a handful of other customers. Worth the wait.
Lillian Pizza has black board walls though out to keep little ones busy, or the young at heart entertained.
You can call in your order and pick it up or have it delivered.
They even have pickup stops to meet the driver if your home is out of the area. Kinda neat.
Overall enjoyed my meal.

name: Ski Gowitzke
text: Good food reasonably priced great staff

name: sagan hawkins
text: Foods always good service is ok sometimes it takes a while to take our order. The pizza and wings are good!

name: Revolutionsmyname318
text: Awesome taste, decent price range, 18" pizzas great for feeding a large crowd. Will visit again on future trips.

name: Ken Baird
text: Good food. Fair prices.

name: Michele Hill
text: Server was a bit inattentive.  Food was good as always

name: Maggie Wood
text: We got the thin crust large pizza with 3 toppings.  It was one of the best pizza's I ever had.  Crust was fresh and hand made.  Service fast and friendly.  I would eat here again.

name: Roxy :D
text: I'm a local and this is the best pizza in town! It's also a great place to stop when you get done at the beach. It's always hot and fresh, and the service is incredible!😁

name: Aaron Bell
text: Pizza and salad were both good

name: Tanner Green
text: We heard from friends it was a good place to eat when visiting Pensacola. The waitress was very nice, but the restaraunt was very pricey and was not worth the quality of the food. We also waited 30 minutes just to get our check back! And all drinks were $2.50!! Even water?? Will not return.

name: Roy Craft
text: One of our favorite places to go to in Perdido Keys, awesome pizza and nice fresh, cold and not wet salads. They have a great staff working there.

name: Jonathan N
text: Absolutely delicious pizza in the perdido, pensacola, and orange beach area. Had the pizza as my last night in town before moving, cant be beat! To top it off the delivery driver was the nicest guy I've ever met in my life. Next time I'm in Pensacola area I will be back. Restaurant itself is a great location with a really cool interior. Well done.

name: Charlie1219
text: Taco Pizza & a full service bar! Hard to beat especially off season?

name: Eric Campbell
text: Great quality pizza. A bit overpriced but great if you want to take the family out. I loved the fresh gulf shrimp as topping option.

name: Michael Barclay
text: Very good pizza but it took them close to 3hrs to make us 2 pizzas and they weren't that busy.

name: Giovanna Blanco
text: Everything was so good!

name: Greg Plante
text: Good variety. Great Pizza. Kids get to draw on the walls. Probably the best place to take a family.

name: Roy Craft
text: One of our favorite places to go to in Perdido Keys, awesome pizza and nice fresh, cold and not wet salads. They have a great staff working there.

name: Kyle C
text: Nice place to eat with a good atmosphere. Food and service was on point.

name: Bob Scidmore
text: Very good pizza. Both thon and deep dish were good. The deep isn't "really" deep.  Beer was cold and cheap during happy hour. Excellent place. Lots of families which is nice.

name: Nolan Terpstra
text: Absolute best pizza I've ever had. I'd rather eat here than be with my family because I honestly love this place more then them. I was on vacation when I went to this paradise of a restaurant, and I almost permanently extended my stay just because of this pizzeria who serves pure slices of ambrosia. I would recommend this place to absolutely anyone. Thank you Lillian's for the amazing pizza!

name: Ken Baird
text: Good food. Fair prices.

name: Logan C
text:
Very expensive. Also very slow. We ordered 4 XL pizzas at 730. We were told to expect them at about 9. We waited until 9:30 at the location to actually receive them.

The pizza itself was good, but not worth the price or wait. I would definitely recommend Pizza Hut or Dominos over this place

name: Charlie1219
text: Taco Pizza & a full service bar! Hard to beat especially off season?

name: Michele Hill
text: Server was a bit inattentive.  Food was good as always

name: Barrett Willits
text: Used to be great, now they don't even answer the phone.

name: Tori Navigator
text:
Super yummy pan style pizza pie.
We also love the spaghetti with the mushroom meat sauce. My kids love to draw on the chalkboard wall.
What a great idea and it means a lot to me to know that they care about the families who patronize them.

name: Jacob Reyes
text: I thought Jim was a great guy he deserved his four dollars. I will say the wait was a bit long but he was trying his best. Not everyone is flash and can't help but to get lost in the sauce, but the food was good not to many pizzas to pick from but the pizzas were good. The pasta was also pretty good nothing to complain of but the time it took for our check.

name: Dwight Jones
text: Great pizza and ice cold beer

name: garrett starkey
text: Not good they really don't know what a stromboli is. Greasy not good, better off going to pizza hut

name: AJ Taylor
text: Our Island Delight pizza was delicious. Not a big fan of the crust though. Sandwiches were alright for the price, stromboli leaves a little to be desired. Didn't get a fork for our potato salad.

name: Tori Navigator
text:
Super yummy pan style pizza pie.
We also love the spaghetti with the mushroom meat sauce. My kids love to draw on the chalkboard wall.
What a great idea and it means a lot to me to know that they care about the families who patronize them.

name: Cherise Norris
text: Delicious! Friendly staff, awesome food, and decent prices! We go every year on vacation.

name: Chasity Boettcher
text: The pizza was incredible.  Loved the chalkboards for kids to write on!!

name: Tiffany Severson
text: Great atmosphere, delicious pizza. The chicken bacon ranch pizza was perfect!

name: Bob Scidmore
text: Very good pizza. Both thon and deep dish were good. The deep isn't "really" deep.  Beer was cold and cheap during happy hour. Excellent place. Lots of families which is nice.

name: Glen Nagy
text: Food was good, our waitress I would give her an 8 she was outstanding

name: Nolan Terpstra
text: Absolute best pizza I've ever had. I'd rather eat here than be with my family because I honestly love this place more then them. I was on vacation when I went to this paradise of a restaurant, and I almost permanently extended my stay just because of this pizzeria who serves pure slices of ambrosia. I would recommend this place to absolutely anyone. Thank you Lillian's for the amazing pizza!

name: Talitha Robertson
text: Great food. Short wait for summertime dinner

name: Sheila Bell
text: The service was great. Caty (with a C) was our server. The shrimp scampi pizza is amazing! It's a little pricy, but worth it.

name: Karen DuPont
text: Brought our family there last week. Excellent service and great food, very good prices

name: Logan C
text:
Very expensive. Also very slow. We ordered 4 XL pizzas at 730. We were told to expect them at about 9. We waited until 9:30 at the location to actually receive them.

The pizza itself was good, but not worth the price or wait. I would definitely recommend Pizza Hut or Dominos over this place

name: Sarah James
text: Very disappointed in carryout service. Just tried calling almost 25 times to either be hung up on or saying the line is busy. Never had an experience like that anywhere else. At all.

name: William Rhodes
text: Pizza was very good- service freindly-forgot to ask for seniors discount.

name: Andy Gruse
text: Good food and good pricing.  Staff was nice and great key lime pie!  We will go back for sure.

name: Shane Gordon
text: Had the Hot Hawaiian pizza.  Great food and terrific service

name: Rob Forsgren
text: The best pizza place I have ever been to, and that includes Chicago and New York places. We come here from Texas every year. The best!!!!!

name: Brad Burns
text: Such a gem of a pizza place. Great selection of pizza toppings, and non pizza items.

name: Cindy Black
text: The best pizza I've had in the last 15 years. I go there every year when I'm at the beach.

name: Jeromy B
text: Consistent good food, good service. Been eating here for almost ten years

name: Colette Turpin
text: The food here is pretty good, but since we've been coming here the service has gone downhill.  Plus it's kinda pricey for pizza.  We paid $20 for a 12 inch pizza with four toppings of our choice.  Seems to be better in the off season.

name: Martin Jones
text:
Salad needed to be chopped up more, and variety was low.
They could have used more salad types. Also, salad dressing  bottles we're very jarge. Place in smaller bottles. Pizza was really good, however.

name: Chad New
text:
Went to Lillians last night and ordered  pizza and asked for crispy crust. What came out was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING!
The crust was not cooked so it had a doughy consistency. Brought it to the attention of our waitress who apologized and took the pizza back to the kitchen.  All they did was put the pizza back in the oven which made the edge crispy but under the toppings was again like raw dough. When the waitress tried to put the pizza in a to go box, her comment was "oh this is really bad".
Called today to give feedback to the restaurant and got nothing but push back from whoever answered the phone. He said they have been open for 30 years with no complaints.
He must not read their reviews!
Avoid this place is my advice.

name: Fred Butler
text: Great Food at a good price. Professional and Polite Staff that will Socialize and make you want to return not like the everyday Servers this is a forgotten art and now at the top of my list. Very Attentive to the Customers and Definitely Recommend you gotta try this place.

name: Matthew Kauffmann
text: Good food and inexpensive. How can you not like a place with a slice of pizza for a sign.

name: duston allison
text: I had the Stromboli and my wife had the taco pizza and they were both great!

name: Susan Steele
text: Lasagna is awesome. Pizza as well. Family friendly and moderately priced.  You can't go wrong having lunch or dinner here.

name: Scott Key
text: Excellent food, a little loosey goosey on service, but it's the beach and that maybe what they are going for.

name: Tom Morris
text: Great local pizza place with delicious sauce and crust.  Will definitely return here upon our next visit.  Very attentive wait staff.

name: Jon Williams
text: While I wasn't the biggest fan of the pizza, there lasagna is awesome!

name: Erika Barnard
text: Go see bartender Nick! He always makes sure guests have a wonderful time with delicious drinks! They have a thin mint bushwaker that is GLORIOUS! Must try!

name: Debbie Rudd
text: Always great food.  Had a short wait because they were short staffed.  Zack was our waiter.  Very pleasant and attentive to our needs, even though he had a table of at least 20 to take care of.  TN

name: Bonnie Riley
text: Pizza is amazing.  Can't go wrong here.  Service was lacking a bit, but not awful.  Great little spot.

name: Gordon Hickey
text: Best pizza in Perdido Key and Orange Beach area. Salads are great and large enough to share with two or three others.

name: José M. DelRio Sr.
text: Great atmosphere, food and service! A family favorite!

name: Tim Miller
text: Amazing pizza, worth the drive. Chalkboard walls for the kids to decorate

name: Marva McKnight
text: Below average. Service was fine. Pizza was not flavorful at all. Maybe some of the other menu items are better, but don’t expect much there.

name: Sarah H
text: Too much cheese on the pizza made the crust soggy. Overpriced! We ordered 2 small pizzas and a salad and paid nearly  $50.

name: Phillip Davis
text: Fantastic thin crust pizza. The cheese is thick and the sauce is phenomenal. Fresh ingredients. Quick and friendly service as well

name: Dwight Jones
text: Great pizza and ice cold beer

name: Sarah James
text: Very disappointed in carryout service. Just tried calling almost 25 times to either be hung up on or saying the line is busy. Never had an experience like that anywhere else. At all.

name: kristin rodriguez
text: After a 16 hour drive to our vacation rental in Perdido Key, my husband, kids, and I ordered pizza from Lillian's, as we wanted to try a local place vs. a chain. We ordered a Greek salad and 5 topping pizza online for delivery. When the total was $40, I was a little surprised, but whatever, its vacation. The food arrived earlier than anticipated, which was a plus, and our delivery man was friendly. However, almost half of the lettuce in our Greek salad was brown and slimy (so disgusting) and there was maybe 4 feta crumbles on it. The dressing had no taste, was basically just olive oil. The pizza was just ok, and quite underdone. We will definitely not recommend anyone to this restaurant.

name: Janell
text: My family loves the food here. Everything is good. But my favorite is the crab quesadillas.  My kids love the thin slice pizza. Never had any issues with customer service and the food comes quickly.

name: Jeromy B
text: Consistent good food, good service. Been eating here for almost ten years

name: Tim Miller
text: Amazing pizza, worth the drive. Chalkboard walls for the kids to decorate

name: Enemy Mammal
text: The best pizza ever go there and eat

name: Deb orah
text: I ordered a large pepperoni pizza and I don’t think it had 20 slices of pepperoni on it. There wasn’t even 2 pieces of pepperoni on each slice. Very disappointing.

name: Deborah Jerlsin
text: Pizza is average nothing more than a papa johns or pizza hit in my opinion.  Wish I would have ordered the thin crust. Because the regular crust was way too thick. I gave this place more stars because the kids could draw in the  walls.  The walls are chalkboard and it kept them occupied while we waited a while for food.

name: D B
text:
Usually good.
Visited 5/13/19 and was disappointed.
Spinach dip was watery, chip were all salt, salad stale, and pizza made poorly.
Supposed to be thin crust, wasn’t
Thats three out of three bad.
Might go back doubt it.

name: Cody Haze
text: Service was amazing as well as the food and atmosphere

name: Phillip Davis
text: Fantastic thin crust pizza. The cheese is thick and the sauce is phenomenal. Fresh ingredients. Quick and friendly service as well

name: Leonor R.
text: Cute place in a secluded area of perdido key. I'm sure it's very busy during the summer time. Ruger pizza was pretty good and service was good too. Not bad.

name: JD Hallam
text: Good food. The biggest concern is that even when tipping $5 for delivery not 5 miles from the restaurant, which is on top of their delivery fee, more than one driver seemed shorted. We like the food, but don't order as often as we would like to from here and since CitySpree started delivering from places that otherwise didn't deliver we've ordered from here even less. Mostly just when friends and family come into town and want pizza.

name: Aionic
text: High prices but very good pizza.

name: Deb orah
text: I ordered a large pepperoni pizza and I don’t think it had 20 slices of pepperoni on it. There wasn’t even 2 pieces of pepperoni on each slice. Very disappointing.

name: Erskin Hickman
text: Good pizza, great location, casual atmosphere, reasonably priced.

name: Glennff St r Wilson
text: The pizza is always very good and also the server unfortunately tonight we had to wait a looong time for the food.

name: Loyd Bowen
text: Great food and excellent service

name: Anthony Kafka
text: Great food worth the drive, only wish it were closer

name: kristin rodriguez
text: After a 16 hour drive to our vacation rental in Perdido Key, my husband, kids, and I ordered pizza from Lillian's, as we wanted to try a local place vs. a chain. We ordered a Greek salad and 5 topping pizza online for delivery. When the total was $40, I was a little surprised, but whatever, its vacation. The food arrived earlier than anticipated, which was a plus, and our delivery man was friendly. However, almost half of the lettuce in our Greek salad was brown and slimy (so disgusting) and there was maybe 4 feta crumbles on it. The dressing had no taste, was basically just olive oil. The pizza was just ok, and quite underdone. We will definitely not recommend anyone to this restaurant.

name: Jennifer Evans
text: We just finished our dinner from here and we were not disappointed! We ordered garlic cheese bread & (2) 12” thin crust pizzas to take back to our condo and everything was so good! Wait time was about 20 minutes. As far as the price, it’s comparable to a good pizza place. If you want Cici’s or Dominos quality & prices, this isn’t the place to go. We’ll definitely be back on our next trip here!

name: David Williams
text: Orange Beach Special was great!

name: Melicia Dempster
text: This is our new family trip on Sunday's we come from mobile just to eat here it's amazing. The people are very sweet and the food taste wonderful we will definitely be back for more.

name: Sarah H
text: Too much cheese on the pizza made the crust soggy. Overpriced! We ordered 2 small pizzas and a salad and paid nearly  $50.

name: Jamie Nicole
text: Amazing pizza, aslong as it is warm! Go in and sit down so you can eat it fresh! If you take it to go, might sound weird.... But it hardens and tastes gross if you wait!

name: Vendea
text: So admittedly we had a party of ten. So the waitress's annoyance was warranted, however, it felt excessive. Furthermore, the service was really slow, and the pizza was not great. If you like very greasy cheesy pizza that reminds one of Chicago deep dish style, then this is good. Otherwise, take a pass.

name: Andrew Rountree
text: Delicious buffet. Friendly staff!

name: Debra Greene
text: We loved our pizza from Lillian's! Yummy! Sitting outside in the back was comfortable, since we had just left a day at Rosamond Johnson's Beach! Great, friendly service!

name: G. W.
text:
Best Pizza we've ever had! I was skeptical at first because usually local pizza joints turn out to be disappointing. Great service and super-fast delivery! I would highly
recommend!

name: Hellon Robinson
text: I loved the pizza. Fast service,

name: Deb Morelli
text: This visit was the BEST! Our calzone and pizza was the best we had in a long time!

name: Chrisie Hawkins
text: Yummy tasty! They were 30 minutes late but it was worth the wait. Highly recommend

name: Jacie H
text: Food was delicious.   I feel that the pasta dishes are a little over priced, pizzas were priced about average.  Service was pretty good.   So pricing is the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars.

name: Daniel Raymond
text: They must have had a really bad night. Service was terrible. Horribly managed. Wait staff was unhelpful. There was more refunds given than pizzas that went out the door. So sad. Terrible experience!

name: Kim Bullock
text: Wonderul food and the BEST waitress. Ask for Nicolette !

name: Owen Robbirds
text: my server was jordan and she was absolutely amazing ! i’m going to ask for her every time now ! thank you lillian’s for such a great staff !

name: Tiffnye Koci
text: I really did not care for the pizza.  The bread app was really good though.  Sweet tea was awesome.  Server was friendly.

name: Kort Grooms
text: The staff was great and the lasagna is the best I've ever had!

name: Nancy Johnstone
text: Stromboli, spaghetti with meatballs, and bowls of good salad - Great!! For 3 of us, we got and stayed full and didn't need to eat anymore. Nice atmosphere, too.

name: Jess Rodriguez
text: Absolutely amazing ... A hidden treasure ... Can't wait to take the rest of the family

name: Brian Wilkinson
text: It wasn't a stuffed pizza as they claim. It was just a normal pizza with another crust on top. They need to learn what a real stuffed pizza is. Gotta stuff it to be a stuffed pizza.

name: Hannah Barron
text: If I could describe the perfect pizza to you, I would be describing Lillian's pizza. My grandmother lived down  near here, and every time we would visit, we made sure to come here at least once. Their pizza is the best I have ever had.

name: Brooks Buffington
text: Good food but we had to wait 2 hours to get our food. I would recommend going at a time where it's a little less busy

name: Daniel King
text: Love food. Workers VERY nice. Clean. ( get the Oreo cheese cake )

name: Robin Baker
text: Disappointed in the pizza. Believe more people like the size than the taste. Will not go back

name: Greg Jones
text: Good food and friendly team

name: Kristina Streetman DiGiovanni
text: My husbands 50th birthday is today and I wanted to have something new for dinner. I stead of me cooking. The PIZZAS ARE AMAZING!!!! Our first time eating Lillians Pizza. Just the right amount of seasoning, the right amount of toppings!! We will be back for more!!!!

name: Sydney Stewart
text: You should not have your rudest employees answering your phone. They make McDonald’s seems like they have phenomenal customer service. I Was going to order a few pizzas but the person that answered the phone was so rude i decided not to. Oh well.

name: Bruce Golson
text: We have always enjoyed the pizza.   Other family members have tried additional items and seem to have been satisfied.  It's a must do when you're at the beach.

name: Matthew Edlund
text: Incredible pizza. 10/10 would go there all the time... if I lived near Florida.

name: Kevin Wallace
text: The best pizza around.

name: nenad dedic
text: Great food, nice people.

name: Walter PHILLIPS
text: First time there and was really disappointed. Hardly any sauce on pizza, white cheese thick over toppings, and burnt around the edges. Think we will stay in Orange Beach for future pizzas.

name: Clark Sgambati
text: Was very good pizza, I'm from the northeast so I consider myself a connoisseur of pizza and they had it going on !

name: Lily Bolton
text: The pizza is SO YUMMY 😋😉 😎  I love how their walls are like  chalkboard's and we can color on it it's just some of the best  🍕 ever their just is not a word good enough to describe how good it is their and they're waitress are so funny and fun for everyone

name: Robbie Harvey Media
text: Absolutely the BEST Pizza in the Pensacola, Perdido, Gulf Shores area! I recommend the Triple Cheese pizza. Add Pepperoni to it and ENJOY!

name: Kelly Proctor
text: They had the best pizza and great service.

name: Paula Rogers
text: Great pizza, friendly staff, laid back atmosphere. One of our favorite pizza places in the area.

name: Lana Roux
text: Great food and the service is excellent and reasonable prices.  Love this place !!

name: Bailey Conte
text: This place was amazing! Great food, better service! Highly recommend.

name: Julie Bunch
text: The scampi pizza had a metallic taste and my quesadilla was soggy. They remade my quesadilla and then it was good.

name: Ryan Turner
text: Best place on perdido Key for a slice. Definitely top 2 pizza places in Pensacola area...Ozone is the other.

name: Richard Hawkins
text: Great food. Pretty much everything homemade.  I eat here twice a week minimum when vacationing.

name: Eugenio Garza
text: The service, food was great I would recommend it for anyone that's looking for good Italian dishes.

name: Fran Lecompte
text: I live in South Louisiana, but when I visit orange beach, the first place I go to eat is Lillian's!! I absolutely love it!!! Never had a bad experience there.

name: Curt Houchins
text: Really great pizza for the price.

name: Shannon Harper
text: Service was excellent and the food was delicious... Their pizza's are amazing

name: Doug N
text: Nice atmosphere and great pizza.  There are chalkboards everywhere to keep the kids occupied.  The taco pizza is a must.

name: Wanda Ellen
text: One of the best pizza I have had in a while.  Had the Veggie pizza.  Service was great and would recommend Lillian's for a great food.

name: Ariel Atwood
text: Claim to have “vegan” options on TripAdvisor but it is just their spinach and artichoke dip. Not good for families with people who have dietary restrictions (vegan diet or celiacs). No gluten free options either as TripAdvisor claims.

name: Carol Woulms
text: Loved this restaurant ! We drove from Gulf shores to Perdido Beach area to look for something different. We're all very impressed with the pizza, wings, bread sticks , the Orangesickle drink & the service

name: Alexander Reynoso
text: Excellent, Love coming to this place the best pizza around.

name: David Mann
text: Tired of seafood. This is a great place to get pizza. Friendly service and lots of room.

name: Neil Gregory
text: Great service and crust - red sauce is average - toppings good on a deliciously deep crust.

name: Tanner Jones
text: Love this pizza really good eat at this place regularly

name: Linda Bradley
text: Good pizza..friendly, helpful staff..we went there twice to eat while on vacation for a week

name: DME
text: Friendly staff and good food

name: Barry Hughes
text: Excellent every time. Recommend  taco pizza. But everything is great even salad.

name: C LM
text:
We have visited Lilian Pizza on a frequent basis and I have to say tonight was the worst experience I have had in any restaurant.  We waited 2-1/2 hours and was told several times our pizza was coming up...it was now in the oven and then finally asked what we wanted to do because they had no idea when the puzza would be out.  We were very understanding up to the point that the manager would not come speak to us and we saw 3 people standing in the kitchen on their cell phones.  Absolutely UNACCEPTABLE!!!!!
Chances are we wont go back.

name: Mark Sawyer
text:
Very polite thorough servers (Jamal) was who served us.

The Big Dave Pizza was really good.
High recommend!

name: Rayleen Sharp
text: Great place to eat! I had the lobster ravioli and it was out of this world. Good margaritas!

name: Lori Schultz
text: I'm from Chicago, born and raised.  Best pizza in the world.  Lillian's is the closest thing I've had since leaving Chicago. Thin crust of course. I live in Pensacola now and we come here every other Friday night and sit with our favorite bartender Keith.  Come early though.  It gets super busy.

name: Georgia Mcmillen
text: Service was great and the Alfredo was okay. Definitely want to try the pizza next time

name: Nickolus Patterson
text: Busy place, but worth the wait.

name: Terry Birmingham
text: best pizza on the island

name: Charles Mclemore
text: Very good service and loved the experience.  Had a great time,and will come back. Excellent service from Geoffrey bjourkland.

name: David DuChane
text: Good pizza and great service!

name: Dazzling0Stranger
text: I don't eat in Perdido much.. but when I do... I prefer Lillians

name: Debra Hollis
text: Great food & friendly staff

name: Robert Reyes
text: Wife and I were visiting from out of town on business.  Ordered thin crust pepperoni pizza and a grilled chicken sandwich.  Excellent and prompt service, great tasting food, relaxed and inviting atmosphere.  We would go here again without hesitation.

name: Jan Corbett
text: Great service.  Called in. Ready when we arrived.  Exactly what we ordered.

name: Stephen Myers
text: Great food amazing service. The stuffed pizza was the best and some of the walls are chalk boards so the kids can draw and color to give them something to do.  10/10 will come again

name: Jeremy Baier
text: Large menu selection. Service wasn't even that slow over spring break. Both the thin crust and the deep dish tasted amazing!

name: Jason Maxwell
text: Best Pizza on the Beach!  Stays packed but order ahead of time so you don't have to wait!

name: Charlie Parent
text: Wonderful no stress place for great pizza. Staff is friendly and atmosphere is beach attitude.

name: Darla Cremeans
text: I noticed that my debit card was charged twice for our dinner we had and when I callled to make them aware the owner himself never apologized and made me feel as if I was putting him out that I was asking them to correct the mistake. Initially he didn’t even want to look it up just stated that he’s worked there for years and has never seen this issue...quite defensive. He then blamed a new computer system and never once apologized. He stated he credited my card back but I had to go to my bank and have them credit it back because he did not in fact credit me back my card! I can’t even imagine how many people they have overcharged but fortunately, I caught it. This was our first experience and we loved the service and the pizza was good but unfortunately, because of the owners attitude towards me we’ll never be back. I am still in shock over this!

name: Gene Brandt
text: Great pizza good price.

name: Charlene Whetstone
text: My mom and I stopped here for pizza and found a treasure.  The best pizza we've ever had. Yum, yum. Staff was friendly and efficient. We had the 5 toppings, and as you know sometimes that can be skimpy, but not Lillians- very generous with the toppings. The pan crust isn't greasy - it's like the best bread!

name: Tina Manley
text: Amazing!! Had calzones and ended up in a Food Coma...We will for sure be back

name: Fawn Warner-Rechkemmer
text: Fun selection of pizza and other Italian fare. Friendly staff, and the chalkboard walls keep the kids busy.

name: Glenn Gaines
text: Not impressed with food, have had much better pizza.

name: Sissy Olney
text: Always great service and food!

name: Allison Touchstone
text: One of my all time favorite pizza places.  We like to call an order in when were are headed home from the beach.

name: Michael Abernathy
text: This is some of the best pizza around this area. It's close to the beach and located close to the most of the condos around this area. Its a great little family owned and run shop.

name: Dad
text: Food and service were just awesome.

name: David Lawrence
text: This is a GREAT place to eat!  Outstanding Pizza and a lot more pasta choices!  The desserts are of the devil (really good)!

name: Matt Parker
text: Best pizza I at least 1000 miles

name: ConRad 850
text: Very good i liked all the signs and chalk walls.

name: Jennifer Jordan
text: Great pizza and calzone!

name: Karl Lewis
text: Food arrived an hour after ordered. Appeared to have been ready  for a while. (Shrimp Alfredo). Condesation on plate, pasta dried out and cool. Shrimp advertised as fresh and local...mine were previously frozen...could still taste the brine they use for freezing, on the shrimp.Salad dressing (blue cheese) very thin. Probably made there. Atmosphere ok...other food ordered was above average but no "WOW" factor. Especially for the drive we took to get there. Choice of indoor or outdoor dining was a plus.

name: Snap Lab Records LLC
text: Man this place is so good

name: Wanda Kelly
text: What pizza and salad they had was very good. However, the bar was not kept full. Plus, the dishes were not available. We had to wait for that too.

name: Bryan Playford
text: Being from out of town and staying in the area, I searched for pizza online.  I looked at Lillian's online menu and placed my order.  Upon pickup, my bill was quite higher than what it should have been based on the online prices on their website.  Using my cell phone, I showed the manager LILLIAN'S ONLINE MENU and pointed out the price difference between their website and my bill.  The response was, "Sorry, what you were billed for is the correct price, go ahead and check our menu.  Our website isn't correct."  Okay, so the point is I felt pretty deceived and for a manager not to make it right on their end is not good business.  Pizza was good, but the amount of garlic was pretty overpowering.

name: kristy ramos
text: Excellent service great food

name: James
text: Fulfilling pizzas and great service

name: Richard Allen
text: Having a staff  shortage. Could not keep up with drink and food orders. Family next to us left after buffett and never received drinks. Pizza was good. Waitress thanked us for our patience Everytime she came by.

name: Douglas DeLong
text: Great pizza and price.  Server was awesome too

name: Julie Uppena
text: Best pizza I've EVER had...go, it's worth the wait!

name: Dave WH
text: Been here several times, have not been disappointed,. First time today trying the all you can eat buffet.   As always good pizza, good service.

name: Travis Youmans
text: Good Food! Good Vibes and Good staff

name: Tina Forester
text: We discovered Lillian's Pizza last year on vaca and will come back anytime we stay around here.  Excellent food!  P.S. take a jacket if you are cold natured like me...they keep it nice and chilly in there :)

name: Robin Earlin
text: We ordered take out and it was pretty good.  I wish we would have eaten in because it seemed like a great place.

name: Lauren Stone
text: The food is amazing, the service is usually not. Order to go for the best experience.

name: Ryan Collier
text: Great food. Served Hot, Close to the beach and bars. Yes, I will go back.

name: Rebecca Wilson
text: Nice stop for a quick bite after the beach. Ordered the margarita pizza and it was so tasty!

name: Beach Lovin Family
text: Ordered a large pizza.  It was good and enough for 2 people to have leftovers.  Casual atmosphere.

name: Tracy Darby
text: Best food in Perdido! They never dissapoint!

name: Mstr06Kai
text:
1. Who doesn't love pizza?
2. Smells AWESOME
3. Staff is *sllllluuuuuurrrrrpp* Noice.
4. The food.... Long story short I gained 5 lbs.

name: R Conrad
text: Pan pizza was pretty good, would have that again.

name: Jennifer Rae Fuchek (Jennifer Rae Pitts)
text:
Friendly employees with prompt courteous service, great pricing and quality of food!
The buffet is AMAZING.

name: Peggy Davis
text: Thin crust and crispy...fresh toppings (I'm having the suprene) and not greasy!!  Delish and definitely recommend!! The staff was super too!

name: william Broussard
text: Pretty decent pizza. Excellent service.

name: Mary Biknius
text: Crust was sort of soggy and didn't hold up very well. Also overpriced.

name: Jason Parth
text: Not a bad pizza place very generous on the cheese but the sauce I felt lacked a little in flavor. All in all not too bad though.

name: Matt Doughten
text:
Best pizza I've had in the area. Great waiter/bartender.
Thank you!
We'll be back!!

name: Michelle Fitzgerald
text: Ordered delivery.... 1st time ever....pizza was hot and fresh. Pan style crust was awesome! Recommend highly!

name: Rachel McQueen
text: Love this place!!!!

name: Casey Johnston
text: This is a must stop for my family everytime we come to Perdido Key.  Great waitstaff.  Awesome environment and the pizza and wings were to die for.

name: Kaderine Uy
text: The pizza here are decent. What I really enjoyed during my visit is their Fettuccini Alfredo served with Gulf Shrimp! It was a very generous serving. It went well with the Cheese Stuffed Breadsticks. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Great place to bring the whole family!

name: Brandon Biggs
text: Really good food but they want a dollar for a little cup of ranch

name: Elliott Endel
text: The pizza, atmosphere, and staff are fine, but the nachos and pasta were not good. They use cheap ingredients out of a can. Not worth the price.

name: Patty Kerr
text: We have been customers of yours for 4 years and everything has been great. However, the last 2 pizza's we ordered have been doughy and not cooked all the way. I know it's the 4th of July weekend and you are busy but DO NOT rush perfection.

name: David Sample
text: Not impressed. Nastiest public restroom ever!!!

name: Teresa Wolan-DeVito
text: My  Husband and I had lasagna and both got diarrhea real bad.  The meat must not have been good so we both got food poisoning from it

name: Brian McMilllian
text: Stopped at Lillian's on our way to Orange Beach...we were too late for the buffet, so we ordered a pizza for the adults and the kids got the kids meal pizzas...first off, let me say that I consider myself a Pizza Connoisseur if there is such a thing...and I would rate this some of the best pizza I have eaten!  We got the thin crust Dave's Meat Pizza and it had an excellent blend of cheese, meat and sauce and with a crackery thin crust with the outside crust being almost a New York style!  The kids got one thin crust and one pan pizza kids meal and they were huge...would have made a meal for most adults.  We had excellent service also...especially since it was the middle of the afternoon...would love to eat there again!

name: David S
text: OK pizza. Good service. OK prices.

name: Honcho Gaming
text: Place is delicious if you dont mind spendig a few extra bucks on a really good pizza. Service could be better though

name: Mr Gilley
text: Best pizza around. No comparison.

name: kendra_madison 06
text: My family's favorite pizza place. Best in the area!

name: Alexander M. Ulm
text: I have eaten here multiple times over multiple years and always had great experiences. Their menu is large for a typical pizza place that makes it easy for our family to eat here.

name: John P
text: Had the supreme Gross. Greasy. Loud and noisy.the toppings were cold the crust was hot

name: Bud Jones
text: Not bad pizza, little over priced

name: Ken L
text: Atmosphere and pizza

name: Mike Sanders
text: Great pizza and nice beer selection

name: Arden Ballard
text: My favorite pizza in Perdido.

name: SarahJo Griggs
text: Food was fantastic.  Service was great too.  I recommend the pizza and my daughter loved her meatball sub.

name: Sydnee Melendez
text: Honestly, it wasn't great. It was like a normal pizza. It wasn't very good but the cheese was good!! I most likely am not coming back.

name: Dave Watkins
text: Good service, fair prices and good food. We were there with about 30 in our group.They took good care of us.

name: Joe Nolan
text: We went to Lillian's Pizza on Friday night with some friends for dinner.  One part of our order was a grilled chicken caesar salad.  We asked if they could put some extra vegetables in the salad.  The waitress said yes and returned after taking our order to ask what vegetables we wanted.  When our bill arrived they had added a one dollar charge per vegetable for a total of $5 on top of the price of $8.99.  We were not informed of the additional charge at the time or ordering or we would have just stayed with the original order.  To top it all off the food was not very good.  I think this was our last trip to Lillian's.

name: Bill Eichelberger
text: In the Cincinnati area we have Dewey's Pizza when we go out for a more upscale pie.  Now we have Lillian's when we go on vacation.  This is very good pizza, a little on the expensive side, but with an impressive array of specialty pizzas and a nice list of ingredients if you're inclined to build your own.  I had a shrimp scampi pizza, my wife had a Greek pizza, my son a maximum meat and my daughter the standard pepperoni.  I got to try every one except for the Greek pizza and I'd give each one a thought if and when we go back.  Drinks were a little ridiculous at $2.50, but I can't say that it cast a shadow over the rest of the meal.  Well worth a trip if you're in Gulf Shores.

name: judith fawley
text: I ordered a large pepperoni pizza  at 7:34 PM on June 7, 2014. I was told it would take one hour to one and one-quarter hours for delivery. It was delivered within one hour, which was wonderful because we were starving. We dug in and began devouring the hot pie. Then we noticed the pie was not sliced. We thought it was because the cheese had rejoined itself, but realized it was because the dough was not cut. It was not cut because the center of the pizza had not baked completely. We were eating raw dough. Within two hours we all had stomach aches, that lasted until Monday. We were chewing Tums and taking shots of Pepto Bismal for days. This is to alert the kitchen not to rush just because a lot of orders are building up. I would have gladly waited another quarter hours for an edible pizza. The pepperoni was not cooked either. We had to throw it away.

name: Phillip Wheat
text:
Have been a customer for over 20 years.  That's right.  20 years.  Thousands spent on great pizza.

Tonight ordered the standard order online.  Did not receive the email ack but assumed it was good.  Headed to the Ono bridge as usual about 10 minutes later.  The driver is usually there at about the same time.

30 minutes goes by, no email so I call.  I am assured by whoever answered that the order went thru and I could expect a delivery in the next 10 or 15 minutes.
30 minutes later I call again.  The driver is on the way and will be there in 10 minutes.  OK cool.

20 minutes later call again.  I said "your driver must be lost" jokingly just to make sure.  Oh this time the girl on the line lit into me.  I can't recall all she said other than "we are quoting 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes" which would have been fine.  But no one quoted any time line to me.

And I got upset at being talked to like a nuisance not a customer.  Then she hung up on me.  I called back and she told me I'd never be ALLOWED to order pizza from Lillians again.  Which is perfectly fine.  Not a problem.   And this story is about to go viral on any social media outlet I can find.

Lillian's has great pizza.  Too bad the customer service sucks.  We are proud to be an ex-customer.  I suggest you try Rotolos or even Papa Johns.  Oh and their website comment form is "broken".  Guess they just don't want to know.

name: Mikel Hoot
text:
Lillian's Pizza... Where to begin? Upon first impression, I figured this might be some two-bit shack run by a mom and pop just trying to keep their heads above the water. A place that wasn't exceedingly great, but wasn't bad either.

I was wrong.

The large painted image of a cartoon fish chowing down on an equally cartoonish piece of pizza gave off the impression that this was some sort of seaside chuck-e-cheese knock-off complete with a goofy lazy-eyed fish or crab mascot dancing about the place. Fortunately, I was greeted by no such character. UNFORTUNATELY, what I was greeted with instead was an entire staff of 'Day One's ... or so it seemed. The teenage hostess was nice enough and I had no issue with her whatsoever. However, once we were seated it where this take of frustration begins...

Sitting down, our hostess informed us that our waiter would be right with us. I'm not entirely sure what 'right with you' must mean to these pizza-baking pepperoni-people, but the phrase (to me at least) means 'as soon as possible'. Four waiters in the course of some ten or so minutes walked by us and even made contact with us but not one stopped to ask if anyone had taken our drink orders. Then finally there came a young gentleman who I shall keep nameless... Lets call him 'Jim'.

Jim was very pleasant and friendly upon first encounter. He smiled and gave off a very professional vibe as he took our drink orders. After Jim went to fetch our drinks, I rose to see just what this 'buffett' was all about...

It was about a singlular olive and wilted spinach sprinkled GENEROUSLY over what I assumed was a razor-thin pizza. I've heard of thin crust, but had I breathed just a little too hard in the vicinity of the pizza, I might have blown it off the tray. Four pizzas of the same quality. This was their fabulous spread and, mind you, these were not whole pizzas. There were only a few slices left after previous customers had also had their fill of disappointment.

I should note, however, they also provided two pasta dishes which could only be described as "not terrible" and "it will make a turd". Also, there was an attempt at salad. It was a good try.

After my party and I picked at what we could stomach, it was finally time to head out. All we needed now was the check. That tiny piece of paper which would promptly be met with a few bills and a wave goodbye. However, I do often forget just how difficult of a task this truly can be as, apparently, not everyone is able to press a button and slap a few keys to make the big pretty machine go 'cha-ching!'...

Oh Jim... My sweet Jim. You were the chosen one. I trusted you.

The first ticket was brought out. Wrong. He went back to fix it. The second ticket was brought out. Wrong again. Once more, Dear Jim, went back... but this time, our server disappeared. Somewhere between the cash register and the kitchen, Jim vanished. I assume he got lost in the sauce because we sat for an additional twenty minutes. In the meantime, one of my party attempted to flag down another server to ask if he could just pay and go. The answer given was "Yeah! We... Uh...Weh! Weh! S-sommmmeone will be right with you!". He too dashed off only to be claimed by the sauce as well. Finally, Jim resurfaced and brought with him the new tickets. We slapped down our payment, gave a subtle farewell and left. I would say that there was no tip left behind, but alas, SOMEONE in our party left behind four dollars for Jim's trouble after traversing the sauce.

Let it be known, however, the spaghetti was good.

name: J T
text: So they are located at the Fort near basspro. It was a rainy day so I got pick up. Is was ready on time and still hot from the oven. I had the Milano. It was probably the best pizza I've had out here. They have a thin hand tossed crust that's chewy and just crisp enough and a really good red sauce. All the ingredients seem top quality. It's a little more expensive than chain delivery but I think still a great value for how good it is. One pizza is enough to share for 2-3 people.

resp.text: Thanks JT! Come back to see us soon!

name: Kristin Colburn
text: This was our first time eating from this restaurant. We ordered our pizzas to-go. These pizzas were amazing!!! They were so delicious and so fresh tasting! They are pricey, but you can tell the difference in the quality and taste of the pizza. It's worth the cost! We will definitely be eating from here again! I think we've found our new favorite pizza!

resp.text:
We look forward to serving you that second time soon Kristin and thanks for the awesome 5-star feedback and your business!

Andy, Johnny's Pizza Customer Care

name: Ken Karr
text: The food was really good, the music was good, and so was the service to start. Unfortunately our waitress was sent home in the middle of our meal and we wound up with one who would fill in. She was exactly that, a fill in. We have had worse service, but definitely felt forgotten after the first waitress left. Would we go back and try it again if we were to come to the area, you bet; the food was good and the service started out that way, so why not give them a second chance.

resp.text:
Hi Ken and thank you for the 4-Star rating.  We'll make sure to pass on your comments about the service interruption to the management so they may review your concerns and act accordingly - this isn’t typical and we apologize!  We do look forward to having you back again real soon as we appreciate your giving us another chance - see you next time!

Andy, Johnny's Pizza Customer Care

name: Steven Davila
text: I just moved from bklyn to columbus less than a month ago. Naturally seeing this was a great sense of joy. Unfortunately, it was not quite what i normally get back home. Crust was really soggy and the calzone seemed greasy. As a native new yorker though i am going to give it another try in the future hoping maybe it was just a bad day or slice.

resp.text:
Hi Steven and welcome to Columbus.  We thank you for your business and very important feedback.  We strive hard to serve delicious tasting, high quality food every day and therefore we're sorry to hear that our pizza crust and calzone did not meet with your satisfaction during your recent visit and for that we apologize.  This is not typical as we've been serving satisfied customers for 43 years now, which makes this more disappointing to hear. We'll be sure to pass on your comments to the management team so they may address your concerns and act accordingly.  In addition, the owner of this location will want to contact you directly to discuss your review in hopes of making things right for your next visit.   Please email us at customercare@johnnyspizza.com with your preferred method of contact (whether by phone or email) and we will be in touch promptly. Thank you for your time and we look forward to your reply.

Andy, Johnny's Pizza Customer Care

text: Look I would have cranked four stars, the food is an easy 4 stars, buy the service just needs a little work to push it there. Great food really!

Of course we're pleased that you enjoy our food but not so pleased to hear about the service issue you describe and for that we apologize.  This is definitely not typical and we'll be sure to pass on your comments to the management team so they may address your concerns and act accordingly.  In addition, the owner of this location will want to contact you directly to discuss your review in hopes of making things right and having you come back to give us another chance. name: Michelle Allen
text:
So disappointed in the quality of this place. It used to be delicious and one of our favorite places to take the kids. I’ve ordered calzones from here for over a decade, and it’s always been good.. and the last 2 years we started going to another place because the quality of the food just went downhill. My husband placed an order for pickup and brought it home. The calzone he brought home, no joke, his iPhone 11 Pro Max is larger than this calzone.
It is 6”x6”, soggy and full of grease.  NOT AT ALL the way it used to be.. and I did call to express my complaint about it, because certainly I must have gotten a childs portion or something like that and the lady I spoke with had an attitude and was not very nice at all.
It’s just such a shame how this place had gone downhill.

resp.text:

text: I had the worst experience today at Johnny’s Pizza. There was only one other customer besides us in the restaurant and we had to wait 20 minutes to get drinks. We placed our order and the cook Kota forgot to put in one of our calzones and they told us it would be another 7 minutes but we could cut the one of the calzones in half and share it so we didn’t have to wait and eat. They were not busy at all and everyone was just standing around chatting and didn’t seem concerned that the place was dirty or that they felt bad we were still waiting on food. I’m very disappointed as I eat here often and even the one in West Point GA. This was just pure laziness and lack of respect in customer service.

name: Aaron
text: I always enjoy lunch, & often call in orders to take out. The orders are usually ready within 15 minutes. I do realize they close at 10 pm on Saturday nights. I called at 9:30 to place an order to pick up. They said they do not take call in orders 30 minutes before they close. That was about a $40 to $45 loss, which I'm sure it would have been ready before 10pm, & I live 5 minutes from them. I just think that is bad business, & if I was the owner of that business I would have been upset. I thought the customer always came first, apparently not here. It needs to be posted on their website that they do not take call in orders 30 minutes before they close. What's the difference in calling in an order at 9:30, or going inside at 9:30 & sitting done & ordering?  That's just my opinion, & yes I wanted some food from there!

We live about 20 min away. The manager was nice when I called and offered to make us another but I’m not really gonna drive 40min round trip for their screw up. And kind of ridiculous to ask me to. We are new to this area and this was our first experience with Johnnys. Needless to say it will be our last and we won’t be recommending it to anyone.   I’m trying to add pics but can’t seem to figure it out. But the pizza was doubled over on its self and when pulled back the toppings came off. That was half of one side of the 12”.

name: Robert Lake
text:
First you must know this place is a chain restaurant! They want you to think you are getting an authentic New York Pizza! I am originally from New York and the experience is a insult to being a New Yorker and being an Italian American to the Yankee pictures on the wall.

The food was far from authentic and the only thing I can say was good were the garlic knots.
I tasted my wife's lasagna and it was awful. The cook needs to go back for more training but I'm sure they are for from being classically trained at a place like this. Not one person looked Italian anyway.

Service was another story our table wasn't very clean but the waitress cleaned it better and apologized for it not being cleaner. They were busy at the time. My guess is there is no other "real Italian " place here. I do wish we went to carabbas where we went a few days prior. She was not very attentive and she blamed the cook for getting one of our orders wrong.

I do Not recommend this place at all. Go to Atlanta if you want the closest New York pizza experience!

Thank you

Hello Kameal and thank you for your very important feedback.  We have been serving satisfied customers for over 10 years now and currently enjoy a 4.5 out of 5 positive rating on Google (Over 400 reviews) which makes reading your review very disappointing.  We take your comments very seriously and want to learn more about your experience.   We do apologize that an employee would make you feel this way as this is not typical nor acceptable.  We really need to know more specifics about what happened and we'll be sure to pass on your comments immediately to the management team so they may address your concerns and act accordingly.  In addition, the owner of this location will want to speak to you directly to discuss your review in hopes of learning more as well.  Please email us at customercare@johnnyspizza.com with your preferred method of contact (whether by phone or email) and we will be in touch promptly. Thank you for your time and we look forward to your reply.

Andy, Johnny's Customer Service Team
customercare@johnnyspizza.com

name: Kevin Pughsley
text: Placed my order for my son's birthday for lunch 35 minutes estimated for delivery.  I am tracking the order and it finally shows out for delivery and 15 minutes until delivery.  I watch the driver then go the opposite direction from our house and delivery somewhere else which took 15 minutes.  Our delivery then delayed to 20 minutes.  An hour after I placed my order we got our food.  I called after seeing the driver go in a different direction and talked to the store manager.  First she checked on my order and said it is only 15 minutes behind and they are on their way.  I explained that the driver went opposite of our house and that the delivery estimated time had increased double the expected time.  She explained they were understaffed only two drivers but that the order was on the way to our house so they took two orders at once.  With the tracker app, I was able to see the driver delivery the other order in the opposite direction before turning around and driving with two blocks of Papa John's to deliver to our house which was the opposite direction.  When I told the store manager that she argued with me and raised her voice.  It wasn't until I asked her not to yell at me that she toned down some but went back to complaining she had too many orders not enough driver's and I would have to deal with it.  I explained to her that by the time order would arrive it be an hour and almost double what I was promised and since the delivery person dropped off some where else first my pizza would not be hot which is was.  I expressed that the driver could have swung back in two blocks away on the way to my house and picked up my order and the pizza would have been hot and delivery time would be accurate.  She didn't want to hear it and told me she didn't have time to talk to me because she had orders, pizza, and stuff to do all while raising her voice again at me.  Poor customer service and I plan on calling the general manager Kirsten Fowler tomorrow.   Beware buying from here because they will deliver multiple orders in different directions and not give an accurate time of delivery along with poor leadership from the manager.

name: Tim Wallace
text: Staff was friendly and pizza good.

name: Raptor Jesus
text: Sorriest excuse of a pizza joint I’ve ever encountered. Gives Papa Johns everywhere a bad name. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and appetizer. Both were raw, cold, & disgusting. We went to exchange for something actually edible and the woman working the front counter gave us the biggest attitude. On top of that she would pull down her face covering completely to talk, spitting her ungodly venom directly at me. She saw how raw the food was but spoke to me in the rudest way possible making it known that I was inconveniencing her. Sorry I refuse to eat raw food lady! Anyway she finally decided to remake the food fully cooked. Overall it was the deceased costumer service that sealed the one star for me. Will stick to Dominos from now on where my business is wanted and the pizzas are better.

name: American Patriot
text: Average at best. If you're looking for good pizza call Marco's.

name: myrobotface
text: Did not get everything I paid for with our delivery order. Called and spoke to manager, who said he would turn driver around with the rest of our order. Over 15 minutes later (they are about 4 minutes driving time away) no show. Called again, manager said driver had a lot more orders and wasn’t sure when he’d be by. Manager said he’d give us a free pizza on our account for our next order. Never did. Don’t tell me you’ll compensate our inconvenience without actually doing so. Very disappointed in your lack of integrity. The rest of order and driver were great and driver was tipped well. Contact me and follow through with your commitment and I’ll update the review.

name: Jaiden C
text: Last week was our first time in this good restaurant. But It is obviously not the last time. We had a good time with the attentive service, with the high quality  cuisine and fine drinks and with the honest price. We will absolutely come back soon.

name: Nicole05
text: Worst Papa John’s in the whole country!!! So disrespectful!!!! Don’t value their customers. They don’t only deliver your order wrong they put you on hold on the phone without even letting you speak. As if it wasn’t enough I remained on hold until I arrived to the store with the wrong pizza. They didn’t showed any empathy whatsoever. At least I got my money back. Do you a favor and go to another place where they value their customers.

name: Blackpantha XP
text:
I work exactly 7 mins down the street at a commercial business & was on hold for OVER 20 mins & called at 12:00pm. Since I work for the company as well I was goin to get myself & several employees were interested but we cant go past our lunch break so from 12pm to 12:22pm I stayed on hold until I dialed the number again. On my second line & was put on hold then my other line finally answered. This is just past ridiculous because when I asked for the supervisors name instantly she asks if I want to talk to them but how do you have time for talking now but none the while 20 mins we waited & couldn't order because there is no way the food would be delivered on time.
Bad service

name: Evelyn Conwell
text: Well we live at my Father's......He always tells the delivery guy or girl we didn't order a pizza and to leave......but we did order a pizza and want the pizza. Luckily for us they still come to our house all the time and we get great service.......lololololol Thanks and thank you Papa John's we love the pizza and ya'lls service.......xoxoxoxoxo

name: Jeanetta
text: Always a pleasant experience. I even locked my keys in my car this time. They were very friendly and accommodating. The food was right on time and good as always.

name: Sandra P
text: This happened last Friday, 3 days ago, and I am still livid. Tyler, worlds worst pie store manager, with his nasty attitude and unprofessional work appearance was managing when we placed our order that was taken incorrectly. We ordered a 2liter Pepsi and they sent a Dr. Pepper.  We called and asked for an exchange. Tyler said he would send the driver. 1.5 hours later, no soda. I called again and Tyler said I was lying and no soda would be delivered. I asked his name, he wouldn’t give it. I got in my car with the food that was delivered cold that we didn’t even mention and the Dr Pepper. Took it to Tyler’s location and asked for the corporate or franchisee information. He refused to give either. I asked for a refund which he promptly processed and walked away. Rude, disgusting attitudes and behaviors like his are what prompted this review. Best part...he did not give a rats ashtray...he knew I was recording and still acted like a McDonalds employee on their last day. I also called the Vestavia store before getting in the car to get the managers name. When I told the manager what I wanted, he put me on hold never to return. I called back 5-6 times and each time they immediately placed me on hold. Papa Johns is a once good product that has since become inferior in quality, customer service and value. We only order it when our guests request it, but we will not any more. My money is better served dropping it in a homeless persons donation cup in lieu of patronizing this pizza chain. Do not order from this location. Plus, pizza maker back there slinging his asymmetric long hair all around while making pizza. Would you like hair with that pie?

text: Great pizza... Guy who answers the phone (Josh) is kind of contemptuous at times, but I still come back. Lol

Went over on break looking for order. Doesn't help I'm pregnant and starving and Jimmy could've cared less. Not an apology issued and he actually was disgusting rude. Definitely contacting corporate. Last time I purchased from them their was hair in my food and I had to be refunded so I shouldn't never given them my business again anyway. STAY AWAY!!! Better places to eat in Pelham.
